Title: Senior Specialist - Data Scientist
Description:
Job Description

We’re looking for a passionate and talented Data Scientist to join our team. In this role, you’ll have the chance to roll up your sleeves and apply data science methods and analytics to real-world business situations across a variety of topics.







Activities

Apply data workflow tasks as extraction, mining, preparation, quality control, KPI optimization, modelling, validation and business insight consideration.
Apply advanced analytics techniques in a big data paradigm considering multiple data sources
Develop and deploy machine/deep learning models applied to cross-functional use cases to increase customer value or operational efficiency.







Preferred Qualifications

A Master’s Degree in a highly quantitative field (Statistics, Computer Science, Machine Learning, Data Science, etc.) or equivalent experience
3+ years of industry experience in predictive modeling, data science and analysis
Fluent in data wrangling and preparation: exploratory analysis, profiling & cleansing, feature selection, feature engineering, segmentation, clustering and PCA
Strong working knowledge on programming languages as Python, SQL, R, data science libraries (Pandas, Scikit-learn, XGBoost) and MLOps tools (Git, Airflow, Kubernetes)
Experience using ML/DP libraries, such as scikit-learn, caret, mlr, mllib, Keras, TensorFlow, PyTorch
Experience with cloud resources, usage of IDE (PyCharm, visualbasic) and version control systems (git) are highly valued
Experience working with GPUs to develop models
Preferred experience with Natural Language and Cognitive applications
Demonstrable track record of dealing well with ambiguity, prioritizing needs, and delivering results in a dynamic environment
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Fluent in Italian and English
Familiarity with digital marketing or advertising is a plus
Show more
HTML:
Job Description

We’re looking for a passionate and talented Data Scientist to join our team. In this role, you’ll have the chance to roll up your sleeves and apply data science methods and analytics to real-world business situations across a variety of topics.



Activities

  • Apply data workflow tasks as extraction, mining, preparation, quality control, KPI optimization, modelling, validation and business insight consideration.
  • Apply advanced analytics techniques in a big data paradigm considering multiple data sources
  • Develop and deploy machine/deep learning models applied to cross-functional use cases to increase customer value or operational efficiency.



Preferred Qualifications

  • A Master’s Degree in a highly quantitative field (Statistics, Computer Science, Machine Learning, Data Science, etc.) or equivalent experience
  • 3+ years of industry experience in predictive modeling, data science and analysis
  • Fluent in data wrangling and preparation: exploratory analysis, profiling & cleansing, feature selection, feature engineering, segmentation, clustering and PCA
  • Strong working knowledge on programming languages as Python, SQL, R, data science libraries (Pandas, Scikit-learn, XGBoost) and MLOps tools (Git, Airflow, Kubernetes)
  • Experience using ML/DP libraries, such as scikit-learn, caret, mlr, mllib, Keras, TensorFlow, PyTorch
  • Experience with cloud resources, usage of IDE (PyCharm, visualbasic) and version control systems (git) are highly valued
  • Experience working with GPUs to develop models
  • Preferred experience with Natural Language and Cognitive applications
  • Demonstrable track record of dealing well with ambiguity, prioritizing needs, and delivering results in a dynamic environment
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Fluent in Italian and English
  • Familiarity with digital marketing or advertising is a plus

Title: Junior Data Scientist
Description:
A.B.S. è alla ricerca di un Junior Data Scientist per ampliare il team di Milano!

Sei la persona giusta? Leggi l’annuncio e aiutaci a conoscerti inviandoci il tuo curriculum.

Il contesto di cui farai parte

A.B.S. (Advanced Business Solutions), nata nel gennaio 2000, si propone al mercato come uno dei più importanti partner di qualità per le grandi aziende in ambito ERP Oracle.

Partener Oracle da sempre, A.B.S. accompagna le aziende nella loro trasformazione digitale e su sviluppi web innovativi gestiti in logica agile.

È recentemente entrata in Altea Federation portando in dote il suo expertise sul mondo Oracle e sull’intero ciclo di vita dello sviluppo del software a livello enterprise.

3 cose che devi sapere in 3 hashtag

#DataEngineeringDataScience

L’attività prevede lo studio e lo sviluppo di soluzioni legati al data science e al data engineering, partendo dalle pipeline dei dati fino ai servizi di reportistica. Il lavoro è in modalità ibrida. Come membro del Team Solutions, avrai l’opportunità e la responsabilità di formarti sullo sviluppo in cloud, sul data science e il data engineering, lavorare su progetti nell’ambito del data engineering e il data science, partecipare allo sviluppo interno del team data science con idee e poc.

#Holonicmantra

La nostra company fa parte del Gruppo Altea Federation. Diventerai un A-People e svolgerai la tua attività a contatto con le altre FedCo. Ti confronterai con professionisti di diversi ambiti e condividerai con loro progetti ed esperienze professionali.

Se cerchi un ambiente dinamico e in continuo becoming… here we are 😊

#Human

Altea Federation è una realtà aziendale Covey compliant, Secondo Stephen Covey, uno dei più importanti studiosi a livello mondiale delle tematiche dell’efficacia e della crescita personale, sono 7 le abitudini (#7 Habits) che distinguono le persone altamente efficaci.

In altre parole, assertività, empatia, team working, capacità di costruire relazioni. Gestirai situazioni complesse e ti interfaccerai con molteplici attori.

Le tue abilità relazionali faranno la differenza nel raggiungimento degli obiettivi.

Sei La Persona Che Fa Per Noi Se


Hai una Laurea in discipline scientifiche
Hai un mindset digitale, un forte orientamento all’innovazione e un approccio consulenziale
Hai conoscenza ed esperienza formativa in almeno un linguaggio di programmazione (preferibilmente Python)
Interesse nell’ambito dati e machine learning
Hai una conoscenza di base di database relazionali e SQL
Hai una conoscenza di concetti base di machine learning e calcolo distribuito
Hai un’ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese (scritta e parlata)


AlteaFederation Sostiene Ed Incoraggia Le Differenze, a Vantaggio Della Nostra Comunità Di A-people e Di Tutte Le Company Della Federation. Siamo Orgogliosamente Per La Non Discriminazione e Per Le Pari Opportunità e Crediamo Nel Rispetto Di Tutte Le Leggi Applicabili In Materia. Se Hai Una Disabilità o Una Necessità Speciale, Non Esitare a Candidarti, per noi ogni differenza è una ricchezza!

Entra nella nostra squadra e scrivi la tua storia in Altea Federation!
Show more

Title: Data Scientist II (Remote)
HTML:
Agile Lab is a company founded in 2014 with the mission to create value for its customers in data-intensive environments through customisable solutions that establish performance-driven processes, sustainable architectures and automated platforms based on data governance best practices. Having delivered over 100 successful Elite Data Engineering initiatives, we have used this experience to create Witboost: a modular, technology-agnostic platform that enables modern organisations to discover, value and produce their data in both traditional environments and fully compliant Data Mesh architectures.

With a highly skilled team of over 130 data engineers based in Europe, Agile Lab helps organisations with their data-driven transformation.

Take a look at our Handbook to discover our core values and processes.

💰RAL: € 38.5K - 48.5K

💼The Opportunity

We are seeking a skilled Data Scientist II to join our team: you should have in-depth knowledge of statistics, classical machine learning. Experience with timeseries analysis is required. Familiarity with MLOps practices and collaborative software development workflows is considered a plus.

💻Responsibilities

  • Analyzes business requirements and determines a suitable solution autonomously, evaluating if an ML-based solution is feasible;
  • Good understanding of business requirements;
  • Develops and fine-tunes models through reproducible experiments;
  • Builds ML solutions incorporating software engineering quality standards (SDLC) and data engineering best practices;
  • Participates in the technical design of features with guidance;
  • Understands and optimizes and monitors model performances;
  • Prioritizes tasks with autonomy based on requirements and proper context.

🛠️Requirements

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Engineering or Computer Science;
  • Previous experience as a Data Scientist or Machine Learning Engineer (+2years);
  • In-depth knowledge of at least one machine learning framework such as Tensorflow, PyTorch or scikit-learn;
  • Good Knowledge of programming languages including advanced Python patterns;
  • Familiarity with software lifecycle practices (testing, release, deploy) and git-based workflows;
  • Knowledge of MLOps practices;
  • Ability to explain ML results and limitations to tech and non-technical audiences;
  • Good project management skills;
  • Good communication skill;
  • Languages: both Italian and English;
  • Team Player.

🙌🏻We Offer

  • Remote or smart working and work life balance;
  • Training monthly budget;
  • A structured career path with clear expectations and salary for each level;
  • Benefits and corporate welfare programs: meal vouchers, health fund provided, prizes, welcome pack with all the equipment you need to work;
  • Agile Nomads experience: opportunity to work for 2 weeks abroad;
  • The opportunity to attend one conference per year;
  • Inclusive environment where you can be who you really are;
  • Stimulating environment oriented to growth, both professional and personal.

😊How We Work

  • We don't like hierarchies: we work as a team;
  • We don't like bureaucracies; we prefer sense of responsibility;
  • We like data, certainly, so anything that is measurable;
  • We want to make a positive change in our industry;
  • Empathy, humility, collaboration, and willingness to challenge ourselves are the basis of our work.

This position is open to all candidates, regardless of gender, and we strongly encourage applications from both male and female candidates pursuant to Art. 27 of Legislative Decree no. 198/2006, as well as those who identify themselves as non-binary or of any other kind. We are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Saipem is a global leader in the engineering and construction of major projects for the energy and infrastructure sectors, both offshore and onshore. Saipem is “One Company” organized into five business lines - Asset Based Services, Energy Carriers, Offshore Wind, Sustainable Infrastructures, Robotics & Industrialized Solutions. The company has 8 fabrication yards and an offshore fleet of 29 construction vessels (of which 26 owned and 3 owned by third parties and managed by Saipem) and 15 drilling rigs, of which 8 owned. Always oriented towards technological innovation, the company’s purpose is “Engineering for a sustainable future”. As such Saipem is committed to supporting its clients on the energy transition pathway towards Net Zero, with increasingly digital means, technologies and processes geared for environmental sustainability. Listed on the Milan Stock Exchange, it is present in more than 50 countries around the world and employs about 30,000 people of over 120 nationalities.

Always committed to promoting and supporting the values of diversity and inclusion, Saipem confirms its commitment to valuing differences as a source of mutual enrichment. To this end, it promotes and encourages conditions that allow the removal of every obstacle that limits the full expression of people and their complete development within the organization. It protects and guarantees work conditions that respect individual dignity, while promoting a collaborative, harmonious, fair and supportive work environment.

The resource will be part of the important transformation program that involves all Saipem Group and plays a key role in ensuring Digital Transformation projects meet objectives and she/he will govern the data management architectures and the related technology authority methodologies.

The resource will contribute on transformation initiatives related to existing technologies, focusing also on new project digital imprinting leveraging on new technology introduction to meet project requirements.

The Person Will Focus On These Areas


Responsible for designing and evolving of Data Technologies and Data Architecture for the Group.
Identification and selection of new solutions offered by the major Technology Providers.
Ensure that applications and data related services during their evolution are sustainable, maintainable and efficient.
Guide and develop the Data Governance processes and environments, contributing to the definition of the technological and procedural guidelines for the Group.
Guide and develop Machine Learning environment and initiatives.
Design and maintain the lifecycle of data integration and data virtualization tools and services.
Manage project initiatives and govern their delivery.
Support and improve the internal data platform and data ops tools leveraging the new paradigms of data mesh and data fabric.
Ensure that information security risks are properly identified, assessed and managed.



From a Technical Point Of View, Required Knowledges Are


In-depth knowledge of Cloud data platforms and related catalogue offers for the ‘end to end’ design of the data Enterprise architecture.
Excellent knowledge of Informatica, Cloudera and Denodo.
Knowledge of Microsoft Azure environment.
Knowledge of IoT platform and Edge applications will be considered a plus.
Knowledge of cloud computing and the specific features of IaaS, PaaS and SaaS services.
Good knowledge of the Dev & Ops and IAC paradigms and management/evolution of CI / CD pipelines.
Familiarity with relevant data tools and technologies is beneficial. This may include experience with databases (e.g., Sql-and NoSql based databases), data visualization tools (e.g., Qlik, PowerBI), and data analysis platforms (e.g., Pandas, NumPy, TensorFlow).
Knowledge of programming languages commonly used in data analysis, such as Python, R, or SQL, is highly desirable. Understanding how to write efficient code and work with data-related libraries and frameworks can significantly help.



Competencies / Experience Are


At least 5 years of experience in data management teams, technology system integration or Vendor player and 5 years’ experience in the technology transformation journey and Cloud technologies.
A degree in a relevant field such as Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related discipline is mandatory together with a strong foundation in STEM subjects.
Experience of working on large-scale software projects.
Fluency in English.
Good communication skills, flexible and adaptable, collaborative, enthusiastic with a high level of energy, self–motivation, resilience, drive and initiative.
Availability to possible business trips.
Proficiency in analytical thinking and problem-solving is crucial. This includes the ability to collect, clean, analyze, and interpret data effectively. Familiarity with statistical concepts and methods, as well as experience with data manipulation and visualization, would be advantageous.
Show more

  • Experience of working on large-scale software projects.
  • Fluency in English.
  • Good communication skills, flexible and adaptable, collaborative, enthusiastic with a high level of energy, self–motivation, resilience, drive and initiative.
  • Availability to possible business trips.
  • Proficiency in analytical thinking and problem-solving is crucial. This includes the ability to collect, clean, analyze, and interpret data effectively. Familiarity with statistical concepts and methods, as well as experience with data manipulation and visualization, would be advantageous.

Title: AI & ML Engineer
Description:
Amplifon is an Italian multinational company and the global leader in hearing care solutions and services for retail expertise, customization, and consumer care. More than 20,300 professionals every day in a network more than 9,700 points of sale across 26 countries, give back the joy of hearing, feeling, and living to thousands of people across the world.

At Amplifon we believe people are the most important component of our success. Thanks to our best-in-class Hearing Care Professionals and front and back-office Teams, we are able to put the everyday taps, pops and splashes back into the lives of our customers. We believe that it’s only through strong investment in talent engagement, continuous professional development, support, and recognition that our people can exceed every limit and build a fulfilling career.

About the Role:

As an AI/Machine Learning Engineer, you will play a crucial role in developing and deploying AI solutions on our target AI platform. You will work closely with other team members to contribute to the evolution of our AI platform, define the best practices for AI development, and deliver impactful AI-driven solutions.

Responsibilities:


Design, develop, and deploy AI solutions.
Contribute to the development and maintenance of our AI platform, including infrastructure and tooling.
Experiment with and evaluate different machine learning algorithms and techniques to solve specific business problems.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into technical solutions.
Follow best practices for AI development, including model versioning, data management, and code documentation.
Contribute to the definition and implementation of AI development best practices within the team.
Participate in code reviews and knowledge sharing sessions.
Stay up to date with the latest advancements in AI/ML and related technologies.
Deploy and monitor AI models in production, ensuring performance and reliability.
Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to AI models and infrastructure.


Qualifications:


Master's degree in a scientific or engineering domain (e.g., Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Statistics, etc.).
Minimum of 3 years of hands-on experience in AI/Machine Learning engineering.
Proven experience with the Google Cloud Platform (GCP) suite, specifically Vertex AI, Storage, BigQuery, Cloud Functions, Cloud Scheduler, Cloud Composer.
Demonstrated experience in deploying AI use cases to production or significant experience in experimentation and model development lifecycle.
Strong programming skills in Python.
Experience with LangChain.
Solid understanding of machine learning concepts and algorithms.
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
Strong communication and collaboration skills.
Ability to work effectively in a global team environment.   


Bonus Points:


Experience with deep learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Experience with MLOps tools and practices.
Experience with Dataiku
Google Cloud certifications
Familiarity with other cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure).


Amplifon is working on boosting a Winning Culture that will lead our employees towards the future, starting from the improvement of our Winning Workplace. Aligned to this goal, we offer a hybrid working policy, allowing employees to work 9 days/month remotely.

Title: Marketing Data Scientist (FTC - 1 Year)
Description:
YOOX NET-A-PORTER GROUP is the world leader in online luxury and fashion which comprises a complete luxury retail ecosystem. The Group sells directly to customers globally through its own family of multi-brand online shops NET-A-PORTER, MR PORTER, YOOX and THE OUTNET. The Group’s Online Flagship Stores Division partners with many leading luxury brands to power their own e-commerce destinations.  

 

The Group has 4.3 million high-spending active customers globally. As pioneers in bringing together the realms of technology and luxury, YOOX NET-A-PORTER satisfies the most discerning clientele with expertly curated products from the world’s most coveted brands, personalized end-to-end service, the latest technology, and inspiring content, all shaped by 20 years of insights into the modern shopper. 

 

As a global Centre of Excellence, our Digital Marketing Department is aimed to further develop our digital capabilities and create synergies across the business, as well as responsible for driving customer growth encompassing all Digital Marketing actions at the service of our stores. 

Our Digital Marketing Division are now seeking a strong, creative and analytical  Marketing Data Scientist to join the Marketing Innovation team.

Some of the essentials for you to know are:

Location: our offices in Milan, Italy

Reporting into: Head of Marketing Innovation

Team Size: 6 resources

Contract type: Fixed Term (12-months)

Working Model: Hybrid

Here is a breakdown of what you’ll be doing:



As a Data Scientist at YOOX NET-A-PORTER Group you will be tackling a wide variety of data challenges including product recommendation, customer value and propensity modelling, and customer and product segmentation.
Work with stakeholders throughout the business to encourage a data-driven approach through the delivery of automated data products and accessible, actionable insight.
Identify opportunities to improve the efficiency of the Data Science team through improved work practices and the development of data assets.
Partner with technology teams to develop the right data, toolsets & platform to enable the benefits of the team’s work to be realised by the business.



The type of person we are looking for:



Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Engineering, Statistics, or related field.
Good knowledge and experience of Python, Spark and SQL.
Strong foundation in key topics of statistics including sample selection, probability, hypothesis testing and linear regression.
Strong understanding of key machine learning algorithms including logistic regression, decision trees, random forests, k-means clustering.
Proven track record of applying machine learning algorithms to solve commercial problems.
A clear focus on the development of actionable insight.
Ability to work proactively to solve loosely defined problems.
Comfortable communicating with a non-technical audience.
Fluency both in Italian and English



From the moment you join the YOOX NET-A-PORTER GROUP we are committed to making your journey with us inspirational and evolutionary. If you are passionate, committed and thrive in a collaborative and fast-paced environment, then please apply with a CV.

YOOX NET-A-PORTER GROUP is an equal opportunities employer, we encourage people with a diverse range of backgrounds to apply. We recognize and celebrate the benefits that diversity brings to our workplace, our business and our customers. We welcome and will consider all applications regardless of race and nationality, religion, color, sex, pregnancy or related medical conditions, parental status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as an individual with a disability, or any other legally protected characteristics.

If you require any reasonable adjustments to complete your application, please do not hesitate to advise us accordingly.

Experience Level: Entry level

Workplace Type: Hybrid

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
MotorK is the leading sales and marketing technology company in Europe, specialized in the automotive sector. At MotorK our mission is to empower manufacturers and dealerships to sell more with innovative, cloud-based products and services to offer the best digital customer experience.

We are on a fast and ambitious trajectory and serving 90% of the automotive manufacturers. To continue our growth, we are hiring new talents. If you want to spark the future of the automotive world, join us.





About the Role

As a Machine Learning Engineer at MotorK, you will be pivotal in driving innovation and improving customer experience. You will develop and deploy machine learning models to power automotive maintenance prediction, product classification, and marketing asset generation. Your work will directly impact the company's revenue, customer satisfaction, and overall business success.




What You'll Do

Design, develop, and train machine learning models, including recommendation systems, predictive analytics, and classification algorithms.
Collaborate with data engineers to extract, clean, and transform large datasets from various sources.
Deploy models into production environments, ensuring scalability and reliability.
Conduct A/B testing and other experiments to evaluate the impact of machine learning models on key metrics.
Work closely with product managers and software engineers to translate business requirements into technical solutions.
Provide technical guidance and mentorship to junior ML engineers on best practices and business-oriented problem-solving.



Requirements


5+ years experience as a machine learning engineer or data scientist in a digital product environment
Strong foundation in machine learning, including deep learning and statistical modelling.
Proficiency in Python and relevant ML libraries (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, or XGBoost).
Experience with cloud platforms and MLOps, preferably AWS.
Ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Passion for data-driven innovation and a desire to make a significant impact.



Benefits



Working pattern and location

40 hours per week, permanent contract 
Monday - Friday
Hybrid role




Benefits

Meal Vouchers (€7 per working day)
26 days holidays + national bank holidays 
Individual training paths
Opportunity to develop and move within the company
National and international mobility options 
Yearly team activities
Food canteen at the office




MotorK is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any kind. Our company is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at MotorK are based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications, without regard to race, colour, religion or belief, age, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate.

Title: DATA SCIENTIST
Description:
Chi cerchiamo

Per la nostra sede di Milano siamo alla ricerca di una persona da inserire come Data Scientist all’interno della struttura Group Data Office. La struttura ha tra le principali responsabilità quella di supportare a livello di Gruppo l’individuazione di utilizzi dei dati per estrarne il maggior valore possibile e supportare le unità locali nel Business nello sviluppo di use cases, nella realizzazione e nel miglioramento delle soluzioni di Advanced Analytics, anche promuovendo la diffusione di best-practice, standard e know-how.

Per quale società

A2A S.p.A.

Ti occuperai di


Esplorazione e analisi di elevate moli di dati al fine di supportare l’elaborazione delle soluzioni di Advanced Analytics
Applicazione di tecniche statistiche avanzate, machine learning supervisionato e non supervisionato, Deep Learning, Data Mining (analisi time series, alberi decisionali, algoritmi di clusterizzazione come K-mean, random forest, reti neurali…) e tecniche di Intelligenza Artificiale Generativa
Collaborazione attiva con il team per supportare e implementare la messa in produzione dei progetti
Partecipazione proattiva all’innovazione e all’ottimizzazione dei processi aziendali


Sei la persona giusta se ti riconosci in questo profilo


Laurea Magistrale in Data Science, Statistica, Matematica, Fisica, Ingegneria, Informatica
Esperienza di almeno 2 anni in ambito di tecniche di Advanced Analytics, modellazione e analisi statistica di elevate moli di dati
Consolidata esperienza nella gestione di database e data warehouse su larga scala (SQL/NoSQL), e l’utilizzo di tecnologie Big Data (Spark, ...)
Conoscenza avanzata di Python e delle librerie di Machine Learning
Conoscenza dei Cloud Provider Google (GCP), Amazon (AWS) e Microsoft (Azure)
Rappresenta un requisito fondamentale pregressa esperienza in data visualization: Microsoft Power BI, Django, Flask, Dash, Shiny
Rappresenta un requisito fondamentale esperienza o conoscenza di tecniche avanzate di Machine Learning supervisionato e non supervisionato, Deep Learning, Data Mining e Generative AI
Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese
Completano il profilo: forte orientamento al team working e capacità di interfacciarsi con interlocutori a diversi livelli, pensiero critico e capacità di problem solving, attitudine a lavorare in un ambiente dinamico, collaborativo con organizzazione agile (startuplike)


Che cosa offriamo


Flessibilità: settimana lavorativa con venerdì a orario ridotto; flessibilità negli orari di entrata/uscita e pausa pranzo; 60% di smartworking su base bimestrale
Buoni pasto elettronici
Salute e benessere: assistenza sanitaria integrativa, supporto psicologico attraverso counseling, webinar dedicati al benessere psicofisico e vaccino antinfluenzale
Famiglia: A2A Life Caring, iniziativa a supporto della genitorialità attraverso un mese aggiuntivo retribuito al 100% per maternità/paternità, rimborsi spese per figli, convenzioni con asili nido, team coaching per neogenitori; spazio caregiver, offriamo webinar e uno spazio di ascolto dedicati a chi si prende cura di persone fragili o non autosufficienti
Formazione e sviluppo: programma di induction dedicato ai nuovi assunti, gestione dei talenti, corsi di formazione e possibilità di crescita interna e job rotation tramite candidatura interna
Risparmio e tempo libero: oltre 300 convenzioni, tra cui trasporti pubblici, attività sportive, viaggi, eventi culturali, e offerte speciali per luce e gas. Opzioni per il car sharing e la conversione del premio di risultato in benefit di welfare
Ambiente di lavoro: promuoviamo una cultura che valorizza la diversità, l’equità e l'inclusione (DE&I); potrai inoltre avere la possibilità di unirti a un team dedicato allo sviluppo di iniziative e progetti su queste tematiche. Sosteniamo l'evoluzione tecnologica e offriamo strumenti e risorse per promuovere il lavoro digitale


Saranno valutate esclusivamente le candidature inviate tramite il Sito Carriere aziendale.

Ci impegniamo ogni giorno per creare un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo e innovativo, fondato sul rispetto, sull’etica e sulle pari opportunità garantendo la valorizzazione delle diversità. 
La selezione è rivolta a candidati e candidate in linea con le competenze richieste. I dati personali raccolti verranno trattati nel rispetto del Regolamento Ue 2016/679 (GDPR).

Scopri di più sul Gruppo a2a:
https://www.gruppoa2a.it/it/carriere/nostre-career-areas

Per conoscere il nostro processo di selezione e prepararti al meglio al colloquio:
https://content.gruppoa2a.it/sites/default/files/2023-03/consigli-iter-selezione.pdf

Title: Digital & Media - Data Scientist
Description:
Descrizione azienda




JAKALA è un'azienda che lavora su dati, intelligenza artificiale e sviluppo di esperienze per generare un impatto significativo e duraturo a livello globale.

Presenti in oltre 30 città in 21 paesi, i nostri team uniscono competenze su strategia, tecnologia, creatività e operations per offrire esperienze personalizzate e soluzioni trasformative ai nostri clienti, grazie al supporto di dati e intelligenza artificiale. I Jakalers sono un gruppo eterogeneo di oltre 3.000 persone, animate da passione, ambizione e idee brillanti. Proprio questa combinazione unica di talenti è il fattore distintivo che ha ispirato il nostro purpose: Together to get there.




Creare un mondo migliore è il nostro obiettivo ultimo: la nostra ambizione è generare valore per tutti i nostri stakeholder in modo sostenibile, con particolare attenzione a etica, clima e qualità. Nel 2021, abbiamo scelto di diventare una Società Benefit, dimostrando il nostro impegno di lungo periodo e la volontà di proteggere i principi e i valori che ogni giorno guidano le nostre azioni.




Crediamo che la diversità sia la chiave del nostro successo e, per questo, siamo impegnati a creare un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, dove ciascuno possa sentirsi valorizzato per la propria unicità. Tutte le nostre opportunità di lavoro sono aperte ai candidati appartenenti alle categorie protette L.68/99.




Posizione




Per il potenziamento della Business Line Digital & Media ricerchiamo un Data Scientist con ottime capacità di lavoro in squadra, di apprendimento e di problem solving. Come Data Scientist verrai inserito nel Team Data e ti occuperai della progettazione, implementazione, gestione di processi big data e machine learning pipelines lavorando a stretto contatto con Data Engineers e Data Viz specialists.




Ecco un esempio delle attività che seguirai:

Applicazione di modelli di Marketing Mix Model per valutare l'impatto dei canali media sulle vendite;
Applicazione di modelli di Attribuzione per il marketing;
Analisi dei Big Data per i nostri clienti su Data warehouse in Cloud come Google BigQuery o similare;
Applicazione di modelli di segmentazione, clustering, churn della customer base;
Utilizzo di modelli di Generative AI (OpenAI, Google, Open Source) applicati ad use-cases di marketing come creazione e generazione di contenuti, traduzione, generazione di immagini, valorizzazione di know how aziendale;




Requisiti

Il/la candidato/a ideale possiede:




Laurea in Informatica, Matematica, Statistica, Ingegneria o altre discipline scientifiche
Almeno 3-6 anni di esperienza nella progettazione di soluzioni analitiche in ambito gestione e analisi dei dati, data visualization, advanced analytics e machine learning
Conoscenza dei principali linguaggi di programmazione per la Data Science: Python, SQL, R.
Passione/Interesse per il digital marketing
Familiarità con le principali soluzioni cloud (GCP, AWS, Azure) o precedenti esperienze nel digital marketing costituiranno elemento preferenziale.
Capacità di lavorare in team
Buona conoscenza lingua inglese scritta e orale




Nice to have:




Conoscenza di base del framework di elaborazione di Big Data Spark
Precedenti esperienze lavorative nel marketing digitale, inclusa esperienza di consulenza
Esperienza / progetti con librerie di Bayesian Modeling.




Se investi tempo nel nostro percorso di Recruiting, avrai tutto il nostro impegno. E oltre.

La tua candidatura verrà presa in carico da un Recruiter del nostro Team Talent Acquisition, che si prenderà cura di visionare il tuo CV e le informazioni fornite. Sarà poi il tuo Recruiter di riferimento a ricontattarti per condividere il nostro feedback per te, indipendentemente dall’esito. Riceverai in ogni caso suggerimenti di sviluppo legati all’ottimizzazione del tuo CV, spunti per consolidare il tuo percorso di carriera e insight sull’arena competitiva in cui sei inserit*. Niente AI: lo facciamo a mano, col cuore, per te.
Ogni ora che vorrai investire nel conoscere JAKALA te la restituiamo per conoscerti meglio: grazie all’iniziativa “Your Time Back” e la nostra partnership strategica con Unobravo, hai diritto ad un percorso di empowerment di sessioni equivalenti al numero di interviste che hai sostenuto e che potrai spendere come vorrai. Sappiamo che cercare lavoro può essere sfidante: insieme a Unobravo vogliamo esserti vicini, anche se ancora non ci conosciamo.
Show more
HTML:
Descrizione azienda


JAKALA è un'azienda che lavora su dati, intelligenza artificiale e sviluppo di esperienze per generare un impatto significativo e duraturo a livello globale.

Presenti in oltre 30 città in 21 paesi, i nostri team uniscono competenze su strategia, tecnologia, creatività e operations per offrire esperienze personalizzate e soluzioni trasformative ai nostri clienti, grazie al supporto di dati e intelligenza artificiale. I Jakalers sono un gruppo eterogeneo di oltre 3.000 persone, animate da passione, ambizione e idee brillanti. Proprio questa combinazione unica di talenti è il fattore distintivo che ha ispirato il nostro purpose: Together to get there.


Creare un mondo migliore è il nostro obiettivo ultimo: la nostra ambizione è generare valore per tutti i nostri stakeholder in modo sostenibile, con particolare attenzione a etica, clima e qualità. Nel 2021, abbiamo scelto di diventare una Società Benefit, dimostrando il nostro impegno di lungo periodo e la volontà di proteggere i principi e i valori che ogni giorno guidano le nostre azioni.


Crediamo che la diversità sia la chiave del nostro successo e, per questo, siamo impegnati a creare un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, dove ciascuno possa sentirsi valorizzato per la propria unicità. Tutte le nostre opportunità di lavoro sono aperte ai candidati appartenenti alle categorie protette L.68/99.


Posizione


Per il potenziamento della Business Line Digital & Media ricerchiamo un Data Scientist con ottime capacità di lavoro in squadra, di apprendimento e di problem solving. Come Data Scientist verrai inserito nel Team Data e ti occuperai della progettazione, implementazione, gestione di processi big data e machine learning pipelines lavorando a stretto contatto con Data Engineers e Data Viz specialists.


Ecco un esempio delle attività che seguirai:

  • Applicazione di modelli di Marketing Mix Model per valutare l'impatto dei canali media sulle vendite;
  • Applicazione di modelli di Attribuzione per il marketing;
  • Analisi dei Big Data per i nostri clienti su Data warehouse in Cloud come Google BigQuery o similare;
  • Applicazione di modelli di segmentazione, clustering, churn della customer base;
  • Utilizzo di modelli di Generative AI (OpenAI, Google, Open Source) applicati ad use-cases di marketing come creazione e generazione di contenuti, traduzione, generazione di immagini, valorizzazione di know how aziendale;


Requisiti

Il/la candidato/a ideale possiede:


  • Laurea in Informatica, Matematica, Statistica, Ingegneria o altre discipline scientifiche
  • Almeno 3-6 anni di esperienza nella progettazione di soluzioni analitiche in ambito gestione e analisi dei dati, data visualization, advanced analytics e machine learning
  • Conoscenza dei principali linguaggi di programmazione per la Data Science: Python, SQL, R.
  • Passione/Interesse per il digital marketing
  • Familiarità con le principali soluzioni cloud (GCP, AWS, Azure) o precedenti esperienze nel digital marketing costituiranno elemento preferenziale.
  • Capacità di lavorare in team
  • Buona conoscenza lingua inglese scritta e orale


Nice to have:


  • Conoscenza di base del framework di elaborazione di Big Data Spark
  • Precedenti esperienze lavorative nel marketing digitale, inclusa esperienza di consulenza
  • Esperienza / progetti con librerie di Bayesian Modeling.


Se investi tempo nel nostro percorso di Recruiting, avrai tutto il nostro impegno. E oltre.

  • La tua candidatura verrà presa in carico da un Recruiter del nostro Team Talent Acquisition, che si prenderà cura di visionare il tuo CV e le informazioni fornite. Sarà poi il tuo Recruiter di riferimento a ricontattarti per condividere il nostro feedback per te, indipendentemente dall’esito. Riceverai in ogni caso suggerimenti di sviluppo legati all’ottimizzazione del tuo CV, spunti per consolidare il tuo percorso di carriera e insight sull’arena competitiva in cui sei inserit*. Niente AI: lo facciamo a mano, col cuore, per te.
  • Ogni ora che vorrai investire nel conoscere JAKALA te la restituiamo per conoscerti meglio: grazie all’iniziativa “Your Time Back” e la nostra partnership strategica con Unobravo, hai diritto ad un percorso di empowerment di sessioni equivalenti al numero di interviste che hai sostenuto e che potrai spendere come vorrai. Sappiamo che cercare lavoro può essere sfidante: insieme a Unobravo vogliamo esserti vicini, anche se ancora non ci conosciamo.

Title: AI Training Analyst
Description:
Outlier aiuta le aziende più innovative del mondo a migliorare i loro modelli di intelligenza artificiale fornendo feedback umano. Sei un ingegnere del software esperto che vorrebbe mettere a disposizione la propria competenza in programmazione per addestrare modelli di IA?

Collaboriamo con organizzazioni per addestrare grandi modelli linguistici di IA, aiutando i modelli generativi avanzati a scrivere codice migliore. I progetti generalmente includono problemi discreti e altamente variabili, che richiedono di interagire con questi modelli mentre apprendono la programmazione. Non è richiesta alcuna esperienza precedente con l'IA.

Informazioni Sull’opportunità

Outlier è alla ricerca di programmatori talentuosi per contribuire al training di modelli di intelligenza artificiale generativa.

Questa opportunità freelance è completamente remota e offre orari flessibili, permettendoti di lavorare quando ti è più comodo.

Come Puoi Contribuire


Creando e rispondendo a domande relative all'informatica per aiutare a formare i modelli di IA.
Valutando e classificando il codice generato dai modelli di IA.


Esempi Di Competenze Desiderate


Essere attualmente iscritto o aver completato una laurea triennale o superiore in informatica presso un'istituzione rinomata.
Competenza in uno o più dei seguenti linguaggi di programmazione: Java, Python, JavaScript / TypeScript, C++, Swift, Verilog.
Capacità di spiegare concetti complessi in modo fluente in italiano.
Eccellente attenzione ai dettagli, compresi grammatica, punteggiatura e linee guida stilistiche.


Pagamento


Attualmente, le tariffe orarie per il lavoro su progetti principali eseguito da esperti di programmazione variano tra $25 e $50 USD.
Le tariffe possono variare in base alle competenze, alla valutazione delle abilità, alla posizione, alle necessità del progetto e ad altri fattori. Ad esempio, tariffe più elevate possono essere offerte a chi possiede un dottorato di ricerca. Per lavori non principali, come la fase di onboarding iniziale o il lavoro straordinario, possono essere applicate tariffe inferiori. Alcuni progetti offrono anche incentivi economici. Ti invitiamo a consultare i termini di pagamento specifici per ogni progetto.


PLEASE NOTE: We collect, retain and use personal data for our professional business purposes, including notifying you of opportunities that may be of interest and sharing with our affiliates. We limit the personal data we collect to that which we believe is appropriate and necessary to manage applicants’ needs, provide our services, and comply with applicable laws. Any information we collect in connection with your application will be treated in accordance with the Outlier Privacy Policy and our internal policies and programs designed to protect personal data.

This is a 1099 contract opportunity on the Outlier.ai platform. Because this is a freelance opportunity, we do not offer internships, sponsorship, or employment. You must be authorized to work in your country of residence. If you are an international student, you may be able to sign up for Outlier if you are on a visa. You should contact your tax and/or immigration advisor with specific questions regarding your circumstances.

Title: Data Scientist, Internship, Italy - BCG X
Description:
Who We Are

Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.

To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures—and business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.

We Are BCG X

We’re a diverse team of more than 3,000 tech experts united by a drive to make a difference. Working across industries and disciplines, we combine our experience and expertise to tackle the biggest challenges faced by society today. We go beyond what was once thought possible, creating new and innovative solutions to the world’s most complex problems. Leveraging BCG’s global network and partnerships with leading organizations, BCG X provides a stable ecosystem for talent to build game-changing businesses, products, and services from the ground up, all while growing their career. Together, we strive to create solutions that will positively impact the lives of millions.

What You'll Do

Our BCG X teams own the full analytics value-chain end to end: framing new business challenges, designing innovative algorithms, implementing, and deploying scalable solutions, and enabling colleagues and clients to fully embrace AI. Our product offerings span from fully custom-builds to industry specific leading edge AI software solutions.

You'll be part of our rapidly growing team who will have a chance to apply data science methods and analytics to real-world business situations across a variety of industries to drive significant business impact. You'll have the chance to partner with clients in a variety of BCG regions and industries, and on key topics like climate change, enabling them to design, build, and deploy new and innovative solutions.

Additional responsibilities will include developing and delivering thought leadership in scientific communities and papers as well as leading conferences on behalf of BCG X. Successful candidates are intellectually curious builders who are biased toward action, creative, and communicative.

We Are Looking For Dedicated Individuals With a Passion For Data Science, Statistics, Operations Research And Redefining Organizations Into AI Led Innovative Companies. Successful Candidates Possess The Following


Comfortable in a client-facing role with the ambition to lead teams
Likes to distill complex results or processes into simple, clear visualizations
Explain sophisticated data science concepts in an understandable manner
Love building things and are comfortable working with modern development tools and writing code collaboratively (bonus points if you have a software development or DevOps experience)
Significant experience applying advanced analytics to business situations and a proven ability to synthesize complex data
Deep understanding of modern machine learning techniques and their mathematical underpinnings, and can translate this into business implications for our clients
Have strong project management skills
Fluency in both Italian and English


What You'll Bring

Requirements

Currently enrolled in a university master’s or PhD degree program in Computer Research Science, Data Science, Statistics, Operations Research, or related field

Technologies

Programming Languages: Python

#BCGXjob

Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.

BCG is an E - Verify Employer. Click here for more information on E-Verify.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist - Prima
Description:
At Prima, you could take on a whole new challenge. As part of our global community, you’d be in the driving seat of your career; learning and growing with a top-tier team around you. Prima is a place where no matter who you are or what your role is — your voice is valued. We are passionate about shaping the future of insurance with a strong commitment to innovation, collaboration, and inclusivity. Since 2015, we've focused on delivering affordable, customer-centered car insurance while fostering a culture where every voice is valued.




We are now hiring for a Data Scientist to join our Pricing team and play a critical role in our journey to become the world's leading insurance provider.

In this role, you will be at the forefront of our predictive pricing strategy, using data analytics, AI, and machine learning to drive our competitive advantage. We look for curious and proactive individuals with strong foundations in mathematics, programming, and machine learning. While prior experience isn’t required, we value a genuine enthusiasm for innovation and analytical challenges.

If you're ready to make an impact in a supportive environment that emphasizes growth, autonomy, and well-being, join us and help shape the future at Prima!




Your main responsibilities

The main responsibility of the Data Scientist in Prima’s Pricing team is to harness the power of data analytics, AI, and machine learning to drive predictive pricing strategies. You’ll be tasked with analyzing large datasets to anticipate market trends, evaluate client risk, and set competitive pricing that aligns with our growth goals. This role is essential to building and maintaining Prima’s competitive edge in the insurance industry by providing data-driven insights that guide strategic decisions.

In addition to technical analysis, you’ll collaborate closely with other departments, ensuring that pricing models are aligned with broader business objectives and continuously optimized. Your work will directly impact Prima’s success, contributing to our mission to become a top global insurance provider.

Here a recap:

Develop predictive pricing models using data analytics, AI, and machine learning to enhance Prima’s competitive edge.
Analyze large datasets to identify trends, evaluate client risk, and inform pricing strategies.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to align pricing models with overall business goals and ensure data-driven decision-making.




Requirements for this position

Here are the key requirements for the Data Scientist position at Prima:

Academic Background: Strong academic achievements in Mathematics, Physics, Mathematical Engineering, Mathematical Statistics, or related fields.
Analytical Skills: Exceptional quantitative, logical, and analytical abilities to tackle complex data challenges.
Programming & Machine Learning: Solid foundation in programming (Python or similar) and experience with machine learning techniques.
Data Manipulation: Proficiency in data mining languages such as MySQL or Redshift to create and manage datasets.
Curiosity and Innovation: A proactive mindset, with a drive for curiosity and problem-solving in a collaborative environment.
Language Proficiency: Fluency in English and Italian is preferred.
International Experience: Previous international experience is a plus, supporting Prima’s global perspective.




Candidates do not need prior work experience, as Prima is committed to investing in early-career talent and growth.




Your compensation

Prima offers a range of compensation and benefits designed to support employee well-being, growth, and work-life balance. Key benefits include:

Flexible Work Arrangements: Prima values work-life balance, offering flexibility between office and remote work and an annual 30-day work-from-anywhere policy.
Professional Development: Access to a teaching and learning marketplace and regular growth sessions with managers to build a personalized career plan.
Health and Well-being Support: Comprehensive private medical insurance, discounted gym memberships, and well-being initiatives to help maintain a healthy lifestyle.
Supportive Work Environment: Prima fosters an inclusive, high-performing culture where diversity is celebrated, and equal employment opportunities are a priority.




Languages

Required (fluent)

Italian

Valuable

English

Show more

Title: AI Training Specialist
Description:
Outlier helps the world’s most innovative companies improve their AI models by providing human feedback. Are you an experienced software engineer who would like to lend your coding expertise to train AI models?

We partner with organizations to train AI large language models, helping cutting-edge generative AI models write better code. Projects typically include discrete, highly variable problems that involve engaging with these models as they learn to code. There is no requirement for previous AI experience.

About The Opportunity


Outlier is looking for talented coders to help train generative artificial intelligence models
This freelance opportunity is remote and hours are flexible, so you can work whenever is best for you


You may contribute your expertise by…


Crafting and answering questions related to computer science in order to help train AI models
Evaluating and ranking code generated by AI models


Examples Of Desirable Expertise


Currently enrolled in or completed a bachelor's degree or higher in computer science at a selective institution
Proficiency working with one or more of the the following languages: Java, Python, JavaScript / TypeScript, C++, Swift, and Verilog
Ability to articulate complex concepts fluently in Italian
Excellent attention to detail, including grammar, punctuation, and style guidelines


Payment


Currently, pay rates for core project work by coding experts range from USD $25 to $50 per hour.
Rates vary based on expertise, skills assessment, location, project need, and other factors. For example, higher rates may be offered to PhDs. For non-core work, such as during initial project onboarding or project overtime phases, lower rates may apply. Certain projects offer incentive payments. Please review the payment terms for each project.


PLEASE NOTE: We collect, retain and use personal data for our professional business purposes, including notifying you of opportunities that may be of interest and sharing with our affiliates. We limit the personal data we collect to that which we believe is appropriate and necessary to manage applicants’ needs, provide our services, and comply with applicable laws. Any information we collect in connection with your application will be treated in accordance with the Outlier Privacy Policy and our internal policies and programs designed to protect personal data.

This is a 1099 contract opportunity on the Outlier.ai platform. Because this is a freelance opportunity, we do not offer internships, sponsorship, or employment. You must be authorized to work in your country of residence. If you are an international student, you may be able to sign up for Outlier if you are on a visa. You should contact your tax and/or immigration advisor with specific questions regarding your circumstances.
Show more
HTML:
Outlier helps the world’s most innovative companies improve their AI models by providing human feedback. Are you an experienced software engineer who would like to lend your coding expertise to train AI models?

We partner with organizations to train AI large language models, helping cutting-edge generative AI models write better code. Projects typically include discrete, highly variable problems that involve engaging with these models as they learn to code. There is no requirement for previous AI experience.

About The Opportunity

  • Outlier is looking for talented coders to help train generative artificial intelligence models
  • This freelance opportunity is remote and hours are flexible, so you can work whenever is best for you

You may contribute your expertise by…

  • Crafting and answering questions related to computer science in order to help train AI models
  • Evaluating and ranking code generated by AI models

Examples Of Desirable Expertise

  • Currently enrolled in or completed a bachelor's degree or higher in computer science at a selective institution
  • Proficiency working with one or more of the the following languages: Java, Python, JavaScript / TypeScript, C++, Swift, and Verilog
  • Ability to articulate complex concepts fluently in Italian
  • Excellent attention to detail, including grammar, punctuation, and style guidelines

Payment

  • Currently, pay rates for core project work by coding experts range from USD $25 to $50 per hour.
  • Rates vary based on expertise, skills assessment, location, project need, and other factors. For example, higher rates may be offered to PhDs. For non-core work, such as during initial project onboarding or project overtime phases, lower rates may apply. Certain projects offer incentive payments. Please review the payment terms for each project.

PLEASE NOTE: We collect, retain and use personal data for our professional business purposes, including notifying you of opportunities that may be of interest and sharing with our affiliates. We limit the personal data we collect to that which we believe is appropriate and necessary to manage applicants’ needs, provide our services, and comply with applicable laws. Any information we collect in connection with your application will be treated in accordance with the Outlier Privacy Policy and our internal policies and programs designed to protect personal data.

This is a 1099 contract opportunity on the Outlier.ai platform. Because this is a freelance opportunity, we do not offer internships, sponsorship, or employment. You must be authorized to work in your country of residence. If you are an international student, you may be able to sign up for Outlier if you are on a visa. You should contact your tax and/or immigration advisor with specific questions regarding your circumstances.

Title: DATA SCIENTIST
Description:
DATA SCIENTIST




Are you curious and ready to accept a new challenge in your career? Are you eager to join a dynamic company and bring innovation through your work and skills?

Prometeia offers you opportunities for growth and training in a Group with over 1000 professionals working for more than 500 clients in 20 countries around the world.

We are looking for motivated and talented Data Scientists to join our Data Science team. You will have the opportunity to work on complex and innovative projects, using cutting-edge tools and collaborating with high-level professionals to face the challenges of the global financial market. If you are looking for a challenging environment where your curiosity and creativity can make a difference, this is the right opportunity for you.




RESPONSIBILITIES:




● Analyze large volumes of structured and unstructured data in banking and insurance, identifying useful patterns and insights to support business processes and decisions.

● Design, develop and implement advanced machine learning, data mining and statistical models to solve complex problems in finance.

● Collaborate in cross-functional teams to define project requirements and propose innovative solutions.

● Contribute to the development of proprietary frameworks and algorithms to improve the performance of solutions offered to our clients.

● Present complex results to technical and non-technical stakeholders, making analysis results understandable.

● Support customers in implementing solutions, ensuring knowledge transfer and customization.




REQUIREMENTS:




● Experience in data wrangling, cleaning, exploration and feature extraction.

● Excellent knowledge of Python and the most important analytical libraries.

● Knowledge of statistics, Machine Learning and major clustering, classification and regression algorithms

● Advanced knowledge of statistical techniques, predictive modeling with the application of Machine Learning models, and data analysis.

● Ability to creatively solve complex problems and propose innovative solutions.

● Ability to rapidly prototype ideas/solutions with a critical/experimental approach to data analysis.

● Good communication skills and ability to translate technical results into insights for non-experts.

● Aptitude for teamwork, with strong orientation toward interdisciplinary collaboration.




NICE TO HAVE:




● Experience with code versioning systems (git).

● Experience in Pyspark development and working in big data platforms.

● Knowledge of at least one major cloud environment (Azure, GCP, AWS).

● Experience in processing and modeling with unstructured data (Text Analytics, Computer Vision)

● Prior analytical experience in the financial industry




EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:




● Master's degree or PhD with excellent grades in Data Science, Statistics, Physics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or related fields

● Experience in a corporate setting (including internships), preferably in finance or insurance




LOCATION:

Milan




WHAT WE OFFER:




COMPENSATION, WELFARE & BENEFIT




Our history, as well as our future, is based on the value of our people. Prometeia’s biggest investment is in our people and it concerns every aspect of professional life. We call it “Total Compensation” and it is made of three elements: Compensation, consisting of a fixed and a variable component, a Welfare Plan active since 2015 –we were among the first companies in Italy to introduce it–, and Benefits, including all initiatives for the well-being of our people.




REMOTE WORKING

Flexibility is an intrinsic value of our way of working. In Prometeia, remote working is an organizational method based on trust. It results in benefits in terms of work/life balance, impact on the environment and optimization of company results through autonomy and empowerment of people.




PEOPLE PROGRAM

Our evaluation system is based on the full enhancement of our people and on continuous dialogue as a stimulus for regular, mutual professional and personal growth. Within the projects, several moments are dedicated to transparent discussions between managers and team members. This allows for reciprocal and prompt feedback. The process is fully digitalized and aimed at continuously improving the strategic growth of both the individual and the company.




TRAINING

Prometeia means continuous training. We provide an average of 11 days of training per year to our people, in person and online. We pay specific attention to younger colleagues, the protagonists of dedicated growth programs, and to the continuous sharing and internal transfer of know-how and skills. On-the-job training is also important and is made of immediate and direct confrontation with the market.




WIN/WIN POLICY

If you are one of our employees and you recommend a person who is later hired, you are entitled to a financial bonus! This is an important opportunity to contribute to the growth of Prometeia as a whole, by attracting acknowledged market professionals and new tech talents.




PHYGITAL MANAGEMENT

We have completely digitalized the management of our physical and virtual environments through the dedicated app Pr(Home)teia. Access to the office, remote working, workstations, meeting rooms, carpooling... everything is just a click away.




COMMUNITY

Our Community is highly diverse, as are the skills of the people who are part of it and who share its values, and the individuals and organizations directly or indirectly involved in our activities. Clients, People of the Group, Alumni, Institutions, Academia, non-profit entities we actively cooperate with are stakeholders representing a great value for us in terms of trust and collaboration.




DIVERSITY

We promote and respect equal opportunities and consider differences as a value. Diversity & Inclusion are fundamental values: from the recruitment phase to everyday life, promoted also through dedicated training moments to develop individual sensitivities and uniqueness.




IMPACT

We responsibly take an active role towards the environment, territories and communities we operate in. Our Headquarter in Bologna has obtained the Leed Gold Certification, one of the highest awards recognizing the efficiency of the building in terms of energy and water savings, CO2 emissions reduction, and improvement of the ecological quality of interiors, materials and resources. In the Sustainability Report we outline the results achieved within the 17 Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) of the 2030 Agenda drafted by the UN in 2016, that we have been supporting since 2020.

Title: Data Scientist Internship- L 68/99
Description:
Cerved è la Tech Company che aiuta imprese e istituzioni a proteggersi dal rischio e a crescere in maniera sostenibile.

Siamo leader nell'ambito dei prodotti e servizi integrati di Risk, Sales e Marketing Intelligence, Credit Management. Con Cerved Rating Agency siamo specializzati nella valutazione del merito di credito di imprese non finanziarie e registrati quale agenzia di rating europea.

Dal 2021, Cerved è entrata in ION Group, uno dei più grandi operatori FinTech sul mercato a livello internazionale in cui lavorano oltre 13 mila persone, con 60 sedi internazionali e oltre 4800 clienti in tutto il mondo insieme realizziamo soluzioni integrate per aiutare le imprese a prendere decisioni efficaci, semplificando i processi e mettendo al centro le persone. 

Sei una persona appassionata di dati e desideri far parte della trasformazione algo-driven in CERVED? Siamo alla ricerca di una figura di Junior Data Scientist che si unisca al nostro team di Collection Intelligence. Questa è un'opportunità sfidante per chi desidera contribuire alla comprensione dei dati e all'estrazione di insight significativi per il nostro business.

La persona che cerchiamo si occuperà di


Collaborare con il Collection Intelligence Manager per sviluppare metodologie e tecniche per l'analisi e la valutazione dei dati mediante modelli matematici e statistici.
Identificare, analizzare e interpretare i dati per individuare trend, pattern e opportunità di ottimizzazione dei processi aziendali.
Supportare le diverse aree aziendali nell'implementazione di strategie data/algo-driven sui sistemi gestionali aziendali.
Sviluppare reportistica per il monitoraggio dei principali KPI aziendali nell'ambito delle operazioni.


La persona che cerchiamo


Ha conseguito una laurea in Statistica, Matematica, Informatica o campo correlato.
Possiede forti doti analitiche e quantitative.
E’ in grado di organizzare, analizzare e interpretare quantità significative di informazioni con attenzione ai dettagli.
Ha competenze in data modeling
Ha una conoscenza avanzata di Excel
Utilizza il linguaggio di programmazione Python.


Per Cerved la diversità e l'inclusione sono valori fondamentali per permettere a tutti di esprimersi al meglio nell'ambiente lavorativo. Ci impegniamo tutti i giorni a capire, comprendere e sviluppare le potenzialità e a valorizzare la diversità delle nostre persone, che rappresentano il vero valore del nostro Gruppo.

Si valuta come sede di lavoro preferenziale San Donato Milanese (MI)

Title: Software Engineer (Machine Learning)
Description:
We are looking for a Machine Learning (ML) Engineer to help us create artificial intelligence products. Machine Learning Engineer responsibilities include creating machine learning models and retraining systems. To do this job successfully, you need exceptional skills in statistics and programming.

If you also have knowledge of data science and software engineering, we'd like to meet you.

Your ultimate goal will be to shape and build efficient self-learning applications.

Responsibilities


Design, build and test Machine Learning models, such as supervised ensemble models (Random Forest, XGBoost, CatBoost, etc.) as well as Deep Learning models
Deploy ML models, exposing model predictions through API
Come up with ML solutions to constantly optimize our work pipeline and replace time-consuming processes
Perform statistical analysis and fine-tuning using test results and develop tools to aid in the post-deployment assessment of our ML products
Study and transform data science prototypes
Research and implement appropriate ML algorithms and tools
Select appropriate datasets and data representation methods
Train and retrain systems when necessary



Requirements


3+ years of experience in developing ML/DL models
Solid programming skills and understanding of software architecture, understanding of data structures, data modeling
Solid knowledge of the most common ML Python libraries (scikit-learn, Keras, Tensorflow)
Familiarity with Jupyter notebooks, PyCharm, and REST API
Ability to work autonomously and to balance multiple projects and deadlines
Good communication skills and ability to explain statistics and ML concepts to both internal and external stakeholders in a simple and intuitive manner
Proven experience as a Machine Learning Engineer or similar role
Deep knowledge of maths, probability, statistics, and algorithms
Excellent communication skills
Ability to work in a team
Outstanding analytical and problem-solving skills
BSc in Computer Science, Mathematics or similar field; Master's degree is a plus



Benefits


Private Health Insurance
Paid Time Off
Hybrid work solution 60% from home
Training & Development
Show more

Title: Machine Learning Scientist Intern
Description:
Integral Ad Science (IAS) is a global technology and data company that builds verification, optimization, and analytics solutions for the advertising industry and we’re looking for a Machine Learning Scientist (ML) Intern to join our Multimedia Core Service team in Modena, Italy. If you are excited by technology that has the power to handle hundreds of thousands of transactions per second; collect tens of billions of events each day; and evaluate thousands of data-points in real-time all while responding in just a few milliseconds, then IAS is the place for you!

As a ML Scientist Intern you will work on advancing the understanding and application of dimensionality reduction techniques for sparse feature matrices generated by semantic engines. You will prototype, implement and evaluate a range of dimensionality reduction approaches. The second phase of the project will involve comparing the reduced-dimensional embedding spaces with existing pre-trained embeddings, to study similarities, overlaps, and differences in representation. This analysis will provide insights into how rule-based semantic features compare with context-aware neural representations This internship is an opportunity for you to gain practical experience with deep learning, interacting with large scale production environments and having the opportunity to research novel methods that can push the state of the art of media understanding and content evaluation.

What you’ll get to do:


Conduct in-depth research and experimentation on a wide array of dimensionality reduction techniques, with a particular focus on their applicability to sparse feature matrices commonly produced by semantic engines. This will involve prototyping, implementing, and rigorously evaluating methods such as Principal Component Analysis (PCA), Truncated Singular Value Decomposition (SVD), and neural embedding models (e.g., autoencoders).
Leverage these feature representations to construct and train machine learning models that can effectively address a variety of downstream tasks, such as classification, regression, clustering, or anomaly detection.
Work with the framework of your choice, e.g. PyTorch, TensorFlow, etc.
Integrate machine learning models into production systems.
Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in the field of machine learning and contribute to knowledge sharing within the team.



You should apply if you have most of this experience:


Currently pursuing a Master’s or PhD in Computer Science, Mathematics, Computer Engineering, Statistics, or a related field.
Familiarity with machine learning and deep learning methods.
Proficiency in Python and experience with libraries such as NumPy, SciPy, Pandas, PyTorch, and TensorFlow.
Familiarity with SVD, BERT, ViT, or CLIP is a plus.
Experience with Self-Supervised Learning methods is also a plus.



About Integral Ad Science

Integral Ad Science (IAS) is a leading global media measurement and optimization platform that delivers the industry’s most actionable data to drive superior results for the world’s largest advertisers, publishers, and media platforms. IAS’s software provides comprehensive and enriched data that ensures ads are seen by real people in safe and suitable environments, while improving return on ad spend for advertisers and yield for publishers. Our mission is to be the global benchmark for trust and transparency in digital media quality. For more information, visit integralads.com.

Equal Opportunity Employer:

IAS is an equal opportunity employer, committed to our diversity and inclusiveness. We will consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, nationality, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, disability or age. We strongly encourage women, people of color, members of the LGBTQIA community, people with disabilities and veterans to apply.

California Applicant Pre-Collection Notice:

We collect personal information (PI) from you in connection with your application for employment or engagement with IAS, including the following categories of PI: identifiers, personal records, commercial information, professional or employment or engagement information, non-public education records, and inferences drawn from your PI. We collect your PI for our purposes, including performing services and operations related to your potential employment or engagement. For additional details or if you have questions, contact us at compliance@integralads.com.

To learn more about us, please visit http://integralads.com/

Attention agency/3rd party recruiters: IAS does not accept any unsolicited resumes or candidate profiles. If you are interested in becoming an IAS recruiting partner, please send an email introducing your company to recruitingagencies@integralads.com. We will get back to you if there's interest in a partnership.
Show more
