Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Saipem is a global leader in the engineering and construction of major projects for the energy and infrastructure sectors, both offshore and onshore. Saipem is “One Company” organized into five business lines - Asset Based Services, Energy Carriers, Offshore Wind, Sustainable Infrastructures, Robotics & Industrialized Solutions. The company has 8 fabrication yards and an offshore fleet of 29 construction vessels (of which 26 owned and 3 owned by third parties and managed by Saipem) and 15 drilling rigs, of which 8 owned. Always oriented towards technological innovation, the company’s purpose is “Engineering for a sustainable future”. As such Saipem is committed to supporting its clients on the energy transition pathway towards Net Zero, with increasingly digital means, technologies and processes geared for environmental sustainability. Listed on the Milan Stock Exchange, it is present in more than 50 countries around the world and employs about 30,000 people of over 120 nationalities.

Always committed to promoting and supporting the values of diversity and inclusion, Saipem confirms its commitment to valuing differences as a source of mutual enrichment. To this end, it promotes and encourages conditions that allow the removal of every obstacle that limits the full expression of people and their complete development within the organization. It protects and guarantees work conditions that respect individual dignity, while promoting a collaborative, harmonious, fair and supportive work environment.

The resource will be part of the important transformation program that involves all Saipem Group and plays a key role in ensuring Digital Transformation projects meet objectives and she/he will govern the data management architectures and the related technology authority methodologies.

The resource will contribute on transformation initiatives related to existing technologies, focusing also on new project digital imprinting leveraging on new technology introduction to meet project requirements.

The Person Will Focus On These Areas


Responsible for designing and evolving of Data Technologies and Data Architecture for the Group.
Identification and selection of new solutions offered by the major Technology Providers.
Ensure that applications and data related services during their evolution are sustainable, maintainable and efficient.
Guide and develop the Data Governance processes and environments, contributing to the definition of the technological and procedural guidelines for the Group.
Guide and develop Machine Learning environment and initiatives.
Design and maintain the lifecycle of data integration and data virtualization tools and services.
Manage project initiatives and govern their delivery.
Support and improve the internal data platform and data ops tools leveraging the new paradigms of data mesh and data fabric.
Ensure that information security risks are properly identified, assessed and managed.



From a Technical Point Of View, Required Knowledges Are


In-depth knowledge of Cloud data platforms and related catalogue offers for the ‘end to end’ design of the data Enterprise architecture.
Excellent knowledge of Informatica, Cloudera and Denodo.
Knowledge of Microsoft Azure environment.
Knowledge of IoT platform and Edge applications will be considered a plus.
Knowledge of cloud computing and the specific features of IaaS, PaaS and SaaS services.
Good knowledge of the Dev & Ops and IAC paradigms and management/evolution of CI / CD pipelines.
Familiarity with relevant data tools and technologies is beneficial. This may include experience with databases (e.g., Sql-and NoSql based databases), data visualization tools (e.g., Qlik, PowerBI), and data analysis platforms (e.g., Pandas, NumPy, TensorFlow).
Knowledge of programming languages commonly used in data analysis, such as Python, R, or SQL, is highly desirable. Understanding how to write efficient code and work with data-related libraries and frameworks can significantly help.



Competencies / Experience Are


At least 5 years of experience in data management teams, technology system integration or Vendor player and 5 years’ experience in the technology transformation journey and Cloud technologies.
A degree in a relevant field such as Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related discipline is mandatory together with a strong foundation in STEM subjects.
Experience of working on large-scale software projects.
Fluency in English.
Good communication skills, flexible and adaptable, collaborative, enthusiastic with a high level of energy, self–motivation, resilience, drive and initiative.
Availability to possible business trips.
Proficiency in analytical thinking and problem-solving is crucial. This includes the ability to collect, clean, analyze, and interpret data effectively. Familiarity with statistical concepts and methods, as well as experience with data manipulation and visualization, would be advantageous.
Show more

Competencies / Experience Are

  • A degree in a relevant field such as Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related discipline is mandatory together with a strong foundation in STEM subjects.
  • Experience of working on large-scale software projects.
  • Fluency in English.
  • Good communication skills, flexible and adaptable, collaborative, enthusiastic with a high level of energy, self–motivation, resilience, drive and initiative.
  • Availability to possible business trips.
  • Proficiency in analytical thinking and problem-solving is crucial. This includes the ability to collect, clean, analyze, and interpret data effectively. Familiarity with statistical concepts and methods, as well as experience with data manipulation and visualization, would be advantageous.

Title: AI Training Analyst
Description:
Outlier aiuta le aziende più innovative del mondo a migliorare i loro modelli di intelligenza artificiale fornendo feedback umano. Sei un ingegnere del software esperto che vorrebbe mettere a disposizione la propria competenza in programmazione per addestrare modelli di IA?

Collaboriamo con organizzazioni per addestrare grandi modelli linguistici di IA, aiutando i modelli generativi avanzati a scrivere codice migliore. I progetti generalmente includono problemi discreti e altamente variabili, che richiedono di interagire con questi modelli mentre apprendono la programmazione. Non è richiesta alcuna esperienza precedente con l'IA.

Informazioni Sull’opportunità

Outlier è alla ricerca di programmatori talentuosi per contribuire al training di modelli di intelligenza artificiale generativa.

Questa opportunità freelance è completamente remota e offre orari flessibili, permettendoti di lavorare quando ti è più comodo.

Come Puoi Contribuire


Creando e rispondendo a domande relative all'informatica per aiutare a formare i modelli di IA.
Valutando e classificando il codice generato dai modelli di IA.


Esempi Di Competenze Desiderate


Essere attualmente iscritto o aver completato una laurea triennale o superiore in informatica presso un'istituzione rinomata.
Competenza in uno o più dei seguenti linguaggi di programmazione: Java, Python, JavaScript / TypeScript, C++, Swift, Verilog.
Capacità di spiegare concetti complessi in modo fluente in italiano.
Eccellente attenzione ai dettagli, compresi grammatica, punteggiatura e linee guida stilistiche.


Pagamento


Attualmente, le tariffe orarie per il lavoro su progetti principali eseguito da esperti di programmazione variano tra $25 e $50 USD.
Le tariffe possono variare in base alle competenze, alla valutazione delle abilità, alla posizione, alle necessità del progetto e ad altri fattori. Ad esempio, tariffe più elevate possono essere offerte a chi possiede un dottorato di ricerca. Per lavori non principali, come la fase di onboarding iniziale o il lavoro straordinario, possono essere applicate tariffe inferiori. Alcuni progetti offrono anche incentivi economici. Ti invitiamo a consultare i termini di pagamento specifici per ogni progetto.


PLEASE NOTE: We collect, retain and use personal data for our professional business purposes, including notifying you of opportunities that may be of interest and sharing with our affiliates. We limit the personal data we collect to that which we believe is appropriate and necessary to manage applicants’ needs, provide our services, and comply with applicable laws. Any information we collect in connection with your application will be treated in accordance with the Outlier Privacy Policy and our internal policies and programs designed to protect personal data.

This is a 1099 contract opportunity on the Outlier.ai platform. Because this is a freelance opportunity, we do not offer internships, sponsorship, or employment. You must be authorized to work in your country of residence. If you are an international student, you may be able to sign up for Outlier if you are on a visa. You should contact your tax and/or immigration advisor with specific questions regarding your circumstances.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
🚀 Join Movify – Where elevation starts with a vision!




At Movify, we don’t just adapt to change; we drive it. As a consultancy company in Belgium, we specialize in designing, building, and scaling digital experiences that make a meaningful impact. Ready to shape the future of digital experiences?




About the job




🤠 What you'll be doing

Design and implement machine learning models to solve complex business problems
Develop data pipelines and workflows for large-scale data processing
Perform exploratory data analysis to uncover patterns and insights
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business challenges and define data science objectives
Create and maintain predictive models, optimization algorithms, and statistical analyses
Communicate findings and recommendations through compelling visualizations and reports
Stay current with advancements in machine learning and data science methodologies
Test, validate, and fine-tune models for accuracy and scalability
Work closely with data engineers to ensure data integrity and availability
Contribute to the development of the company’s data strategy and best practices




🤓 Skills & qualifications

3+ years of experience in a data science or related role
Proficiency in Python or R, with a strong understanding of data manipulation libraries (e.g., pandas, NumPy)
Hands-on experience with machine learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn)
Strong knowledge of SQL and experience working with large datasets
Solid understanding of statistical analysis, hypothesis testing, and probability
Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) and version control systems (e.g., Git)
Ability to communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders
A proactive and innovative mindset with attention to detail
Fluent in French or Dutch with good command of English
A passion for turning data into actionable insights




😍 Movify offers

Cutting-edge projects at the intersection of technology and business
Continuous learning opportunities, including certifications and workshops
A dynamic and agile environment that fosters creativity and innovation
A team of passionate experts who thrive on collaboration
Flexible working conditions with a strong emphasis on work-life balance
Competitive compensation with performance-based incentives
State-of-the-art tools, resources, and facilities
A supportive and inclusive culture that values every voice
Regular team-building activities and celebrations to keep the energy high

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Freelance Data Scientist (Financial Sector) – Brussels (Hybrid, 12 Months)

Overview

We are seeking an experienced Freelance Data Scientist to support our financial analytics and machine learning initiatives in Brussels. This is a 12-month contract with the potential for extension. The ideal candidate will apply data science, AI, and predictive modeling to enhance financial decision-making, risk assessment, and customer insights.




Key Responsibilities

Develop and implement machine learning models for financial forecasting, risk analysis, and fraud detection.
Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) on large financial datasets to extract meaningful insights.
Work with structured and unstructured data from multiple sources, ensuring quality and consistency.
Build and optimize predictive models, including time-series forecasting, credit scoring, and anomaly detection.
Automate data pipelines and improve data workflows for real-time analytics.
Collaborate with finance, risk, compliance, and IT teams to align data science initiatives with business goals.
Create clear visualizations and reports to communicate findings to stakeholders.
Ensure data privacy, security, and compliance with financial regulations (Basel III, IFRS, MiFID II).




Required Skills & Qualifications

Technical Skills

Strong proficiency in Python or R for data science and machine learning.
Experience with machine learning frameworks (Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Strong understanding of financial statistics, risk modeling, and time-series analysis.
Hands-on experience with SQL and relational databases.
Knowledge of Big Data technologies (Spark, Hadoop) and cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure) is a plus.
Familiarity with MLOps practices for deploying and monitoring ML models.

Soft Skills

Strong problem-solving and analytical thinking.
Ability to communicate complex findings to non-technical stakeholders.
Self-motivated and able to work independently and in cross-functional teams.
Attention to detail, especially regarding financial data accuracy.

Preferred Experience

Previous experience in the financial sector (banking, insurance, fintech).
Knowledge of financial regulations (Basel III, IFRS, MiFID II).
Experience in credit risk modeling, fraud detection, and algorithmic trading.




Contract Details

Location: Brussels (Hybrid – On-site & Remote)
Duration: 12 months (with possibility of extension)
Type: Freelance Contract
Start Date: ASAP
Compensation: Competitive, based on experience




If you are interested, feel free to apply with your CV or email me directly at adam@kodastaff.com

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
We’re looking for specialists in Computer Vision, large Language Models (LLMs), and AI-powered Chatbots to advance advanced machine learning initiatives and deliver impactful solutions. This role offers the opportunity to work on pioneering projects in a dynamic and fast-moving industry that pushes the boundaries of AI and automation.




Just so you know, this client operates within the Adult Entertainment space.




Machine Learning Engineer

Location: Fully Remote

Salary: up to €180,000 (dependant on experience)




What You’ll Be Doing:

Designing, developing, and deploying cutting-edge machine learning models to enhance user experience and engagement.
Working on either Computer Vision (e.g., object detection, image recognition) or LLMs & AI Chatbots (e.g., conversational AI, natural language processing).
Optimizing and fine-tuning models for performance, scalability, and real-time applications.
Collaborating with cross-functional teams to integrate AI solutions into existing systems.
Conducting research and staying up to date with advancements in machine learning and AI technologies.
Managing large datasets and leveraging data pipelines for efficient processing and training.
Ensuring ethical AI implementation, focusing on privacy, security, and responsible data usage.




What We’re Looking For:

Strong experience in machine learning, with expertise in either Computer Vision or LLMs/NLP & AI chatbots.
Proficiency in Python and machine learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Hugging Face, OpenCV).
Experience with deep learning models, fine-tuning, and optimization.
Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure) and MLOps best practices.
Ability to work autonomously in a fully remote setting while collaborating with a distributed team.
Strong problem-solving skills and a passion for pushing the limits of AI innovation.




What’s In It For You?

Competitive Salary based on experience.
Fully Remote Role – Work from anywhere.
Exciting AI Projects – Be at the forefront of machine learning innovation.
Career Growth & Development – Expand your expertise in a rapidly evolving industry.
Collaborative & Creative Environment – Work with like-minded professionals in a forward-thinking space.




If you’re ready to take on an exciting challenge and work with an industry leader in AI-driven solutions, apply today via Digital Waffle!

HTML:
We’re looking for specialists in Computer Vision, large Language Models (LLMs), and AI-powered Chatbots to advance advanced machine learning initiatives and deliver impactful solutions. This role offers the opportunity to work on pioneering projects in a dynamic and fast-moving industry that pushes the boundaries of AI and automation.


Just so you know, this client operates within the Adult Entertainment space.


Machine Learning Engineer

Location: Fully Remote

Salary: up to €180,000 (dependant on experience)


What You’ll Be Doing:

  • Designing, developing, and deploying cutting-edge machine learning models to enhance user experience and engagement.
  • Working on either Computer Vision (e.g., object detection, image recognition) or LLMs & AI Chatbots (e.g., conversational AI, natural language processing).
  • Optimizing and fine-tuning models for performance, scalability, and real-time applications.
  • Collaborating with cross-functional teams to integrate AI solutions into existing systems.
  • Conducting research and staying up to date with advancements in machine learning and AI technologies.
  • Managing large datasets and leveraging data pipelines for efficient processing and training.
  • Ensuring ethical AI implementation, focusing on privacy, security, and responsible data usage.


What We’re Looking For:

  • Strong experience in machine learning, with expertise in either Computer Vision or LLMs/NLP & AI chatbots.
  • Proficiency in Python and machine learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Hugging Face, OpenCV).
  • Experience with deep learning models, fine-tuning, and optimization.
  • Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure) and MLOps best practices.
  • Ability to work autonomously in a fully remote setting while collaborating with a distributed team.
  • Strong problem-solving skills and a passion for pushing the limits of AI innovation.


What’s In It For You?

  • Competitive Salary based on experience.
  • Fully Remote Role – Work from anywhere.
  • Exciting AI Projects – Be at the forefront of machine learning innovation.
  • Career Growth & Development – Expand your expertise in a rapidly evolving industry.
  • Collaborative & Creative Environment – Work with like-minded professionals in a forward-thinking space.


If you’re ready to take on an exciting challenge and work with an industry leader in AI-driven solutions, apply today via Digital Waffle!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Job Location

Brussels

Job Description

Do you want to belong to one of the most advanced Data Science groups in the industry, developing advanced AI, ML and optimization algorithms, and applying Operations Research techniques?

Do you have passion for technology and desire to learn and grow continuously?

A career in IT Data Science & Analytics at P&G will build your Data Science and Analytics skills, develop your ability to influence and think strategically and will provide you a breadth of experience across multiple internal businesses and type of work (whether you do Analytics for Marketing, Sales, Supply Chain).

As a Data Scientist for the Supply Chain you will belong to an award-winning Analytics / Operations Research community that is global in scope, and operates across P&G’s supply chains.

Find out more about IT at P&G at www.youtube.com/watch?v=1ial3aeA9SE .

YOUR CONTRIBUTION TO P&G’S SUCCESS:

Our Data Scientists in IT Data & Analytics at P&G are:


Passionate about Analytics: the ability to mine terabytes of data, develop models and algorithms to derive actionable insights, and then translate those insights into business is important in our work. In this role you will provide consulting services to P&G business units in Europe, India, Middle East and Africa; you will use mathematical modelling, decision analysis and simulation to provide business insights to various aspects of the supply network (supply chain design, inventory modelling, capacity analysis, distribution flow and purchasing analytics). You will get to know a wide variety of supply chains and you will influence multi million-dollar decisions. You will act as primary enthusiast for the power of technology, data, and predictive and prescriptive analysis.
Effective communicators, self-driven and able to drive insights into actions that improve business results. Interpersonal and communication skills are crucial to thrive in a multi-functional leadership team. Your job is to communicate complex data or algorithms into simple conclusions that will empower others to act based on the insights you derive.
Technically Capable: Data Scientists “roll up their sleeves”, using data visualization (Spotfire, Tableau), and analytic tools (R, Python, SAS, JMP, Hive/Impala, etc.) to grasp the business building insights in our mountains of data. You should be adept at applying such technologies for solving ad hoc business problems, innovating on potential future solutions, and working with technology partners to translate your innovations into robust, scaled, analytic solutions.


Job Qualifications

YOU ARE THE RIGHT FIT IF YOU ARE/HAVE:


A Master in a quantitative degree (Operation Research, Statistics, Systems Engineering, Decision Sciences, Computer Science, Applied Math, Economics etc.);
English fluency;
Strong technical & analytical skill (R, SAS, SQL, optimization, simulation, predictive modeling etc);
Great leadership skills, problem solving and priority setting;
Excellent collaboration skills and working comfortably across teams;
have passion to transform how decisions are made through adhoc & scaled application of analytics;
preferably have some experience in CPG (FMCG), supply chain, analytics or consulting; can demonstrate success at deriving insight from data and effectively communicating those insights to drive action.


YOUR ADVANTAGES:


A fixed contract, with an attractive compensation package;
Competitive pay, including monthly salary, 13th month at the end of the year as well as an annual variable bonus.
A flexible benefits plan to customize to your personal needs and kilometer allowance/public transport reduction;
Hospitalization plan after 6 months of employment, pension plan, life insurance plan, long term illness insurance and stock purchase plan;
Access to Benefits at work platform: A large benefits platform with employee discounts on renowned shops and online commercial platforms as well as on leisure activities and well-known amusement parks;
Working in an international and inclusive environment, with diverse and supporting colleagues.
Continuous self-development via coaching, trainings and a general Growth Mindset working environment;
A vibrant and modern working environment, supporting employees’ wellbeing:
Subsidized company restaurant;
On-site vibrant Café for breaks and less formal meetings;
On-site fitness room and possibility to join regular group sport activities;
Flexibility in terms of working hours and remote working for a good balance between personal needs and the job to be done.
Employee Assistance Program: free professional counseling services, work-life resources, and mental health support.
Supporting employees’ commute: plenty of parking facilities for both cars and bikes, shower facilities, shuttle between Heizel metro and the office, carpooling community.


ARE YOU EXCITED ABOUT THE ROLE? DEEP DIVE INTO P&G AND CHECK THE BELOW INSIGHTFUL LINKS:


Our hiring process consists of three main steps: 1) application, 2) online assessments and 3) interviews. Click here to get all the tips to be fully prepared.
P&G is driven to make life better, not just within the company, but across the globe. Click here to check out how we make a meaningful impact on the world.
We are the world’s largest consumer goods company. Click here to discover about our iconic brands.


At P&G #weseeequal

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. At P&G, we strive to build a culture where everyone feels welcome, included, and able to bring their full selves to work.

We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process. Please click here if you require an accommodation during the application process. Please make sure to wait to hear back from us regarding your accommodation before proceeding with the online assessment, we thank you in advance for your patience.

Title: Data Scientist (AI & Analytics Focus)
Description:
Spektrum have a wide range of exciting opportunities in several global locations.

We are always looking to add great new talent to our team and look forward to hearing from you.

Spektrum supports apex purchasers (NATO, UN, EU, and National Government and Defence) and their Tier 1 supplier ecosystem with a wide range of specialist services. We provide our clients with professional services, specialised aerospace and defence sales, delivery, and operational subject matter expertise. We are looking for personnel to join our team and support key client projects.

Who We Are Supporting

The NATO Communication and Information Agency (NCIA) is responsible for providing secure and effective communications and information technology (IT) services to NATO's member countries and its partners. The agency was established in 2012 and is headquartered in Brussels, Belgium.

The NCIA provides a wide range of services, including:


Cyber Security: The NCIA provides advanced cybersecurity solutions to protect NATO's communication networks and information systems against cyber threats.
Command and Control Systems: The NCIA develops and maintains the systems used by NATO's military commanders to plan and execute operations.
Satellite Communications: The NCIA provides satellite communications services to enable secure and reliable communications between NATO forces.
Electronic Warfare: The NCIA provides electronic warfare services to support NATO's mission to detect, deny, and defeat threats to its communication networks.
Information Management: The NCIA manages NATO's information technology infrastructure, including its databases, applications, and servers.


Overall, the NCIA plays a critical role in ensuring the security and effectiveness of NATO's communication and information technology capabilities.

The program

Assistance and Advisory Service (AAS)

The NATO Communications and Information Agency (NCI Agency) is NATO’s principal C3 capability deliverer and CIS service provider. It provides, maintains and defends the NATO enterprise-wide information technology infrastructure to enable Allies to consult together under Article IV, and, when required, stand together in the face of attack under Article V.

To provide these critical services, in the modern evolving dynamic environment the NCI Agency needs to build and maintain high performance-engaged workforce. The NCI Agency workforce strategically consists of three major categorise's: NATO International Civilians (NIC)'s, Military (Mil), and Interim Workforce Consultants (IWC)'s. The IWCs are a critical part of the overall NCI Agency workforce and make up approximately 15 percent of the total workforce.

Role Background

The NATO Information and Communication Agency (NCIA) located in The Hague, Netherlands, is currently involved in the development and support of new and existing capabilities for NATO. In light of these activities, within NCIA Chief Technology Office, the Exploiting Data Science and Artificial Intelligence (EDS&AI) Team has as primary goal to ensure that Big Data and AI can be used to make better and faster decisions. In leveraging the volume of big data, EDS&AI team aims to turn data overload into decision dominance. Inside NATO, leaders in different functions need support for their decision making. EDS&AI brings the expertise to exploit the vast and varied data available for extracting insights, and we achieve that by using both cloud computing and the Agency’s high performance computing sandbox. The EDS&AI team provide the core data science skills and technology needed for big data analysis and AI. The EDS&AI team applies innovative technology to data whenever it is not possible to extract value with conventional approaches.

Role Duties And Responsibilities


Apply available data and tools to deliver data analytics and data science products, such as data visualization dashboards and implement the dashboards in a production environment on NATO classified networks.
Design of automated data integration, analytics and data science models for selected use cases, including defining requirements, proposing data sources and machine-learning algorithms to use, and designing data visualisation product.
Further development and enhancement of the Data Exploitation and AI Programme Synch Dashboard to include, e.g. automated data ingestion. Deployment into the NATO business networks to enable access and maintenance by NATO staff across the Enterprise, with a focus on HQ.
Independently validate external data and reports on data quality.
Deliver and refine initial data analytics and visualisation products.
Presentation of data visualization products to user communities and subsequent product refinement based on user feedback.
Training staff on the use of dashboards and available data analytics and data science tools.
Close engagement with the NCIA EDS&AI team in The Hague through digital collaboration tools, plus one day in The Hague every second sprint1.
Produce sprint completion reports (format: e-mail update, see Section 4), which include detail of activities performed.
Participate in meetings and boards on as-needed basis, or as requested by NCI Agency.


Essential Skills And Experience


At least 3 years’ of practical experience in the field of data science and/ or data analytics;
Experience using business intelligence and visualization tools (e.g. ArcGIS (Insights, Dashboards, Web Experience, Knowledge), PowerBI, Tableau), data programming skills (e.g. Python, R, Neo4j’s Cypher, and SQL)
Experience using data visualization/analytics software packages and development environments, such as ArcGIS (Pro, Notebooks), KNIME, AWS, MS Azure, or similar;
Experience in data validation and ability to evaluate the quality and effectiveness of data sourced for analysis;
Experience of data analysis in geo-spatial, resilience, political decision-making, military C2, hybrid threats.
Have an in-depth knowledge of the execution of tasks similar to the ones specified, including data mining, pre-processing of structured and unstructured data, data analysis and visualization, dashboard development, employment of data algorithms, NLP, and machine-learning, as well as understanding broader issues concerning the responsible development and employment of Artificial Intelligence;
Excellent drafting, communication and presentation skills in English, including at senior level.
Knowledge of NATO responsibilities and organization, including NCIA, IS, IMS, ACO and ACT.
Experience Strong organizational and multitasking abilities;
High attention to detail and accuracy;
Strong interpersonal skills to coordinate effectively with multiple stakeholders;
Knowledge of NATO responsibilities and organization, including INFOSEC/COMSEC procedures.


Education


BSc/BA in Computer Science, Engineering or relevant field.
A higher degree in Data Science is preferred.


Working Location


Brussels, Belgium


Working Policy


On-Site


Travel


Some travel to other NATO sites may be required


Security Clearance


Valid National or NATO Secret personal security clearance


We never know what new opportunities might be just over the horizon. If this opportunity isn't for you please feel free to send us your resume anyway and be the first to know if something suitable for your skills and experience comes up.

  • Deliver and refine initial data analytics and visualisation products.
  • Presentation of data visualization products to user communities and subsequent product refinement based on user feedback.
  • Training staff on the use of dashboards and available data analytics and data science tools.
  • Close engagement with the NCIA EDS&AI team in The Hague through digital collaboration tools, plus one day in The Hague every second sprint1.

Essential Skills And Experience

  • Experience using business intelligence and visualization tools (e.g. ArcGIS (Insights, Dashboards, Web Experience, Knowledge), PowerBI, Tableau), data programming skills (e.g. Python, R, Neo4j’s Cypher, and SQL)
  • Experience using data visualization/analytics software packages and development environments, such as ArcGIS (Pro, Notebooks), KNIME, AWS, MS Azure, or similar;
  • Experience in data validation and ability to evaluate the quality and effectiveness of data sourced for analysis;
  • Experience of data analysis in geo-spatial, resilience, political decision-making, military C2, hybrid threats.

  • Excellent drafting, communication and presentation skills in English, including at senior level.

  • Experience Strong organizational and multitasking abilities;

  • Strong interpersonal skills to coordinate effectively with multiple stakeholders;

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
О компании и проекте:

Компания-разработчик всемирно известного браузера в поисках специалиста Data Scientist.

Продукт компании стал символом безопасности и инноваций, завоевав доверие миллионов пользователей по всему миру. Он позволяет скрывать информацию о посещаемых страницах, блокировать трекеры и рекламу, а также оснащен инновационной функцией VPN.

Присоединившись к международной команде, вы станете частью ее главной миссии, а Ваш вклад будет важным шагом в создании совершенного продукта, который делает Интернет безопасным и удобным местом для каждого пользователя.

Компания предлагает возможность долгосрочного сотрудничества, где вы сможете развиваться вместе с ней и принести свой вклад в развитие продукта мирового значения.

Вам предлагается удаленное сотрудничество или работа в офисе компании на Кипре, где Вы сможете наслаждаться не только работой, но и потрясающей культурой и теплым климатом.

Задачи на позиции:


Решение прикладных бизнес-задач, связанных с развитием продукта и улучшением пользовательского опыта
Участие в создании инновационного решения: масштабный, многопрофильный проект с использованием современных технологий, таких как computer vision, ML Ops, LLM
Вклад в разработку творческих и комплексных инструментов, направленных на достижение стратегических целей компании



Requirements


1-2+ года опыта в data science / machine learning
Глубокое теоретическое понимание современных архитектур машинного обучения, особенно transformers и neural networks
Подтвержденный опыт разработки и внедрения моделей машинного обучения в производственных средах
Опыт в области математического моделирования и оптимизации
Степень магистра в области прикладной математики, информатики, физики
Английский B1+



Будет плюсом, если у Вас есть:


Опыт развертывания модели на устройстве для мобильных платформ (iOS/Android)
Практический опыт с методами оптимизации моделей (quantization, pruning, distillation)
Опыт в обучении и тонкой настройке LLM
Опыт разработки и внедрения рекомендательных систем
Опыт работы с ограниченными ресурсами ML-сред (edge devices, tiny LLMs)
Понимание технологий обслуживания моделей ML (например, vLLM)



Benefits

Достойная официальная заработная плата, основанная на вашей квалификации и опыте до 5000 EUR gross

100% удаленка или работа в офисе в центре Лимассола, на Кипре

21 рабочий день отпуска + 10 рабочих больничных дней "без справок"

Карьерный рост и профессиональное развитие в быстрорастущем проекте
Show more

Задачи на позиции:

  • Решение прикладных бизнес-задач, связанных с развитием продукта и улучшением пользовательского опыта
  • Участие в создании инновационного решения: масштабный, многопрофильный проект с использованием современных технологий, таких как computer vision, ML Ops, LLM
  • Вклад в разработку творческих и комплексных инструментов, направленных на достижение стратегических целей компании


Requirements

  • 1-2+ года опыта в data science / machine learning
  • Глубокое теоретическое понимание современных архитектур машинного обучения, особенно transformers и neural networks
  • Подтвержденный опыт разработки и внедрения моделей машинного обучения в производственных средах
  • Опыт в области математического моделирования и оптимизации
  • Степень магистра в области прикладной математики, информатики, физики
  • Английский B1+


Будет плюсом, если у Вас есть:

  • Опыт развертывания модели на устройстве для мобильных платформ (iOS/Android)
  • Практический опыт с методами оптимизации моделей (quantization, pruning, distillation)
  • Опыт в обучении и тонкой настройке LLM
  • Опыт разработки и внедрения рекомендательных систем
  • Опыт работы с ограниченными ресурсами ML-сред (edge devices, tiny LLMs)
  • Понимание технологий обслуживания моделей ML (например, vLLM)


Benefits

Достойная официальная заработная плата, основанная на вашей квалификации и опыте до 5000 EUR gross

100% удаленка или работа в офисе в центре Лимассола, на Кипре

21 рабочий день отпуска + 10 рабочих больничных дней "без справок"

Карьерный рост и профессиональное развитие в быстрорастущем проекте

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
About the Company

Our client is an innovative real estate company committed to enhancing the way people interact with the real estate market. Their mission is to leverage cutting-edge technology to provide exceptional user experiences. They are building a state-of-the-art large language model (LLM) function for their website to revolutionize customer interactions and simplify property searches.




Role Overview

The client is seeking a highly skilled Machine Learning Engineer to develop, implement, and optimize a large language model for their platform. The role involves creating intelligent, user-focused solutions that transform the Real Estate experience. This position is fully remote, requiring availability during EU business hours.




Key Responsibilities

Design, develop, and deploy LLM-based features tailored to the client's real estate platform.
Implement Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) techniques to enhance LLM performance and relevance.
Fine-tune pre-trained models (e.g., GPT, Llama, etc.) to meet specific business and user needs.
Integrate LLM capabilities into the client's website to enable natural language search, chatbot functionality, and personalized property recommendations.
Collaborate with front-end and back-end development teams to ensure seamless integration of AI-powered solutions.
Optimize model performance for speed, accuracy, and cost-efficiency.
Conduct thorough testing and validation to ensure reliability and scalability.
Stay informed of the latest advancements in machine learning and natural language processing.




Key Skills & Qualifications

Proven experience in developing and deploying machine learning and NLP models, particularly large language models.
Strong expertise in Python and ML frameworks/libraries such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Hugging Face Transformers.
Hands-on experience with fine-tuning pre-trained LLMs for specific applications.
Knowledge of Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) and its implementation.
Familiarity with APIs and integration of AI solutions into web applications.
Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, Google Cloud, or Azure for deploying ML models.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a results-driven approach.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, especially in remote team environments.

Show more

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
As an Data Scientist, you will play a key role in developing end-to-end solutions for AI use cases. By taking up a use case right from the start you will help business define and scope the problem, pick the right ML solution and technology as well as ensure implementation, integration and deployment of your solution to production. You will do so while ensuring that our internal governance processes and best practices are respected. You will also collaborate with other team members in knowledge sharing as well as continuously improving our way of working.

Responsibilities

  • Develop AI applications using state-of-the-art (Gen)AI technology;
  • Translate business requests into AI applications;
  • Identify high-value use cases through data exploration and visualization;
  • Pilot prototypes in production processes to demonstrate their value;
  • Deploy prototypes to production, with support of IT, to obtain reliable, scalable systems;
  • Present your results in a clear manner and discuss them with multi-functional project teams;
  • Work in close collaboration with business experts (e.g. for requirement gathering, data source identification, data and process understanding, feature engineering, result validation, etc.), with IT (e.g. for ETL, deployment to production, etc.) and with other AI engineers in the team (e.g. for knowledge sharing).

Profile

  • PhD or Master's degree in a quantitative field (Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, etc.)
  • 3+ years of relevant work experience in a business environment

Technical Skills

  • Hands-on experience with Python and its AI ecosystem;
  • Strong knowledge of state-of-the-art AI and statistical methods;
  • Experience with cloud technology (Azure);
  • Experience using LLM’s and commonly used libraries to interact with LLM’s (Langchain, Llamaindex, ...) is an asset;
  • Proven proficiency in the end-to-end AI project life cycle, including:
  • Translating business requests into data requirements.
  • Identifying high-value use cases through data exploration and visualization.
  • Developing AI solutions (incl. feature engineering, model fitting, etc.).
  • Deploying scalable AI applications to production.
  • Any experience with following elements is a plus:
  • MLOps practices, e.g. orchestration with Airflow, Gitlab CI/CD, etc.

Attitudes/Behavior

  • Passionate about AI and a constant learner;
  • Result-oriented and highly proficient in transforming data into actionable insights that create business value;
  • Team player with strong communication and presentation skills;
  • Able to manage AI projects in an autonomous way and drive collaboration with domain experts, data engineers and other AI engineers;
  • Knowledge in the field of telecommunications is a plus.

Languages

  • Fluent in Dutch and/or French (mandatory) + Fluent in English.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
NORRIQ is an international group based in Denmark and Belgium, comprising over 350 consultants dedicated to unlocking the full business potential of companies through technology and digital transformation.

We have a specialized Financial Services practice that is experiencing rapid growth. Over 100 consultants focus exclusively on the financial services sector, assisting banks and insurances in redesigning their operations to meet changing client expectations, adopt new technologies, and adhere to evolving regulations (DORA, RIS, AI Act, AML, KYC, etc).

At NORRIQ, our employees are at the heart of our organization and our success.. We hire and nurture passionate individuals who strive for excellence for both our clients and colleagues. Our culture supports personal and professional growth with training, opportunities, and creative freedom. Regardless of when you join or how long you stay, you'll experience an unforgettable NORRIQ journey and become a part of our extended family. Connected forever!

Role Overview

As an MLOps Engineer/AI Engineer, you will play a critical role in bridging the gap between Data Science and IT operations. Your primary responsibility will be to deploy, monitor, and optimize machine learning models and AI applications, ensuring seamless integration into the organization’s infrastructure. You will also contribute to lifecycle management, scalability, and performance optimization of AI systems.

Key Responsibilities


Model Deployment: Collaborate with Data Scientists to deploy optimized models for production, ensuring adherence to best practices for security, scalability, and reliability.
Data Pipeline Management: Design and implement automated and efficient data pipelines to support continuous integration and deployment (CI/CD).
Environment Setup: Assist teams in setting up projects by managing dependencies, configuring environments, and integrating tooling for code quality, testing, and deployment.
Data Flow Design: Establish and maintain seamless data flows between sources such as Cloud Storage, SQL databases, and other platforms to support AI applications.
Lifecycle Management: Oversee the lifecycle of AI applications, including performance monitoring, regular updates, incident management, and troubleshooting.
Kubernetes Orchestration: Use Kubernetes to manage and streamline the deployment of containerized components, ensuring efficient resource utilization and system reliability.
Incident Management: Promptly handle incidents, troubleshoot issues, and communicate updates to stakeholders while conducting root-cause analyses and post-mortems.
Innovation and Optimization: Explore innovative solutions to enhance AI capabilities and streamline model integration processes.


Requirements

Education


Master’s degree in Computer Science or a related field.
Substantial knowledge in Programming, System Engineering, or DevOps is highly valued.


Technical Expertise


Strong proficiency in Python.
Hands-on experience with REST APIs and Git version control.
Proven expertise in MLOps/DevOps, including CI/CD pipeline automation.
Familiarity with containerization tools (e.g., Docker) and orchestration systems (e.g., Kubernetes).
Knowledge of software testing practices and Linux operating systems.
Nice to have : SQL, PostgreSQL, Mlflow, Helm charts.


Soft Skills


Collaborative and team-oriented mindset.
Proactive, results-driven, and adaptable in a dynamic environment.
Strong communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills.


Language Proficiency


Fluent in English (spoken and written).
Additional knowledge of other languages is a plus.


Why Joining Us?


You will be part of a fast growing international company with a unique people culture
A very competitive salary package including a company car, iPhone and different allowances
You will get extensive trainings in Belgium and Denmark on technical matters, as well as soft skills and project management, and you will have access to new technologies and innovative equipment.
You will join a dynamic and growing team with a great mix of young and experienced professionals focusing on financial services.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Permanent position only




WHAT IS CREAM ALL ABOUT?

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency…but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business & Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.




CREAM’S SPECIAL RECIPE:

1/3 of Personal development
1/3 of Collective Intelligence
1/3 of Intrapreneurship

Bonus ingredient: … Some passionate colleagues 😀




WHAT IS A DATA SCIENTIST AT CREAM?

As Robin, Data Scientist, you will have a key role in the implementation of innovative data models to solve specific business issues. You will be part of a challenging and multidisciplinary team. You will discover various industries.




YOUR TASKS:

You gather business requirements to better understand your client’s needs
You dive in a large amount of data to discover is hidden
You provide data-driven recommendations to the client
Based on your client’s needs, you apply predictive analysis and machine learning
You bring out concrete and predictive models
At the end, you help the business to better optimize the use of their data
data




HOW DO WE IMAGINE OUR FUTURE CONSULTANT?

You have at least 2 years of experience in Data Science
You want to learn more about Machine Learning, Robotics Process Automation (RPA)…
You are used to work with one of the following technologies : MATLAB, R, SAS, Python, Java …
You have good communication and synthesis skills
You are fluent in French and English; a good knowledge of Dutch is an asset




WHY SHOULD YOU TASTE CREAM/THE LIME FLAVOUR?

A broad diversity of career options: you’re not stuck in a box
You evolve in a learning environment where you can challenge your knowledge with your colleagues
You grow in a company that is at the leading edge of technology
You have the opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving company
We have values we share, live with, experiment every day

We just hire great people and give them the playing field to become awesome!




"THE LITTLE THING THAT CAN MAKE THE DIFFERENCE,

CREAM IS DEVELOPING A DIVERSITY PLAN AND WOULD LIKE THAT ALL ITS MEMBERS REFLECT THE SOCIETY IN ALL ITS DIVERSITY"

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Are you a Machine Learning Engineer with strong Python, MLOps, and DevOps skills? Do you thrive in a data-driven environment?




Join our client’s team and help build, deploy, and optimize AI models!




Your mission

Manage and improve the data science ecosystem (Domino Data Science Platform).
Automate and monitor AI model performance in production.
Support data scientists in best practices, dependencies, and environment setup.
Optimize data pipelines and ensure data quality for AI models.
Explore new AI tools and technologies to unlock innovation.




What you bring

3+ years of experience in ML/DevOps/Data Engineering.
Strong Python skills (pandas, sklearn) and experience with Git, SQL, Bash.
Experience with MLOps/DevOps, containerization (Docker), and cloud is a plus.
Proficiency in English (Dutch/French is a plus).




Ready to make an impact?

Apply now and be part of an AI-powered future!




#MachineLearning #DevOps #AI #Python #MLOps #DataScience #Hiring

Title: Research Engineer - AI - $100k
Description:
We offer a unique opportunity to join a early stage startup, in San Francisco (USA), dedicated to accelerating progress in decentralized AI.




Their mission is to enable global contributions of compute, code, and capital to create cutting-edge, openly accessible AI models. By advancing these technologies, they aim to democratize AI development and make its benefits available to everyone.




They've recently secured a $5.5 million seed round from leading investors and are looking for innovative thinkers to help shape the future of decentralized AI.




Our partner is seeking a Research Engineer to join their team focused on mid-training processes. This role involves shaping technical strategies, optimizing compute usage, and advancing synthetic data solutions.




Core Responsibilities:

Lead research to develop large-scale synthetic data generation pipelines and orchestration solutions.
Optimize AI inference workloads for performance, cost, and resource efficiency using the latest techniques.
Contribute to open-source tools for synthetic data generation and mid-training frameworks.
Publish research at leading AI conferences, including ICML and NeurIPS.
Communicate technical outcomes through blogs tailored for developers and customers.
Stay at the forefront of AI/ML tools and infrastructure, driving platform improvements.




What They Require:

Strong expertise in AI/ML engineering, with experience building pipelines for large-scale model training or inference.
Knowledge of distributed inference frameworks and performance optimization techniques.
Proficiency in MLOps, including model versioning and CI/CD pipelines.




What They Value:

Passion for synthetic data generation and making AI accessible to researchers and developers.
High energy and eagerness to learn and contribute to new areas of development.




Perks:

$80k to $100k with equity and token incentives.
Flexible work options, including remote or in-office opportunities.
Visa sponsorship and relocation assistance for eligible candidates.

Show more

Title: Data Scientist - ML
Description:
RED Global is currently recruiting for a Data Scientist - ML for our client, a global organisation who are scaling up their data capability. They are looking to bring on board an experienced Data Scientist with experience of Machine Learning, GenAI and solution architecture and software engineering.







Key Responsibilities:

Responsible to support and advice various clients to identify and define problems and resolve these complex issues for the business.
You will interact with graph databases through standardized APIs and query languages and work with ETL Prosses.
Use AI techniques such as GenAI, supervised and un-supervised machine learning techniques.
Work across the latest data science platforms (Databricks, Dataiku, AzureML, SageMaker) and frameworks (e.g., Tensorflow, PyTorch, MXNet, scikit-learn).
Support with building and deploying solutions to Cloud (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) including Cloud provisioning tools (e.g., Terraform).
Advising to the business stakeholders on data driven marketing - working closely with third parties and, internally, with digital teams, IT, and others.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English and French/Dutch with good senior-level stakeholder management soft skills and competencies.




Required skills:

3-5 years experiences as a Data Scientist working within global organisations.
Extensive work experience of various Data Science Platforms such as Databricks, Dataiku, AzureML, SageMaker) and frameworks such as Tensorflow, PyTorch, MXNet, scikit-learn.
Experience building and deploying solutions to Cloud (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud).
Must have technical knowledge of Machine Learning (ML) or GenAI.
Industry skills: Manufacturing or Life sciences would be a plus.
Strong analytical skills and appreciation of coding languages, data sources, data matching and data acquisition.

Title: Data Scientist / AI Engineer
Description:
Job Description




My client are at the forefront of technology, specializing in AI-driven solutions within a rapidly evolving industry. Their mission is to push the boundaries of what's possible with AI, especially in sectors where precision and quality are paramount. We are looking for a visionary leader to join their team and drive cutting-edge projects that will shape the future.




They building a next-generation data platform, powered by Databricks on Azure, to support all our data initiatives. The goal is to transition toward a data mesh architecture that offers scalability, flexibility, and seamless access across teams. We believe that fostering collaboration and innovation creates a data-driven culture that empowers everyone to make informed decisions.




What You'll Do

Design and manage our data infrastructure on Databricks and Azure to ensure it is scalable and high-performing.
Work closely with data engineers, data scientists, and stakeholders to create a platform that aligns with various team needs.
Contribute to platform architecture using data mesh principles to enable decentralized data ownership.
Ensure the platform meets security and performance standards, and implement innovative best practices.
Collaborate with other teams to support end-to-end data integration and workflows for multiple data products.
Stay updated on the latest advancements in data platform technology and engineering.

Your Background

3-5 years of experience in data engineering, ideally within a data and analytics setting.
A Master’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, or a similar field.
Strong expertise in Azure and Databricks, including infrastructure as code, data lake storage, and ETL processes.
Excellent problem-solving abilities and a passion for innovation.
Familiarity with data mesh concepts and experience working within decentralized data architectures.
Strong communication and collaboration skills, with a drive to work with cross-functional teams.

What We Offer

We’re committed to creating a supportive, inclusive environment that values personal growth and work-life balance. Here’s what we offer:

An international, diverse workspace with professionals from various fields.
A culture that emphasizes respect, collaboration, and continuous learning.
An extensive onboarding program, with mentorship to help you grow.
Competitive salary, comprehensive health coverage, paid leave, retirement benefits, and flexible work arrangements.

Show more
HTML:
Job Description


My client are at the forefront of technology, specializing in AI-driven solutions within a rapidly evolving industry. Their mission is to push the boundaries of what's possible with AI, especially in sectors where precision and quality are paramount. We are looking for a visionary leader to join their team and drive cutting-edge projects that will shape the future.


They building a next-generation data platform, powered by Databricks on Azure, to support all our data initiatives. The goal is to transition toward a data mesh architecture that offers scalability, flexibility, and seamless access across teams. We believe that fostering collaboration and innovation creates a data-driven culture that empowers everyone to make informed decisions.


What You'll Do

  • Design and manage our data infrastructure on Databricks and Azure to ensure it is scalable and high-performing.
  • Work closely with data engineers, data scientists, and stakeholders to create a platform that aligns with various team needs.
  • Contribute to platform architecture using data mesh principles to enable decentralized data ownership.
  • Ensure the platform meets security and performance standards, and implement innovative best practices.
  • Collaborate with other teams to support end-to-end data integration and workflows for multiple data products.
  • Stay updated on the latest advancements in data platform technology and engineering.

Your Background

  • 3-5 years of experience in data engineering, ideally within a data and analytics setting.
  • A Master’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, or a similar field.
  • Strong expertise in Azure and Databricks, including infrastructure as code, data lake storage, and ETL processes.
  • Excellent problem-solving abilities and a passion for innovation.
  • Familiarity with data mesh concepts and experience working within decentralized data architectures.
  • Strong communication and collaboration skills, with a drive to work with cross-functional teams.

What We Offer

We’re committed to creating a supportive, inclusive environment that values personal growth and work-life balance. Here’s what we offer:

  • An international, diverse workspace with professionals from various fields.
  • A culture that emphasizes respect, collaboration, and continuous learning.
  • An extensive onboarding program, with mentorship to help you grow.
  • Competitive salary, comprehensive health coverage, paid leave, retirement benefits, and flexible work arrangements.

Title: Data Science Specialist
Description:
Data Science / Data Analytics

Contract for 1 year with possible extensions




Apply only if you have a Valid SECRET Security Clearance.




Responsibilities:

Apply available data and tools to deliver data analytics and data science products, such as data visualisation dashboards and implement the dashboards in a production environment.
Design of automated data integration, analytics and data science models for selected use cases, including defining requirements, proposing data sources and machine-learning algorithms to use, and designing data visualisation product.
Further development and enhancement of the Data Exploitation and AI Programme Synch Dashboard to include, e.g. automated data ingestion. Deployment into the business networks to enable access and maintenance by staff across the Enterprise, with a focus on HQ.
Independently validate external data and reports on data quality.
Deliver and refine initial data analytics and visualisation products.
Presentation of data visualization products to user communities and subsequent product refinement based on user feedback.
Training staff on the use of dashboards and available data analytics and data science tools.
Close engagement with the team through digital collaboration tools, plus one day in The Hague every second sprint1 .
Produce sprint completion reports (format: e-mail update, see Section 4), which include detail of activities performed.
Participate in meetings and boards on as-needed basis, or as requested.




Requirements:

BSc/BA in Computer Science, Engineering or relevant field.
A higher degree in Data Science is preferred.
At least 3 years’ of practical experience in the field of data science and/ or data analytics;
Experience using business intelligence and visualization tools (e.g. ArcGIS (Insights, Dashboards, Web Experience, Knowledge), PowerBI, Tableau), data programming skills (e.g. Python, R, Neo4j’s Cypher, and SQL)
Experience using data visualization/analytics software packages and development environments, such as ArcGIS (Pro, Notebooks), KNIME, AWS, MS Azure, or similar;
Experience in data validation and ability to evaluate the quality and effectiveness of data sourced for analysis;
Experience of data analysis in geo-spatial, resilience, political decision-making, military C2, hybrid threats.
Have an in-depth knowledge of the execution of tasks similar to the ones specified in this SOW, including data mining, pre-processing of structured and unstructured data, data analysis and visualization, dashboard development, employment of data algorithms, NLP, and machine-learning, as well as understanding broader issues concerning the responsible development and employment of Artificial Intelligence;
Excellent drafting, communication and presentation skills in English, including at senior level.
Experience Strong organizational and multitasking abilities;
High attention to detail and accuracy;
Strong interpersonal skills to coordinate effectively with multiple stakeholders;
Valid SECRET Security Clearance.

Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer (freelance)
Company: Templeton & Partners - Innovative & Inclusive Hiring Solutions
Description:
We are seeking a Machine Learning Engineer to support the development, deployment, and monitoring of AI models within the Predictive Analytics team. The ideal candidate has a strong background in Python development, MLOps, and data engineering, with a passion for automation and continuous improvement.




Responsibilities




Manage and enhance the execution and quality assurance of monthly AI model production runs, from data preparation to scoring and validation.
Maintain and improve existing Python programs for data collection, validation, AI model scoring, and performance monitoring.
Act as an interface between data scientists and IT, ensuring smooth use of the Domino Data Science Platform and AI building blocks.
Assist data scientists in identifying and installing correct dependencies, ensuring best practices for code quality, automation, and continuous improvement.
Support data engineering tasks, including creating new variables and automating model refitting.
Explore new ways to optimize AI tools and technologies to enhance model performance and deployment capabilities.
Collaborate with a motivated team of data scientists, sharing expertise and driving innovation.




Requirements




At least 3 years of experience in machine learning engineering, data engineering, or MLOps.
Strong expertise in Python development and data science libraries (pandas, sklearn).
Experience with Git, bash scripting, SQL, and MLOps/DevOps practices.
Knowledge of containerization (Docker) and cloud environments is a plus.
Familiarity with SAS, Domino Data Science Platform, Django, and software testing is preferred.
Fluent in English; good command of Dutch is required, with French as a plus.
Degree in a quantitative field such as computer science, or equivalent experience in data science and ML DevOps.
Strong analytical and problem-solving mindset, with a proactive and result-driven approach.




Information:




Working style: Hybrid
Duration: 6 months to begin with + option to extend
Work location: Brussels

Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist - AI/ML (Previous pharmaceuticals experience)

Fully remote - Europe based

1 Year contract




Key Responsibilities:

Design and implement AI/ML models for pharmaceutical applications (e.g., drug discovery, biomarker identification, patient stratification).
Work with large-scale clinical, genomic, and real-world datasets to derive insights.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including biostatisticians and researchers.
Optimize data pipelines and ensure model reproducibility.
Stay updated with industry trends and regulatory considerations in AI-driven healthcare.
Develop and implement NLP and Generative AI products using LLMs.
Identify key LLM/NLP use cases with stakeholders.




Requirements:

Strong experience in AI/ML, deep learning, and statistical modeling.
Background in pharmaceuticals, biotech, or healthcare data.
Proficiency in Python, TensorFlow/PyTorch, and data visualization tools.
Knowledge of best practices in code generation, documentation, data security, and compliance in cloud-based workflows.
Ability to work independently and communicate insights effectively.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Wij zijn op zoek naar een gepassioneerde Machine Learning Engineer die ons helpt het Innovation Lab bij ACA verder uit te bouwen. Iemand die samen met ons wil groeien!




ACA’s Innovation Lab is het nieuwe businessconcept van ACA Group. In ons Innovation Lab groeien innovatieve ideeën uit tot gevalideerde businessconcepten.




Hoe wij (samen)werken

Omdat wij een relatief nieuw team zijn, hanteren we geen ‘business-as-usual’ proces. We werken in een dynamische omgeving die eigenlijk vergelijkbaar is met een start-up binnen een groter geheel. ACA investeert een substantieel deel van haar winst in het “ACA Innovation Lab” zodat er ruimte is om nieuwe ideeën en technologieën af te toetsen.

We hebben bij ACA gekozen voor een proactieve aanpak om innovatie (AI en Machine Learning) bij onze klanten te stimuleren. Dit heeft ons de kans gegeven om samen met onze klanten een aantal nieuwe oplossingen te ontwikkelen door het gebruik van AI en ML.




Waar jij mee aan zal werken (tech & omgeving)

Python & Java
Kubernetes & Kubeflow
AWS / GCP
Jupyter notebooks
Git
Tensorflow
Machine Vision toolkits (YOLO, OpenCV, …)
Wandb
MLFlow




Ben jij de geknipte persoon voor deze rol?

Hard skills

Je hebt minstens 3 jaar relevante ervaring met Machine Learning.
Je hebt ervaring als tech lead in een nieuwe start-up omgeving.
Je hebt een goede kennis van het Engels en/of Nederlands.
Je hebt een goede kennis van software development.
Je flexibel kunnen opstellen in een dynamische werkomgeving. Prioriteiten stellen vormen voor jou dan ook geen probleem.
Ervaring in een test-driven development en Agile omgeving.




Soft skills

Je bezit goede communicatieve vaardigheden.
Je bent een teamplayer, maar je gaat ook graag zelfstandig tewerk.
Je bent proactief ingesteld en gemotiveerd om nieuwe uitdagingen aan te gaan!




Hoe voelt dat, werken bij ACA?

Innovatieve werkomgeving: je werkt met de nieuwste technologie en tools in een omgeving die innovatie uitademt.
Een aantrekkelijk loon, een bedrijfswagen, maaltijdcheques, onkostenvergoeding, MacBook Pro en nog veel meer.
Leren & groeien: bij ACA heeft iedereen een on-the-job coach. Je beschikt over een persoonlijk evolutieplan met een budget voor technische en professionele trainingen en heel wat kansen om bij te leren.
We’ve got your back: we voorzien een uitgebreid gezondheids- en verzekeringsplan om tegemoet te komen aan jouw noden. Het is onze prioriteit om ervoor te zorgen dat onze collega’s gelukkig zijn, o.a. door een goede work-life balans, de juiste tools te voorzien, enzovoort.
Onze unieke bedrijfscultuur: je bent deel van een passioneel en hardwerkend team dat trots is op hun verwezenlijkingen. ACA is een plek waar teamwork, transparantie, kennisdeling en erkenning centraal staan. Trots om ons "Great Place To Work" te noemen!
Jij staat centraal: wij zijn gedreven door onze teamleden waarbij iedereen hun steentje bijdraagt, maar waar plaats is voor heel wat fun. Een fantastisch team werkt niet alleen samen, maar maakt ook samen plezier. Daarom organiseren we heel wat activiteiten binnen en buiten onze kantoren en vertrekken we elk jaar op een spetterend ACA-weekend!

Show more

Title: Data Scientist Senior - H/F (CDI)
Description:
Qui sommes-nous ?

Metrum est une société spécialisée dans l'accompagnement des entreprises dans leur transformation digitale, l'excellence opérationnelle et la gestion du changement. Forts de plus de 20 ans d'expérience, nous aidons nos clients à relever les défis technologiques de demain grâce à des expertises solides en développement, intégration de solutions, gestion de performance, transformation digitale et gouvernance des données. Chez Metrum, nous valorisons la collaboration, l'innovation et une culture d'entreprise conviviale où chaque talent peut s'épanouir.

Si vous êtes passionné par la technologie et motivé par l'excellence, rejoignez notre équipe pour un rôle clé dans l'accompagnement stratégique de nos clients !

Votre rôle

En tant que Data Scientist Senior, vous jouerez un rôle clé dans l'exploitation des données pour transformer les enjeux stratégiques de nos clients en solutions concrètes et innovantes. Vous interviendrez dans toutes les étapes du cycle de vie des projets Data Science, en apportant une expertise technique approfondie et une vision stratégique.

Vos principales missions incluront  :2. Analyse et exploration des données3. Développement de modèles avancés4. Collaboration pour l'industrialisation des solutions5. Veille technologique et innovation6. Encadrement et partage de connaissances


Compréhension et analyse des besoins métiers
Collaborer étroitement avec les équipes métiers et décisionnaires pour comprendre leurs défis et objectifs stratégiques
Traduire les problématiques métiers en cas d'usage concrets et en solutions analytiques exploitables
Identifier les opportunités de création de valeur grâce à l'exploitation des données (optimisation, automatisation, personnalisation, etc.)
Effectuer des analyses exploratoires approfondies pour identifier des tendances, anomalies ou patterns dans les données (data profiling)
Évaluer la qualité et la pertinence des données disponibles en vue de leur utilisation dans des modèles ou algorithmes
Mettre en œuvre des techniques avancées de visualisation pour communiquer efficacement les insights aux parties prenantes
Concevoir, implémenter et optimiser des modèles prédictifs et prescriptifs pour répondre aux problématiques métiers (régression, classification, clustering, optimisation, etc.)
Travailler sur des projets d'IA générative pour des cas d'usage tels que l'exploitation de capital intellectuel, automatisation intelligente,etc
Tester et valider la robustesse des modèles (ex : cross-validation, performance metrics) et ajuster les paramètres pour améliorer leur précision et fiabilité
Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les équipes de data engineers et data architects pour industrialiser les modèles développés
Participer à la mise en place de pipelines de données automatisés pour le déploiement et la maintenance des solutions de Data Science
Garantir l'intégration des modèles dans les systèmes existants, avec une attention particulière à la scalabilité et à la performance
Assurer une veille active sur les technologies émergentes, outils et frameworks en Data Science et IA
Explorer de nouvelles méthodes ou approches pour améliorer les performances des modèles ou répondre à des problématiques complexes
Participer à des conférences, meetups ou formations pour rester à la pointe des avancées dans le domaine
Encadrer et accompagner les data scientists plus juniors dans leur montée en compétences, tant sur les aspects techniques que méthodologiques
Encourager la collaboration et la création d'une dynamique d'apprentissage au sein de l'équipe



Requirements

Votre profil

Vous êtes doté(e) d'une solide expertise en Data Science et faites preuve d'un esprit analytique et d'un excellent sens relationnel. Voici les qualités et compétences recherchées :


Formation et expérience : Diplômé(e) Bac+5 en Management, Économie, Ingénieur, Mathématiques, Physique ou similaire avec au moins 5 ans d'expérience en tant que Data Scientist, idéalement dans différents secteurs, notamment l'industrie
Compétences techniques indispensables :
Maîtrise des concepts de probabilité et statistiques
Maîtrise de la modélisation en machine learning, optimisation, IA generative et traitement de séries de temps
Excellente maîtrise de Python et/ou R pour l'analyse de données
Expérience avec des frameworks de machine learning : scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch
Bonne connaissance des bases de données SQL et NoSQL
Compétences complémentaires qui représentent un plus :
Connaissance en manipulation de grandes masses de données et en programmation (Javascript, Spark, C)
Expérience avec des outils de visualisation de données (Power BI, Tableau, etc.) et des outils Cloud (AWS, GCP, Azure)
Capacités analytiques et organisationnelles : Aptitude à analyser des processus complexes et à vulgariser des résultats d'analyse
Polyvalence linguistique : Excellentes compétences en français et en anglais, tant à l'oral qu'à l'écrit. La maîtrise d'autres langues (allemand, luxembourgeois) est un plus
Soft skills : Autonomie, esprit d'équipe, bonne communication


Benefits

Pourquoi rejoindre Metrum ?


Une entreprise à taille humaine qui valorise le travail en équipe et le développement personnel
L'opportunité de contribuer à des projets stratégiques et innovants
Un cadre collaboratif, bienveillant et stimulant pour progresser dans votre carrière
Une culture qui prône l'équilibre entre vie professionnelle et vie personnelle


Envie de relever le défi ? Envoyez-nous votre candidature dès maintenant et intégrez une équipe passionnée où votre expertise sera pleinement reconnue !
Show more
