  • Assurer une veille active sur les technologies émergentes, outils et frameworks en Data Science et IA
  • Explorer de nouvelles méthodes ou approches pour améliorer les performances des modèles ou répondre à des problématiques complexes
  • Participer à des conférences, meetups ou formations pour rester à la pointe des avancées dans le domaine
  • Encadrer et accompagner les data scientists plus juniors dans leur montée en compétences, tant sur les aspects techniques que méthodologiques
  • Encourager la collaboration et la création d'une dynamique d'apprentissage au sein de l'équipe


Requirements

Votre profil

Vous êtes doté(e) d'une solide expertise en Data Science et faites preuve d'un esprit analytique et d'un excellent sens relationnel. Voici les qualités et compétences recherchées :

  • Formation et expérience : Diplômé(e) Bac+5 en Management, Économie, Ingénieur, Mathématiques, Physique ou similaire avec au moins 5 ans d'expérience en tant que Data Scientist, idéalement dans différents secteurs, notamment l'industrie
  • Compétences techniques indispensables :
    • Maîtrise des concepts de probabilité et statistiques
    • Maîtrise de la modélisation en machine learning, optimisation, IA generative et traitement de séries de temps
    • Excellente maîtrise de Python et/ou R pour l'analyse de données
    • Expérience avec des frameworks de machine learning : scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch
    • Bonne connaissance des bases de données SQL et NoSQL
  • Compétences complémentaires qui représentent un plus :
    • Connaissance en manipulation de grandes masses de données et en programmation (Javascript, Spark, C)
    • Expérience avec des outils de visualisation de données (Power BI, Tableau, etc.) et des outils Cloud (AWS, GCP, Azure)
  • Capacités analytiques et organisationnelles : Aptitude à analyser des processus complexes et à vulgariser des résultats d'analyse
  • Polyvalence linguistique : Excellentes compétences en français et en anglais, tant à l'oral qu'à l'écrit. La maîtrise d'autres langues (allemand, luxembourgeois) est un plus
  • Soft skills : Autonomie, esprit d'équipe, bonne communication

Benefits

Pourquoi rejoindre Metrum ?

  • Une entreprise à taille humaine qui valorise le travail en équipe et le développement personnel
  • L'opportunité de contribuer à des projets stratégiques et innovants
  • Un cadre collaboratif, bienveillant et stimulant pour progresser dans votre carrière
  • Une culture qui prône l'équilibre entre vie professionnelle et vie personnelle

Envie de relever le défi ? Envoyez-nous votre candidature dès maintenant et intégrez une équipe passionnée où votre expertise sera pleinement reconnue !

Title: Data Scientist
Company: Nuitée | Enabling all companies to build travel solutions
Description:
About the company

Founded in 2017, Nuitée makes it easy for businesses to build travel applications securely and quickly, accelerating your revenue growth. We're committed to enhancing the travel planning process and ensuring our technology meets the dynamic needs of our users.

Nuitee is headquartered in Ireland with a tech and operations hub in Casablanca, Morocco and Palma de Mallorca, Spain. Commercial staff are based around the world in the USA, Mexico, Spain, Germany and Argentina.




About the Role:

We are seeking a talented and motivated Data Scientist to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in machine learning, data analysis, and reporting, with experience in travel tech or related domains. You will work on cutting-edge projects involving search optimization, NLP systems, and various machine learning models.




Key Responsibilities:

Develop and implement machine learning models using XGBoost and other classical ML algorithms
Design and maintain data pipelines using Metaflow for efficient model training and deployment
Conduct in-depth data analysis and create comprehensive reports using BigQuery
Contribute to the development of NLP systems and language models
Optimize search algorithms and recommendation systems
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and solve complex business problems
Stay current with the latest advancements in data science and machine learning




Our Ideal Candidate:

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, or a related field
2-4 years of professional experience as a Data Scientist
Strong proficiency in Python and SQL
Extensive experience with data analysis and visualization tools
Proven track record of developing and deploying machine learning models in production environments
Experience with XGBoost and other classical machine learning algorithms
Familiarity with BigQuery for large-scale data analysis and reporting
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent communication skills and ability to present complex findings to non-technical stakeholders




Nice to have:

Experience in the travel tech industry
Hands-on experience with Metaflow for managing data science workflows
Knowledge of NLP techniques and language models
Experience with search optimization and recommendation systems
Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure)
Contributions to open-source projects or research publications in relevant fields







Why Nuitee?

At Nuitee, you’ll be part of an innovative team that thrives on pushing boundaries and defining the future of travel technology. We offer the flexibility of remote work and the opportunity to make significant impacts on a global scale, enhancing the travel experiences for millions of users. Join us and help drive the continuous evolution of our cutting-edge platform.




Be part of a company on the way to becoming the world's leading technology platform for travel.

We're seeking individuals who are eager to embark on this exhilarating journey. Grab the chance to join us and send your application today!

Title: Machine Learning Engineer (Data/Pre-Training)
Description:
Machine Learning Engineer (LLM Data/Pre-Training)

Europe (remote)

€200-300k base salary + equity




About Us

We’re a fast-growing, well-funded startup currently training a foundational LLM. Our mission is to build cutting-edge Large Language Models (LLMs) that empower businesses and developers to solve real-world problems. We’re looking for a Machine Learning Engineer who is excited about designing robust data pipelines, scaling transformer-based models, and leveraging synthetic data techniques to push the boundaries of what’s possible in NLP.




What You’ll Do

Design & Build Data Pipelines: Own the end-to-end process of gathering, cleaning, and curating massive text datasets—including real-world and synthetic data—to fuel LLM pre-training.
Train Large-Scale Models: Implement and optimize large language model training on GPU/TPU clusters.
Leverage Synthetic Data Generation: Explore and develop methods for data augmentation or synthetic text generation to address low-resource domains, bias mitigation, and overall dataset enrichment.
Optimize Performance: Develop strategies for efficient distributed training, memory optimization, and large-scale deployment.
Collaborate Across Teams: Work closely with research scientists, data engineers, and software engineers to deploy, evaluate, and iterate on LLMs.
Experiment & Innovate: Stay at the cutting edge of NLP by testing new architectures, fine-tuning techniques, and data augmentation strategies.




Who You Are

Technical Expert: You have experience with transformer-based models and have built or contributed to large-scale NLP systems.
Data Savvy: Proficient in data wrangling at scale, including experience with Spark, Ray, or similar distributed frameworks.
Synthetic Data Enthusiast: You’ve experimented with synthetic or augmented data to improve model performance and address data scarcity or bias.
ML Tooling Pro: Skilled in PyTorch and/or TensorFlow, with exposure to libraries like Hugging Face Transformers or Megatron-LM.
Performance Oriented: Able to optimize training pipelines for performance, leveraging GPU/TPU-based clusters.
Problem Solver: You thrive in a dynamic startup environment where creativity, autonomy, and rapid iteration are essential.
Team Player: Strong communication and collaboration skills. You enjoy sharing ideas, mentoring, and driving results together.

Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
afarax is looking for a freelance Machine Learning Engineer. We need you!




The project:

Our client in the banking sector is looking for a Machine Learning Engineer to join their team.




Tasks:

Manage the execution and quality assurance of the monthly production run from data preparation, scoring and validation of different AI models and analytical indicators. Improve the automation of this process to make it more efficient
Maintain and improve the existing python programs for collecting and validating data from different sources, for building, scoring, and performance monitoring of AI models of the team (e.g. python version upgrades)
Interface between data scientists and IT to support the usage of the Domino Data Science Platform, the AI building blocks and the evolution of the python environment.
Assist data scientist by helping them identify and install the correct dependencies in their environment, best practices for code quality, continuous improvement and automation
Support the creation of new variables (data engineering), automatic refit of the data science models
Explore new ways of combining the available tools of the bank (AI building blocks from Tribe AI) to unlock new capabilities for building AI products and supporting the data scientists.
Work with a team of motivated data scientists who are eager to learn, collaborate and share expertise




Is this you?

You have a fluent knowledge of English (spoken and written)
Fluent/Good level of Dutch (French is a plus)
You have a degree in a quantitative field (e.g Master in computer sciences)
Strong expertise in software development in Python and Python data science packages (pandas, sklearn)
Git
bash
SQL
Experience in MLOps / DevOps
SAS
Domino Data Science Platform
Django
Software testing
Experience in containerization (docker)
Experience in Cloud environments




Team player, good communication and presentation skills
Quick self-starter, pro-active attitude
Result driven
Analytical and problem solving mindset
Autonomy, commitment and perseverance
Passionate about continuous improvement




How afarax supports you?

You benefit from our extensive network
You will have access to projects that fit your expertise
We help and support you throughout your project
We offer the possibility to build a valuable and lasting partnership

Check out more projects on: https://afarax.be/jobs/type/freelance/

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We’re looking for a Data Scientist to join our team and help shape the future of contextual advertising as we continue to expand globally.




Who We Are

At Seedtag our goal is to lead the change in the advertising industry because we believe that effective advertising should not be at odds with users’ privacy.

By combining Natural Language Processing and Computer Vision our proprietary, Machine Learning-based technology provides a human-like understanding of the content of the web that finds the best context for each ad while providing unparalleled risk-mitigation capabilities that protect advertisers from showing their ads on pages that could be damaging for their brand. All of this, without relying on cookies or any other tracking mechanisms.

Every day, our teams develop new services that reach over 200 million users worldwide with fast response times to ensure that we deliver the best user experience. We’re fully committed to the DevOps culture, where we provide the platform that our Software Developers and Data Scientists use to manage over 100 different microservices, pushing dozens of changes to production every day. All of this is built on top of Kubernetes in Google Cloud Platform and Amazon Web Services.

If you are interested in joining one of the fastest-growing scale-ups in Europe and working on massive scalability challenges, this is the place for you.




Your Challenge

As a member of our data science team, you will take on the task of developing bidding optimizations through NLP applications, such as large language models, scalable embeddings, and network analysis solutions.
You will be responsible for building and improving bidding functionalities which will have a direct impact on our client’s advertising KPIs.
You will explore the applicability of LLMs for production, crafting solutions that can handle real-world, large-scale challenges, particularly in areas like contextualization, personalization, and relevance optimization.
You will work on end-to-end projects, taking solutions from concept to production, and focusing on creating scalable, efficient, and impactful solutions.
Collaborating closely with our cross-functional teams, your work will be aligned with business goals and drive the practical application of your solutions.




Our core values

Outcome over output

Our core tech values reflect our commitment to delivering exceptional results, fostering a culture of continuous learning, and always putting the customer's needs first. We believe that success comes from focusing on the outcomes rather than just the output. Our tech team aims to solve problems that make a meaningful difference, and we measure our success by the impact we have on the customer.

Failure is allowed, learning is a must

We also recognize that failure is an inevitable part of the innovation process. Our team understands that setbacks are opportunities to learn and grow. We believe in testing early and often, and we continuously iterate and improve until we arrive at the best solution.

We are all scouts

Another core value we hold is that we are all scouts. We believe in leaving things better than we found them. This means we take ownership of our work and strive to improve the systems and processes we touch. We encourage our team members to be proactive in identifying areas for improvement, and we value those who take the initiative to implement positive changes. Our goal is to leave a lasting, positive impact on our projects and our team.

We are data-driven

Lastly, our team is data-driven. We believe that making informed decisions based on data is crucial to our success. Our team uses data to guide our decision-making process and to identify opportunities for improvement. We are committed to using data to continuously monitor and optimize our models and processes to ensure that we are delivering the best possible outcome for our customers.




Tech Stack

We have to support 120k requests per second running with ML models in production answering within 10 milliseconds! We have this running in production with Python and GoLang microservices using datalakes, GCS, Redis, Kinesis or Kafka. All this is constantly deployed in GCP using Kubernetes and other kinds of production stacks. The current stack outputs 20 TB of daily data having them ready to use for analytics and more with easy and low latency access.

In the rest of the company, we also develop in Typescript for Nodejs and Scala making use of technologies like Kafka, Druid and MongoDB all over the Google Cloud Platform.




What You’ll Need to Succeed

You bring 3-5 years of experience in data science and machine learning, with relevant experience in developing ML/NLP applications at scale to address real-world business challenges.
You possess strong software engineering skills and a track record of deploying machine learning models in production environments, with proficiency in Python and experience in libraries relevant to NLP and embedding frameworks.
You have a strong academic background in fields such as Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, or similar, with a focus on quantitative analysis and problem-solving.
You have hands-on experience with end-to-end project workflows, from data exploration to deployment, proven ability to scale embeddings for high-volume data environments, and are skilled at managing both the technical and business aspects of data projects.
You are proactive, entrepreneurial, and adaptable, with a commitment to leveraging data and machine learning to drive impactful, measurable business outcomes in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.




Why Join Seedtag?

Growth & Opportunity: A key moment to join with vast career development prospects.

Flexibility: At Seedtag, we trust you to balance work and life effortlessly with the option to a 100% remote (Please note that while we operate as a 100% remote company, we can only extend contracts within Europe in countries where we have established legal entities: Spain, Italy, the UK, Belgium, the Netherlands, France, and Germany) or hybrid work setup, depending on what works best.

Learning & Development: Online courses in ODILO, and optional English or Spanish group classes.

Inclusive Culture: We foster a supportive environment that values personal growth.

Fun & Connection: Participate in team activities, company offsites, and more!




Additional Perks

Flexible benefits plan: Restaurant, transportation, and kindergarten vouchers.
Health insurance: Comprehensive coverage included.
Gympass: Access to wellness programs and fitness classes.
Seedsave Program: Exclusive discounts to help you save for the future.
Build your home office with a gross budget of up to 1K€ (external screen, chair, table...)
Paid travels to our HQ in Madrid to work p2p with your squad members
Macbook Pro M3




Ready to join the Seedtag adventure? Send us your CV and let’s grow together!




At Seedtag, we’re committed to creating an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive. We welcome diverse perspectives as they fuel our innovation and growth. Please let us know if you require accommodations during the hiring process and we’ll ensure a positive and accessible experience.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
To reinforce our Benelux Data Office department, Allianz is currently looking for a Data Scientist. Are you looking for a role where you can be at the forefront of using cutting-edge data analytics techniques to drive strategic decisions and provide innovative solutions for business challenges? Join us at Allianz and be part of our dynamic team that leverages data science to drive innovation and make a meaningful impact in the insurance sector!




As a Data Scientist at Allianz, you will develop end-to-end, data-driven solutions to support decision-making systems at Allianz. You will engage with business functions to develop ideas, proof of concept to support a transformation business case and release your models to cloud-based state of the art production platform together with IT, senior engineers and scientists. You will analyze information from various data sources using statistics, including machine learning, to provide insights on various business problems. You will develop end-to-end, data-driven solutions (incl. GenAI) to support decision-making systems at Allianz.




What do you get in return?




We offer you a full-time challenging role in an international landscape based in Brussels or Rotterdam;
Working in a dynamic environment at Allianz, world leader in insurances;
You will work from our new office, from walkable distance from Brussel-North or Rotterdam Central station;
A pleasant working atmosphere within an experienced and enthusiastic team;
Development opportunities and a nice salary package supplemented with fringe benefits.




As Data Scientist, your main responsibilities will be:




Model Development and Integration: Build, implement, and continuously enhance machine learning and statistical models using cutting-edge tools. Focus on integrating these models into our IT infrastructure, ensuring scalability, reliability, and performance. Collaborate with IT and DevOps teams to deploy models in production environments, monitor their performance, and optimize for efficiency. Translate business problems into robust data-driven solutions while maintaining best practices in version control, testing, and documentation.
Collaborate with Stakeholders: Partner with business stakeholders to understand their challenges and convert them into actionable data science projects, ensuring that the solutions align with business objectives.
Data Management and Analysis: Acquire, clean, and integrate data from various sources to address business issues. Use advanced data analytics techniques to manipulate and interpret complex datasets, providing clear insights and answers to critical business questions.
Knowledge and Trend Analysis: Stay informed about the latest industry trends to maintain a competitive edge and apply this knowledge to drive strategic decisions and methodologies within the company.




Let’s do the match?




You have a Bachelors/Masters degree in a quantitative field such as Computer Science, Engineering, Econometrics, Physics, Actuarial, Statistics, or Mathematics? Check! Knowledge of machine learning principles and unsupervised machine learning techniques, including linear models and tree-based methods for regression and classification? Check! Ability to easily interpret common performance metrics? Check! Advanced skills in Python or R, proficiency in SQL and good knowledge of cloud data environments (e.g., Microsoft Azure)? Double check!




Have we peaked your interest? Join us and #LetsCareForTomorrow




Allianz is an equal opportunity employer and therefore welcomes applications regardless of ethnicity or cultural background, age, gender, nationality, religion, disability or sexual orientation.

To reinforce our Benelux Data Office department, Allianz is currently looking for a Data Scientist. Are you looking for a role where you can be at the forefront of using cutting-edge data analytics techniques to drive strategic decisions and provide innovative solutions for business challenges? Join us at Allianz and be part of our dynamic team that leverages data science to drive innovation and make a meaningful impact in the insurance sector!


As a Data Scientist at Allianz, you will develop end-to-end, data-driven solutions to support decision-making systems at Allianz. You will engage with business functions to develop ideas, proof of concept to support a transformation business case and release your models to cloud-based state of the art production platform together with IT, senior engineers and scientists. You will analyze information from various data sources using statistics, including machine learning, to provide insights on various business problems. You will develop end-to-end, data-driven solutions (incl. GenAI) to support decision-making systems at Allianz.


What do you get in return?


  • We offer you a full-time challenging role in an international landscape based in Brussels or Rotterdam;
  • Working in a dynamic environment at Allianz, world leader in insurances;
  • You will work from our new office, from walkable distance from Brussel-North or Rotterdam Central station;
  • A pleasant working atmosphere within an experienced and enthusiastic team;
  • Development opportunities and a nice salary package supplemented with fringe benefits.


As Data Scientist, your main responsibilities will be:


  • Model Development and Integration: Build, implement, and continuously enhance machine learning and statistical models using cutting-edge tools. Focus on integrating these models into our IT infrastructure, ensuring scalability, reliability, and performance. Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
Freelance AI Engineer (Financial Sector) – Brussels (Hybrid, 12 Months)

Overview

We are looking for a skilled Freelance AI Engineer to work closely with our data team and drive AI-powered innovations in the financial sector. Based in Brussels, this 12-month contract involves collaborating with data scientists, analysts, and engineers to develop and deploy cutting-edge AI models for fraud detection, risk assessment, and automated financial decision-making.




Key Responsibilities

Collaborate with the data team (data scientists, data analysts, and data engineers) to build and deploy AI-driven financial solutions.
Design, develop, and implement machine learning and deep learning models for risk management, fraud detection, algorithmic trading, and credit scoring.
Optimize AI models for real-time financial applications while ensuring scalability and efficiency.
Work with big data platforms to process large-scale structured and unstructured financial datasets.
Develop and maintain end-to-end AI pipelines, including data ingestion, model training, and deployment.
Deploy AI models using MLOps best practices (CI/CD, model monitoring, and retraining).
Ensure AI solutions comply with financial regulations (Basel III, IFRS, MiFID II).
Work with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) for scalable AI deployment.
Research and implement state-of-the-art AI techniques to improve financial analytics and decision-making.




Required Skills & Qualifications

Technical Skills

Strong proficiency in Python or C++ for AI/ML development.
Experience with machine learning frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn).
Hands-on experience in AI model deployment using Docker, Kubernetes, and CI/CD pipelines.
Strong knowledge of SQL and NoSQL databases for working with financial data.
Familiarity with big data processing technologies (Apache Spark, Hadoop) is a plus.
Experience in cloud computing (AWS SageMaker, Google Vertex AI, Azure ML).
Solid understanding of MLOps tools (MLflow, Kubeflow, Airflow).

Soft Skills

Strong problem-solving and analytical mindset.
Ability to collaborate effectively with data scientists, analysts, and engineers.
Excellent communication skills to explain AI concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Detail-oriented, with a focus on model accuracy and ethical AI considerations.

Preferred Experience

Prior experience in the financial sector (banking, fintech, insurance).
Knowledge of financial regulations (Basel III, IFRS, MiFID II) as they relate to AI.
Experience with high-frequency trading (HFT), robo-advisors, or automated financial systems is a plus.




Contract Details

Location: Brussels (Hybrid – On-site & Remote)
Duration: 12 months (with possibility of extension)
Type: Freelance Contract
Start Date: ASAP
Compensation: Competitive, based on experience




If you are interested, feel free to apply with your CV or directly email me at adam@kodastaff.com

Show more

Title: Data Scientist - 021197
Description:
Role: Data Scientist - 021197

Location: VASS BRUSSELS

А global digital transformation company with a team of more than 4,900 global players in 26 countries – in Europe, America and Asia, working together to put organizations at the forefront of innovation by bringing together talent, knowledge and technology.

Our approach is based on conscious technology, through which we create positive environments and meaningful opportunities, always in our own way, making the complex simple.

VASS BeNeLux, in partnership with the European Commission, is currently seeking an Expert Data Scientist - 021197 to work from the European Commission.

The role:

Following tasks are expected to be performed by external service provider:


Collect business requirement and develop advanced data mining and business intelligence solutions or




identify, assess and deploy relevant existing data mining and business intelligence solution.


Identify, collect, convert and update different data types/sets in several locations (e.g. ETL).
Data analysis, data processing, data reconciliation and data visualisation.
Contribute to the design of the datawarehouse migration strategy and of the future enterprise




datawarehouse.


Contribute to the design and implementation of the analytics architecture and its solution stack




(including performance aspects, physical design, capacity dimensions etc…).


Write the different documentation associated with the tasks and liaise with other project teams as




necessary to address cross-project interdependencies

You have:

Following skills and knowledge are required for the performance of the above listed tasks:

To have a bachelor of minimum 3 years


Excellent knowledge of Data Analytics techniques and tools.
Excellent knowledge of business intelligence tools.
Good expertise in the ETL processes and tools.
Excellent knowledge of SQL tooling (NoSQL, Hadoop, SQL …).
Knowledge of architectural design and implementation of scalable modern datawarehouses.
Experience with languages like Python and R.
Experience with unit testing.
Capacity in preparing and writing clear and structured technical and user documents




If you want to join a dynamic company where technological challenges will be found in your day to day we are waiting for you in the great VASS team.

And we encourage you to be the best version of yourself: Transformative, Creative, Honest, Vibrant!

At VASS we take action every day to achieve a favourable environment that facilitates and promotes equal opportunities, non-discrimination, diversity and inclusion of all people. We select our talent based on business needs, skills and merits. 🌟

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Department: Data

Employment Type: Full Time

Location: Remote

Description

We’re seeking a highly skilled Data Scientist to join our analytics team, driving performance optimization and providing strategic insights. You will be responsible for developing and refining LTV, ROAS prediction models, and working with SKAdNetwork (SKAN) data to enhance user acquisition and marketing efficiency. This is a hands-on role where you’ll also lead the development of foundational marketing analytics systems.

All The Responsibilities We'll Trust You With


You'll be working on hands-on development and refinement of LTV and ROAS predictive models to optimize marketing spend.
You'll maintain and improve SKAN ETL pipelines, ensuring accurate collection and analysis of post-install metrics to inform marketing strategy .
You'll analyze marketing KPIs like CAC, CTR, ROAS, and conversion rates, delivering actionable insights to drive campaign performance.
You'll collaborate cross-functionally with marketing, product, and data engineering teams to identify data needs and strategies .
You'll design and implement A/B tests for user acquisition campaigns, measuring impact and optimizing channels.
You'll create dashboards and reports to visualize marketing performance and trends, communicating insights to non-technical stakeholders .
You'll proactively drive the evolution of marketing analytics by identifying data-driven opportunities and building foundational analytics processes.


What You'll Bring To The Team


2-3+ years of experience in marketing data science or analytics (preferably in mobile gaming or apps).
Proficiency in SQL, Python (or R), with a strong background in building and deploying LTV/ROAS prediction models.
Experience working with SKAN and marketing attribution tools .
Strong understanding of key marketing metrics such as CAC, ROAS, LTV, and engagement metrics.
Experience in machine learning techniques (e.g., regression, classification) for building predictive models.
Experience in A/B testing and statistical analysis.
Proven ability to work independently and drive projects autonomously in a fast-paced environment .
Familiarity with BI tools such as Metabase, Looker, or Tableau.


Why You'll Love Working With Us


We’re 100% remote, work wherever you want forever!
We offer unlimited holidays and sick days. Take as much time off as you need, to spend time with your family and friends or just because you feel like playing games all day. We trust our team and want to offer a modern work life balance that allows you to thrive both at work and in your personal life.
You’ll be able to make an impact, to work closely with the rest of the team and its leads to work on one of the most promising upcoming games in the mobile gaming industry and the Web3 space.
You’ll have a comfortable work schedule and stable workload. With a variety of tasks that will allow your constant professional development.
We want our team to grow personally and professionally and support learning opportunities, especially with a focus around new AI tools and methods.
We have a culture that puts our people first. We believe in open communication, creativity and the value of unique contributions from everyone in the team.
We offer a competitive salary in addition to equity option plans.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
ITMAGINATION helps its Clients by becoming a true extension of their software and data development capabilities. Through the readily set up, comprehensive, and self-governing teams, we let our Clients focus on their business while we make sure that their software products and data tools scale up accordingly and with outstanding quality.

We are looking for experienced team players to fill the Data Scientist position and participate in our up-and-coming project for our client from the pharmaceutical industry.

You can expect:


working with highly skilled team of professionals
leveraging advanced algorithms, and high-performance computing


Requirements


Min. 3 years of industry experience in Computer Science, Data Science, Bioinformatics, or a related quantitative field
Experience in digital health, physiological signal processing, and bioinformatics
Proficiency in Python
Strong background in machine learning, deep learning, statistical analysis, especially for large datasets
Familiarity with cloud technologies (AWS, Azure, GCP, Snowflake)
Excellent communication skills for collaborating and presenting technical concepts
Excellent English skills


Nice to have:


Programming experience in R or MATLAB
Knowledge of GPU computing, high-performance computing, and cloud-native applications
Familiarity with cardiovascular, neuroscience, or epidemiology data


Benefits


Fully remote work model
Professional training programs – including Udemy and other development plans
Benefits package offer - Health Insurance, Sports Package, and Life Insurance offerings
Work with a team that’s recognized for its excellence. We’ve been featured in the Deloitte Technology Fast 50 & FT 1000 rankings. We’ve also received the Great Place To Work® certification for five years in a row

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
Do you want to work in a company with the purpose of helping patients around the world? Do you want to learn and grow every day? Do you want to change healthcare?




Lyfegen is a fast-growing health-tech company making healthcare more accessible and affordable by delivering solutions for healthcare payers and pharma to identify the right drug pricing agreements, simulate and understand the financial impacts of those agreements, and automate the management of them.




We are seeking a passionate and skilled AI Engineer. This role focuses on leading and driving AI initiatives, optimizing simulations to support drug pricing negotiations, and improving our LLM-based chatbot to facilitate learning about drug reimbursements. This position offers an exciting opportunity to join a dynamic team at the forefront of innovation in healthcare technology.




We are doing things nobody has done before! Thus, creative problem solving is a must and a get-things-done mentality a definitive requirement.




Your main responsibilities:

Lead all the AI initiatives inside the Lyfegen platform.
Discover and benchmark different strategies for fast and accurate RAG on tabular data sources. Evaluate methods to achieve efficient and precise question-answering.
Orchestrate and compose AI-supported toolchains. Use your knowledge of existing components, models and libraries such as LangChain and GPT to create AI toolchains to support diverse user tasks on the Lyfegen Platform.
Support Lyfegen internal users with machine learning tooling. Provide ML tools and automations to streamline and enhance our internal workflows and processes.
Work with our internal Product Owners to translate company vision into technical specs and collaborate with engineers to solve challenges.




Who you are:

Machine learning and NLP expertise:
Solid understanding of machine learning algorithms such as gradient boosted trees.
Experience in multiple large language models (LLMs) specifically for Q&A and chat.
Experience in benchmarking and optimizing toolchains.
Proficiency in AI-relevant programming languages such as Python. Familiarity with frameworks and libraries such as TensorFlow, PyTorch and LangChain.
Familiarity with databases for storing and retrieving data for AI models. (SQLAlchemy,Alembic)
Expertise in Python-based Web frameworks such as Flask, Django or FastAPI.
Research mindset by owning an AI feature/product end to end building server-side software that delivers AI inference results, aiming for reliable, scalable systems that seamlessly integrate into our products.
AI toolchain integration skills. Ability to integrate and orchestrate AI tools and libraries into cohesive, user-friendly, and performant systems.
Experience in recommendation engines is a bonus, particularly in apps involving pricing.
Strong problem-solving abilities to identify issues and evaluate solutions.
Analytical skills to implement effective AI strategies.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills to work effectively with stakeholders.
Ability to translate business requirements into user-friendly AI-enabled solutions.
Hands-on experience with retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) on tabular data.







What we offer:

Join a company with a purposeful vision and mission.
Direct influence on the growth and success of Lyfegen.
The possibility to work flexibly.
Become part of a team of international high performers.
Opportunities for professional development and career advancement.
Show more

Title: Python Developer (Gen AI)
Description:
Location: Headquarters Brussels, Anderlecht (on-site 2 days/week)

Languages: English

Employment Type: Freelance

Start Date: 6-month project with potential for extension

Context of the mission/objective(s) of the job


We have developed several innovative Generative AI assistants to streamline high-value tasks across the company. With solutions that bring trials closer to patients, or that transform our internal helpdesks, Generative AI brings new opportunities to generate value for patients and the company.
Your initial project will involve collaborating with app developers and users to productize an existing prototype (built in Streamlit) using Python FastAPI and our custom internal framework. Beyond this initial project we will be looking to leverage your experience to enrich our Generative AI capabilities.


Responsibilities


Develop FastAPI application back-ends that combine large language with business logic
Act as a team player within the platform team and collaborate closely with the teams that built the Prototypes
Work with the infra teams to deploy the app, ensuring its supportability and maintainability
Maintain well-documented code, complete with necessary unit and integration tests.


Requirements


Proficient in Python and FastAPI
Experience with Generative AI, including the use of. Familiarity with standard data analytics libraries such as pandas, matplotlib, Streamlit, langchain, etc.
Expertise in development tools, including GIT, IDE (preferably Vscode), and CI/CD (preferably Azure DevOps-based).
Ability to work independently, breaking down complex tasks into manageable subtasks and executing them. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with a proven track record of collaborating effectively with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.
A proactive and results-driven mindset, capable of resolving issues independently or seeking help and driving issues to resolution.
Strong problem-solving and decision-making abilities, with a focus on developing innovative solutions.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
RED Global is currently recruiting for a Machine Learning Engineer - AI for our client, a global organisation who undertaking a large complex digital transformation program. They are looking to bring on board an experienced ML Engineer – AI with extensive experience of Machine Learning, Generative AI, Solution architecture and Data Science platforms.

Key responsibilities:

Responsible to define and implement best practices for building, testing, and deploying scalable AI solutions with a strong focus on generative models and LLM.
Design and implement solutions with the use of ML and Generative AI tools and technologies, with a strong focus on end-to-end automation.
Accountable to build and design cloud hosted generative AI solutions.
Work closely with customers to identify issues and support them in implementation of their ML ecosystem.
Develop Solutions to ensure robust and secure data pipelines and infrastructure to support AI model training and deployment.
Stay updated on the latest trends and technologies in Generative AI and Machine Learning.
Lead the evaluation of new AI tools, frameworks, and methodologies.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English and Dutch or French with good senior level stakeholder management soft skills and competencies.




Required skills:

4+ years’ experience in designing and building AI solutions.
Hands on expertise in ML techniques, deep learning frameworks, image processing and AI-related technologies including Generative AI.
Previous worked across various cloud platforms such as AWS and Azure.
Must have experience of using data science platforms such as Databricks, AzureML, SageMaker and frameworks such as TensorFlow or similar.
Good knowledge of DevOps, MLOps, DataOps and LLMOps principles.
Native Dutch or French speaker and professional working proficiency in English.

Title: AI ML Engineer
Company: Bridebook - The No.1 Wedding Planning App
Description:
At Bridebook, we're digitising the wedding industry! Join us in transforming the wedding planning experience for engaged couples around the world.




Who is Bridebook anyway? 💙




Bridebook is a revolutionary wedding planning platform that seeks to make wedding planning an enjoyable, intuitive, and rewarding experience for couples, guests, and industry partners. Launched in the UK, Bridebook has over 1,000,000 planning couples and has been featured in major outlets such as the New York Times, the BBC, and the App Store. After six years and many iterations later, we have 2 in 3 engaged UK couples and 1 in 3 engaged German couples using Bridebook, and have recently expanded globally. While we serve a very emotional and creative industry, we are obsessed with using tech and data to revolutionise the industry. We have a team of motivated and experienced professionals with ambitious plans to make Bridebook an iconic global brand, making this an exciting time to join our vibrant and innovative company.




What will I be doing? ‍‍👩‍💻👨‍💻




Join us in revolutionizing the wedding planning experience with AI-powered solutions! We’re looking for a hands-on AI Engineer to build, optimize, and deploy cutting-edge AI applications that enhance our platform’s intelligence.




Specific responsibilities will include:




AI Application Development – Design and implement AI-driven features using LLMs, RAG systems, and AI agents.
Search & Recommendations – Build smart search and retrieval systems with Elasticsearch and vector search.
Model Engineering – Optimize prompt engineering, fine-tune models, and enhance inference efficiency.
AI Infrastructure & MLOps – Architect and scale AI pipelines, ensuring robust monitoring, security, and deployment.
Full-Stack Development – Work with TypeScript, React, and Node.js to integrate AI seamlessly.







We’re looking for someone with: 🧠💚




AI/ML Expertise – Experience with LLMs, RAG, prompt engineering, and AI agent development.
Software Engineering Skills – Strong coding background in Python & TypeScript, with experience in cloud-based AI solutions.
Infrastructure & MLOps – Proficiency in GCP, Vercel, containerization, and monitoring AI applications
Scalability & Performance Focus – Ability to design efficient AI systems that are cost-effective and production-ready.
AI Safety & Responsible AI – Strong understanding of AI ethics, safety guardrails, and monitoring best practices.




What if you’re a partial fit?🌱




We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the wedding industry and welcome candidates with different backgrounds and experiences! We prioritise grit, positivity, and the willingness to get stuck in, and encourage you to apply even if your experience doesn’t exactly match this job description.




Location 🌍




Remote, Europe (Please note we cannot offer contracts to anyone outside of this region)




Our Values 🙌




One Team: Together we are better.

Keep Accelerating: We work smart.

Create Joy: We celebrate going above and beyond.




Equal employment opportunity 🌈




Research shows that women, neurodiverse individuals, and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! At Bridebook we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply.




So what’s next? 🕓




You’ll hear from our team within 2 weeks regarding your application. We believe in efficient and meaningful conversations, so you’ll be happy to hear there isn’t a whopping 7 stage process!




Please submit your CV in English to be reviewed by our internal team.




That's all for now - see you on the dancefloor! 🕺💃

Show more

Title: Data Scientist (H/F)
Description:
LittleBigCode is a digital consulting laboratory specializing in Data and Artificial Intelligence. Our mission is to democratize the use of these technologies by co-building useful applications with our customers for the Society of the future, particularly on subjects related to health, mobility or the environment.




For this, we deliver turnkey projects and also work on consulting assignments while developing our own solutions. Finally, we combine Cloud technologies, AGILE methods and DevOps culture to facilitate industrialization and scaling up.




Our big success so far:

A community of more than 40 enthusiasts of Data Science & Data Engineering domains
International presence & missions – we are launching our new office in Belgium!
Workshops, Innovation contests, customers challenges taken up




As such, we are looking to build our technical team in Belgium ! Join us !




What will be your tasks with us ?




You will work in Agile mode and you will support our client on their challenges related to Data and production.




You will be working in the following areas:

Business case study with business teams
Analysis of customer data and processes in order to study their valuation
Elaboration of Data Science solutions
Going into production with Data Engineers
Creation of POC, model development
Ensure a technological watch in order to propose innovations




Who are you ?

You have a Master in engineering (Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics…) and you have some experiences as a Data Scientist !
You have bases in the realization of POC, the development of models and applications starting from- scratch as well as in the putting into production
You master programming best practices such as code versionning (git), IDE use (PyCharm fore.g.), testing, use of CI/CD tools
You are fully proficient in Python, Machine learning & Deep learning frameworks (Scikit-Learn & Tensorflow for e.g.) and DataViz tools
You have experiences with Data services of at least one the major Cloud Provider (Azure, AWS, GCP)
You are familiar with some of the following domains: time series, NLP, Computer Vision, reinforcement learning, IoT
Note that we are also big devotees of DevOps so the more you are comfortable with it, all the better!
Fluent in English + in Dutch and/or French

Title: Research Scientist (Jr)
Description:
Position: Jr. Research Scientist

Location: Brussels/Leuven, Belgium




Role Overview

We seek a motivated Junior Research Scientist with a PhD (up to 2 years post-PhD) in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematical Engineering, or Operational Research.




Your Responsibilities

Develop novel methods and algorithms customized for solving network optimization problems involving nonlinear coupling constraints, nonconvex/nonlinear composite objective functions, etc.
Validate (numerically/experimentally) solutions using real-life datasets.
Integrate them as part of product-grade solver framework for automated execution.




Required Skills

Network optimization including network design, network embedding, routing/traffic assignment, resource allocation, flow/resource scheduling, etc.
Optimization Expertise: Mixed-integer nonlinear programming (mandatory) and iterative methods like quasi-Newton, primal-dual methods (Lagrangian methods, etc.), interior point, combinatorial methods: polyhedral methods, etc.
Programming: Proficiency in C/C++, Fortran, and Octave.
Tools: Good knowledge of MI(N)LP solving frameworks such as Gurobi, SCIP, Couenne/COIN-OR, SHOT/COIN-OR, Bonmin, etc. and subsolvers (e.g. MIP: CPlex, NLP: Ipopt, Conopt, Algencan).




Soft Skills

Attention to detail, adaptability, teamwork, and responsiveness.




Application Requirements

CV highlighting:
Programming: Outstanding programming skills (experimental code or ICPC winner) in C/C++ and Octave programming (programming skills in FORTRAN is considered as a plus)
Expertise in network optimization methods and algorithms: list of achievements and publications (Springer: JOTA, COAP, AMO, JGO, NUMA, etc. Wiley: Networks, IEEE JSAC, IEEE Transactions on Communications, etc.) –note: theoretical knowledge of abstract algorithms not sufficient
Languages: Proficiency in English (Dutch/Mandarin beneficial).

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
We are seeking a highly skilled Machine Learning Engineer with extensive experience in running and scaling models on public cloud platforms. The successful candidate will join our team to optimize, implement, and maintain our organization’s cloud-based systems.


Responsibilities:**
Design, develop, and deploy modular models on cloud-based systems.
Develop and maintain cloud solutions in accordance with best practices.
Ensure efficient functioning of data storage and processing functions, adhering to company security policies and best practices in cloud security.
Identify, analyze, and resolve infrastructure vulnerabilities and application deployment issues.
Regularly review existing models and systems, making recommendations for improvements.
Collaborate with engineering and development teams to evaluate and identify optimal cloud solutions.
Modify and improve existing systems.
Educate teams on the implementation of new cloud technologies and initiatives.
Technical Skills:**
Proven work experience as a Machine Learning Engineer or in a similar role.
Preferred: GCP certifications.
Strong troubleshooting and analytical skills.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Relevant training and/or certifications as a Google Cloud Engineer.
Proficiency in Google Compute Engine, including creating, managing, and scaling virtual machines (VMs) to meet diverse workload requirements.
Expertise in designing solution architecture on Google Cloud Platform (GCP), aligning with project-specific needs and objectives.
Strong grasp of programming languages such as Python, Java, Go, and Node.js.
Expertise in programming frameworks and libraries specific to GCP, such as Google Cloud SDK, Cloud Client Libraries, and Cloud APIs.
Understanding of serverless computing, containerization (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes), and event-driven architectures for developing scalable and efficient applications on GCP.
Knowledge of containers and infrastructure automation tools.
Proficiency in tools including Ansible, Docker, Windows PowerShell, and Linux/Unix.
Expertise in Google Cloud Storage.
Familiarity with other GCP services like BigQuery, Cloud Pub/Sub, and Cloud Functions.
Software Security Skills:**
Expertise in securing applications and data on Google Cloud, including:
Configuring Identity and Access Management (IAM) to control resource access.
Implementing network security measures such as firewall rules and encryption.
Monitoring and logging security events using tools like Stackdriver Logging.
Ensuring data encryption at rest and in transit.
Securing containers and Kubernetes clusters.
Complying with security standards and regulations.
Developing incident response plans.
Automating security checks and vulnerability scanning.
Following secure development practices.


These skills are crucial for maintaining the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of software systems deployed on Google Cloud and protecting against potential threats and vulnerabilities.


Coding and Scripting Skills**
Proficiency in programming languages like Python, Java, or Go to build and customize applications on the Google Cloud Platform.
Knowledge of infrastructure-as-code (IaC) tools such as Terraform and/or Google Cloud Deployment Manager enables defining and managing infrastructure resources using code. Automation is key, utilizing scripting languages and tools like Cloud SDK or Cloud APIs to automate tasks, deployments, and resource management.
Familiarity with containerization technologies like Docker and Kubernetes enables efficient deployment and management of applications. Cloud API integration and utilization of monitoring and logging tools like Stackdriver aid in application monitoring, troubleshooting, and enhancing overall performance. These skills empower developers to optimize and harness the capabilities of Google Cloud for building scalable and reliable cloud solutions.
Testing Skills**


The primary objective of any GCP Engineer is to expedite the software delivery process for clients, ensuring swift and efficient deployment.

To Excel GCP Skills, It Is Imperative To Possess


Strong testing skills and a comprehensive understanding of the testing process. Testing plays a critical role in driving automation and ensuring successful outcomes in the role.
Additionally, once the appropriate tests are established, a sense of assurance prevails, knowing that each component functions as intended. Tests can be conducted at various stages, from development to deployment, to ensure seamless integration of new features throughout the entire system.
Finally, emphasizing quality is paramount in the realm of applications and software. As a result, one should continuously prioritize and conduct rigorous testing to deliver high-quality work.


**Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment (CI/CD)**


Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) in Google Cloud refers to a set of practices and tools that enable developers to automate the process of building, testing, and deploying applications. CI involves automatically integrating code changes into a shared repository and running tests to ensure code quality. CD takes it further by automating the deployment of tested code to production environments. In Google Cloud, CI/CD pipelines can be set up using tools like Cloud Build, Cloud Source Repositories, and Cloud Deployment Manager. These pipelines help streamline development workflows, increase collaboration, and ensure rapid and reliable application delivery, allowing teams to deliver software updates more frequently and with reduced manual effort.
Azure DevOps and Azure Pipelines


An Ideal Candidate Should Also Demonstrate The Following Behaviours


Self-learning abilities
Radiates energy & enthusiasm for his field, and can instil the same passion in others
Naturally curious & always a step ahead
Critical thinker, challenging others in a constructive way, continuously looking for improvements
Can combine big-picture thinking, with zooming in on details.


, ING Bank

These skills are crucial for maintaining the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of software systems deployed on Google Cloud and protecting against potential threats and vulnerabilities.

  • Coding and Scripting Skills**
  • Proficiency in programming languages like Python, Java, or Go to build and customize applications on the Google Cloud Platform.
  • Knowledge of infrastructure-as-code (IaC) tools such as Terraform and/or Google Cloud Deployment Manager enables defining and managing infrastructure resources using code. Automation is key, utilizing scripting languages and tools like Cloud SDK or Cloud APIs to automate tasks, deployments, and resource management.
  • Familiarity with containerization technologies like Docker and Kubernetes enables efficient deployment and management of applications. Cloud API integration and utilization of monitoring and logging tools like Stackdriver aid in application monitoring, troubleshooting, and enhancing overall performance. These skills empower developers to optimize and harness the capabilities of Google Cloud for building scalable and reliable cloud solutions.
  • Testing Skills**

The primary objective of any GCP Engineer is to expedite the software delivery process for clients, ensuring swift and efficient deployment.

To Excel GCP Skills, It Is Imperative To Possess

  • Strong testing skills and a comprehensive understanding of the testing process. Testing plays a critical role in driving automation and ensuring successful outcomes in the role.
  • Additionally, once the appropriate tests are established, a sense of assurance prevails, knowing that each component functions as intended. Tests can be conducted at various stages, from development to deployment, to ensure seamless integration of new features throughout the entire system.
  • Finally, emphasizing quality is paramount in the realm of applications and software. As a result, one should continuously prioritize and conduct rigorous testing to deliver high-quality work.

**Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment (CI/CD)**

  • Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) in Google Cloud refers to a set of practices and tools that enable developers to automate the process of building, testing, and deploying applications. CI involves automatically integrating code changes into a shared repository and running tests to ensure code quality. CD takes it further by automating the deployment of tested code to production environments. In Google Cloud, CI/CD pipelines can be set up using tools like Cloud Build, Cloud Source Repositories, and Cloud Deployment Manager. These pipelines help streamline development workflows, increase collaboration, and ensure rapid and reliable application delivery, allowing teams to deliver software updates more frequently and with reduced manual effort.
  • Azure DevOps and Azure Pipelines

An Ideal Candidate Should Also Demonstrate The Following Behaviours

  • Self-learning abilities
  • Radiates energy & enthusiasm for his field, and can instil the same passion in others
  • Naturally curious & always a step ahead
  • Critical thinker, challenging others in a constructive way, continuously looking for improvements
  • Can combine big-picture thinking, with zooming in on details.

, ING Bank

Title: AI Machine Learning Engineer - Brussels
Description:
YOUR JOB IN A NUTSHELL

As an AI Machine Learning Engineer you promote the adoption of best standards in industrial code development across the Machine Learning and AI community. You do so by developing ML pipelines that are production-ready by design or by integrating existing ML solutions into industrial pipelines.

You participate in the development, deployment and monitoring of AI services, which means you contribute to data quality checks, data flow design, the design of the models themselves and their overall integration into the production environment.

AND IN DETAIL


You facilitate the communication between AI & Analytics teams and IT production with regards to the deployment of ML models, ensuring that models put in production are equipped with the appropriate data pipelines and monitoring.
You work with the Data Scientists to define and develop the target solution with production constraints in mind. This allows to select the correct run infrastructure and serving model (e.g. data ingestion scheme, API synchronicity …) to address the business requirements (real-time responses, processing volumetry …).
You contribute to the automation of the different elements of the ML pipeline in order to integrate and deploy them in the production environment (e.g. building Docker/VM images, prepare unitary, regression and integration tests …).
You support Data Scientists on the usage of the existing industrial solutions available to build and monitor AI services (i.e. the CI/CD tools).
You support IT Production on the parameterization of the target environment.
You ensure that the model runs without errors, is retrained if needed (incl. automatically) and is monitored both from the IT and the business perspective.


YOUR TALENTS AND COMPETENCES


A profound knowledge of English is mandatory. Knowledge of Dutch and/or French is a plus.
You have at least 2 years of relevant experience with:
Basic knowledge of Linux platform
Containerization/virtualization
AI platforms & IDEs
CI/CD
Code, model & data versioning
Python
Usage of package managing tools and experience in dependency management
PostgreSQL
It is preferable you have experience with:
Integration using different technologies and infra components
Model compression techniques
ELT/ETL tools
Big data tools (Spark)
Data flow processing
Data visualization tools
You have a knowledge of agile methodology.
You have strong communication skills, oral and written. You are open to other’s opinions, ideas and feedback.
You work results driven, have attention to detail and you are a real problem solver. You can think out of the box and outside existing processes and frameworks.
You proactively invest time in continuous learning and knowledge improvement.
You work with energy and empowerment to deliver great results and a large contribution to the company’s success.


What We Have To Offer

OUR IMPACT

We strongly believe in the positive impact the financial sector can have on the world. BNP Paribas Fortis offers sustainable and responsible investment products and solutions, and encourages social entrepreneurship. Together with our customers, we work towards a better future every day.

YOUR CAREER PERSPECTIVES

We offer you a wide range of training courses, workshops and webinars to choose from depending on your availability, interests and ambitions.

OUR OFFER

You will benefit from our Smart Working program: offering flexibility on workplace (work everywhere, home working) and time management.

OUR ENGAGEMENT

At BNP Paribas Fortis, we want to attract and retain all talent, whatever their gender, age, background or sexual orientation, and irrespective of whether they are living with a disability, as every person has their own experiences and their own identity. All of our full-time vacancies are also open to candidates wishing to work on an 80% or 90% full-time equivalent basis.

TEMPTED BY THE CHALLENGE?

A first selection is made based on your CV and motivation letter. Are we convinced that you are the right candidate? Then we will contact you.

Good luck!

Is this position not for you, but do you know someone who is cut out for this job? Feel free to share it with friends and family!
Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
We are seeking a highly skilled Machine Learning Engineer with extensive experience in running and scaling models on public cloud platforms. The successful candidate will join our team to optimize, implement, and maintain our organization’s cloud-based systems.


Responsibilities:**
Design, develop, and deploy modular models on cloud-based systems.
Develop and maintain cloud solutions in accordance with best practices.
Ensure efficient functioning of data storage and processing functions, adhering to company security policies and best practices in cloud security.
Identify, analyze, and resolve infrastructure vulnerabilities and application deployment issues.
Regularly review existing models and systems, making recommendations for improvements.
Collaborate with engineering and development teams to evaluate and identify optimal cloud solutions.
Modify and improve existing systems.
Educate teams on the implementation of new cloud technologies and initiatives.
Technical Skills:**
Proven work experience as a Machine Learning Engineer or in a similar role.
Preferred: GCP certifications.
Strong troubleshooting and analytical skills.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Relevant training and/or certifications as a Google Cloud Engineer.
Proficiency in Google Compute Engine, including creating, managing, and scaling virtual machines (VMs) to meet diverse workload requirements.
Expertise in designing solution architecture on Google Cloud Platform (GCP), aligning with project-specific needs and objectives.
Strong grasp of programming languages such as Python, Java, Go, and Node.js.
Expertise in programming frameworks and libraries specific to GCP, such as Google Cloud SDK, Cloud Client Libraries, and Cloud APIs.
Understanding of serverless computing, containerization (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes), and event-driven architectures for developing scalable and efficient applications on GCP.
Knowledge of containers and infrastructure automation tools.
Proficiency in tools including Ansible, Docker, Windows PowerShell, and Linux/Unix.
Expertise in Google Cloud Storage.
Familiarity with other GCP services like BigQuery, Cloud Pub/Sub, and Cloud Functions.
Software Security Skills:**
Expertise in securing applications and data on Google Cloud, including:
Configuring Identity and Access Management (IAM) to control resource access.
Implementing network security measures such as firewall rules and encryption.
Monitoring and logging security events using tools like Stackdriver Logging.
Ensuring data encryption at rest and in transit.
Securing containers and Kubernetes clusters.
Complying with security standards and regulations.
Developing incident response plans.
Automating security checks and vulnerability scanning.
Following secure development practices.


These skills are crucial for maintaining the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of software systems deployed on Google Cloud and protecting against potential threats and vulnerabilities.


Coding and Scripting Skills**
Proficiency in programming languages like Python, Java, or Go to build and customize applications on the Google Cloud Platform.
Knowledge of infrastructure-as-code (IaC) tools such as Terraform and/or Google Cloud Deployment Manager enables defining and managing infrastructure resources using code. Automation is key, utilizing scripting languages and tools like Cloud SDK or Cloud APIs to automate tasks, deployments, and resource management.
Familiarity with containerization technologies like Docker and Kubernetes enables efficient deployment and management of applications. Cloud API integration and utilization of monitoring and logging tools like Stackdriver aid in application monitoring, troubleshooting, and enhancing overall performance. These skills empower developers to optimize and harness the capabilities of Google Cloud for building scalable and reliable cloud solutions.
Testing Skills**


The primary objective of any GCP Engineer is to expedite the software delivery process for clients, ensuring swift and efficient deployment.

To Excel GCP Skills, It Is Imperative To Possess


Strong testing skills and a comprehensive understanding of the testing process. Testing plays a critical role in driving automation and ensuring successful outcomes in the role.
Additionally, once the appropriate tests are established, a sense of assurance prevails, knowing that each component functions as intended. Tests can be conducted at various stages, from development to deployment, to ensure seamless integration of new features throughout the entire system.
Finally, emphasizing quality is paramount in the realm of applications and software. As a result, one should continuously prioritize and conduct rigorous testing to deliver high-quality work.


**Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment (CI/CD)**


Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) in Google Cloud refers to a set of practices and tools that enable developers to automate the process of building, testing, and deploying applications. CI involves automatically integrating code changes into a shared repository and running tests to ensure code quality. CD takes it further by automating the deployment of tested code to production environments. In Google Cloud, CI/CD pipelines can be set up using tools like Cloud Build, Cloud Source Repositories, and Cloud Deployment Manager. These pipelines help streamline development workflows, increase collaboration, and ensure rapid and reliable application delivery, allowing teams to deliver software updates more frequently and with reduced manual effort.
Azure DevOps and Azure Pipelines


An Ideal Candidate Should Also Demonstrate The Following Behaviours


Self-learning abilities
Radiates energy & enthusiasm for his field, and can instil the same passion in others
Naturally curious & always a step ahead
Critical thinker, challenging others in a constructive way, continuously looking for improvements
Can combine big-picture thinking, with zooming in on details.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
🎉 Join the Future of Fun! Become a Machine Learning Engineer in the iGaming Industry! 🎉

Are you a tech wizard with a passion for working with cool tech? If so, we have the perfect opportunity for you! We’re on the hunt for a Machine Learning Engineer to join our dynamic team in the thrilling world of iGaming. As a key player in our innovative team, you’ll be diving into the latest ML algorithms, crafting intelligent systems that enhance customer experience, and pushing the boundaries of what’s possible in the iGaming universe.




This role requires you to have the right to work in Europe no work visa on offer




KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Design, develop and maintain ML pipelines, ensuring high reliability and scalability.
Implement scalable machine learning infrastructure, to deploy advanced algorithms based on image, text, audio and tabular data.
Optimize trained AI models (latency, memory, throughput, ...)
Develop CI/CD pipelines and containerize production applications
Automate existing workflows withing Data Science team
Monitor and troubleshoot production ML systems to ensure smooth operation using alert systems.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams across data and engineering to come up with solutions to complex problem statements.
Lead research initiatives to explore new methodologies, tools, and technologies, and contribute to the development of best ML OPs practices within the company.







REQUIRED SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS




Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
Strong proficiency in Python, with extensive experience in PyTorch or TensorFlow.
Extensive knowledge of key machine learning metrics and optimization techniques.
Strong knowledge of version control systems (Git, data versioning, ...).
Experience in model management and experiment tracking frameworks
Strong knowledge and practical understanding of different ML Ops techniques.
Prior experience in handling very large datasets across different business functions.
Practical experience of deploying and monitoring scalable machine learning models in real-world applications.
Prior experience in CI/CD pipelines, containerization, scheduling and automation.
Prior experience in designing production ready and large-scale AI/ML systems end-to-end in a very fast-paced environment.
Excellent problem-solving, analytical, and communication skills.
Self-motivated individual who can work independently, and stay updated on updated with the latest advancements in AI, deep learning, generative AI and related system design areas.







PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:




Extensive experience with Azure ecosystem, in particular Azure Machine Learning.
Experience developing computer vision, text, audio, and/or tabular data models.
Strong proficiency in Gitlab CI, Jenkins, Grafana, Docker.
Excellent software engineering skills in API design and development, and concurrency design skills.




If you are a skilled Machine Learning Enginner who has passion to work in a fast-paced environment, have an eye for details and ready to experiment new things, we encourage you to apply and be part of our dynamic and innovative team and organization.

Show more

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Company Description

Sopra Steria offers tailored, end-to-end corporate technology and software solutions to help clients make bold choices and deliver results. Successfully so! With more than 56.000 colleagues in 30 countries, we rank as Europe’s leading digital solutions provider. Some of the most successful companies in Europe rely on our technology due to our commitment to innovation, collaboration, and value in business development.

The world is how we shape it. Let’s shape it together

Job Description

We have an opening for a person with a passion for data science & AI, interested in solving concrete business projects in a wide variety of domains and applications.

In this role, you will work closely with other Data Profiles from Sopra Steria but also from our clients’ internal teams. You will lead the way and participate in multiple advanced analytics & AI projects from the ideation phase to the value delivery. Every step of the way, you will ensure the quality of the analytical solution as well as the actionability towards the business stakeholders.

Does this sound like your ideal day-to-day drill? Then don’t wait any longer and let’s meet.

Qualifications

We’re seeking passionate colleagues who are eager to push the boundaries in digital transformation and technology consulting. At Sopra Steria, you’ll have the opportunity to grow your skills in a constructive, collaborative team environment, working on impactful projects that drive change for our clients. If you thrive on challenge and meet (most of) the qualifications below, we look forward to your application!

You’ll have knowledge and experience of the following:


You have multiple years of industry experience in building and delivering a variety of data science & AI applications / solutions
You understand that organizations today should make the most of the available information, in order to turn this information into value. You have acquired relevant skills through your past experiences
You are proficient in Python (all other programming languages are a plus).
You have worked on at least one cloud provider
You are motivated by obtaining concrete deliverables and results. You want to make a difference for the organizations you work for, and you like to be recognized for your input
You can work independently, but you also appreciate collaboration. You are open-minded and have no fear of expressing your opinion in a constructive way
You are proficient in English. You are also fluent in Dutch or French.
Experience in project management and people management is a plus


What We Can Offer You

As a member of one of Europe’s largest digital solutions providers, you’ll benefit from extensive career development opportunities, both local and international. At the Sopra Steria Academy, you’ll be part of a dynamic network of 56,000 professionals at all stages of their careers. With a wide array of offices to explore, you can find your ideal location and take the next step in your career.

You’ll become a part of a major Tech player in Europe recognised for its consulting, digital services, and software development. On top of that, you’ll join our Data & AI team, where we support enterprises and institutions to become more data driven, and assist our clients to increase business efficiency and create impact with data. We offer a complete portfolio of Services and Solutions to unburden organisations in every step of their transition: from defining and executing the data strategy and governance, over setting up data platforms, to visualizing dashboards and applying the latest data science and artificial intelligence methodologies.

Additional Information

Our employees are known for making bold choices and delivering results. Work among high-level professionals at the forefront of corporate software solutions and innovation at Europe’s Leading Digital Service Provider.

We offer a generous employee benefits package that includes:


A variety of perks, such as mobility options (including a company car), insurance coverage, meal vouchers, eco-cheques, and more.
Continuous learning opportunities through the Sopra Steria Academy to support your career development.
The opportunity to connect with fellow Sopra Steria colleagues at various team events.


People are the cornerstone of our success. That’s why we aspire to be bolder together. Our goal is to build high-functioning teams and healthy team environments that inspire and help each other to deliver excellence for each of our customers.

Excited about this job opportunity? Ready to shape the world with us? Great! We are looking forward to your application!

______

Sopra Steria is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to age, ancestry, nationality, color, family or medical leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, gender (including pregnancy), sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. We foster a work environment that is inclusive and respectful of all differences.
Show more
