You'll have the opportunity to contribute to the development of generative modeling techniques and large language models. Your role will involve building and optimizing state-of-the-art deep learning models, deploying them at scale, and working in a collaborative environment with some of the best minds in AI and Biotech.

This is a unique opportunity to make a significant impact at a well-funded, fast-growing company that is defining the future of AI in the Biotech space.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Design, implement, and deploy machine learning models with a focus on large language models and generative modeling.
  • Fine-tune and optimize deep learning models at scale, applying advanced hyperparameter tuning techniques.
  • Collaborate closely with a highly skilled, interdisciplinary team of researchers, engineers, and Biotech experts to integrate AI solutions into real-world applications.
  • Drive continuous improvements in model performance and scalability.
  • Stay up-to-date with the latest research and technological advancements in AI/ML and contribute innovative ideas to the team.


Required Skills:

  • 3+ years of industry experience in Machine Learning and AI.
  • Strong expertise in large language models (LLMs), including experience coding, deploying, evaluating, and fine-tuning these models.
  • Hands-on experience with deep learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or similar, and a strong understanding of model training and evaluation.
  • Proficiency in deploying machine learning models at scale in cloud-based environments (AWS, GCP, Azure, etc.).
  • Experience with hyperparameter tuning and optimization techniques.
  • Solid understanding of machine learning algorithms and techniques, particularly in generative modeling and NLP.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
On behalf of our established client UMATR are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Machine Learning Engineer to spearhead machine learning initiatives. In this critical role, you’ll lay the foundation for ML/AI capabilities and lead the development of innovative solutions that enhance the platform.




What You’ll Do:

Lead ML Development: Design, develop, and deploy state-of-the-art machine learning models to power our platform.
Shape Strategy & Vision: Collaborate with leadership to create and execute a strategic roadmap for machine learning initiatives that align with organisational goals.
Collaborate Cross-functionally: Partner with product managers and cross-functional teams to identify opportunities where ML can solve complex challenges and improve user experience.
Vector Database Management: Build and manage vector databases to store, retrieve, and perform fast, accurate similarity searches on high-dimensional data.
Data Management & Analysis: Collect, preprocess, and analyze large datasets to inform model development and derive actionable insights.
Feature Engineering: Design and implement feature engineering techniques to enhance model performance and accuracy.
Model Training & Optimisation: Train, fine-tune, and optimize machine learning models, ensuring they meet performance, accuracy, and scalability goals.
Research & Innovation: Stay ahead of industry trends by researching the latest advancements in AI and machine learning, bringing innovative solutions to the platform.
Testing & Maintenance: Develop and maintain robust testing frameworks to ensure model reliability and consistency over time.
Documentation: Document workflows, model architectures, and methodologies to promote knowledge sharing and model reproducibility within the team.




What We’re Looking For:

Educational Background: Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Machine Learning, or a related field.
Experience: Proven track record as a Machine Learning Engineer or similar role, with hands-on experience building, deploying, and maintaining machine learning systems.
Technical Proficiency: Strong expertise in Python, R, and key ML frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn).
Strong Fundamentals: Deep understanding of data structures, algorithms, and core software engineering principles.
LLM & Generative AI Expertise: Experience with Large Language Models (LLM) and related frameworks (e.g., LangChain), with a solid grounding in Generative AI.
NLP Expertise: Knowledge of Natural Language Processing (NLP) techniques and tools for building language-centric applications.
Vector Databases: Experience with vector databases (e.g., Pinecone, FAISS, Milvus) for managing high-dimensional data and building recommendation systems or similarity search engines.
Cloud & Containerisation: Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, Google Cloud, Azure) and containerisation tools like Docker and Kubernetes (preferred but not required).
Leadership & Autonomy: Proven ability to lead projects and work both independently and as part of a team.
Excellent Communication Skills: Ability to articulate complex technical concepts clearly to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Fluency in English, German or French would be a great addition




Why Join Us?

Innovative Environment: Work on cutting-edge AI/ML technology that pushes the boundaries of what’s possible.
Collaborative Culture: Thrive in a dynamic and cross-functional team, collaborating with product managers and engineers to drive real-world impact.
Growth & Development: You’ll be at the forefront of developing a highly impactful product with plenty of opportunities to innovate and grow.




If you're passionate about AI, machine learning, and the future of technology, we’d love to hear from you!

Title: Data Scientist, Product, Ads Metrics
Description:
Minimum qualifications:


Master's degree in Statistics, Economics, Engineering, Mathematics, a related quantitative field, or equivalent practical experience.
3 years of experience with statistical data analysis, data mining, and querying (e.g., SQL).
1 year of experience managing analytical projects.
Experience with statistics and business analysis.


Preferred qualifications:


Master's degree or PhD in a quantitative discipline (e.g., Statistics, Operations Research, Bioinformatics, Economics, Computational Biology, Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, or Engineering), or a related field.
3 years of experience in scripting, statistical analysis (e.g., R, Stata, SPSS, SAS), developing and managing metrics, and evaluating programs/products.
Experience with database languages (SQL) and statistical software (Python).
Experience in data analysis to solve business problems in complex, fast-moving, and ambiguous business environments, with strong data intuition and business acumen.
Excellent scientific writing, communication, and presentation skills.


About The Job

Help serve Google's worldwide user base of more than a billion people. Data Scientists provide quantitative support, market understanding and a strategic perspective to our partners throughout the organization. As a data-loving member of the team, you serve as an analytics expert for your partners, using numbers to help them make better decisions. You will weave stories with meaningful insight from data. You'll make critical recommendations for your fellow Googlers in Engineering and Product Management. You relish tallying up the numbers one minute and communicating your findings to a team leader the next.

Google Ads is helping power the open internet with the best technology that connects and creates value for people, publishers, advertisers, and Google. We’re made up of multiple teams, building Google’s Advertising products including search, display, shopping, travel and video advertising, as well as analytics. Our teams create trusted experiences between people and businesses with useful ads. We help grow businesses of all sizes from small businesses, to large brands, to YouTube creators, with effective advertiser tools that deliver measurable results. We also enable Google to engage with customers at scale.

Responsibilities


Own the process of gathering, extracting, and compiling data across sources via relevant tools (e.g., SQL, R, Python). Format, re-structure, and validate data to ensure quality.
Run business-critical ad-hoc product analyses with fast turnaround and present results to executive stakeholders to deliver insights and support product decisions in Search Ads.
Collaborate with Product Managers, Engineers, and other Data Scientists to identify and clarify business or product questions, and translate them into tractable analyses and metrics.
Develop and maintain product health metrics and dashboards to track key performance indicators, identify trends, and provide insights. Ensure data quality and consistency to empower other teams in delivering insights.
Identify and size opportunities for product growth and improvement, such as increasing adoption, reducing churn, or improving performance, and collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement solutions.



Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

Title: CTO & Co-Founder (AI Engineer / Data Scientist / Developer / ML)
Description:
Are you an AI-driven innovator who loves solving complex problems? Do you want to build a game-changing AI trading technology from the ground up? SetupView AI is looking for a Technical Co-Founder (CTO) to lead the development of our AI-powered trading and investing technology.




About SetupView AI

SetupView AI is an advanced trading technology platform powered by artificial intelligence (AI), designed to help traders and investors make data-driven decisions while fostering psychological discipline and emotional control. By analyzing price action and market trends, SetupView AI enables traders to trade smarter and more consistently.




Your Role as Co-Founder & CTO

As the Technical Co-Founder (CTO), you will be the architect of SetupView AI’s technology, driving the development of our AI models and trading platform. You'll work side-by-side with the founding team to build, scale, and refine the AI engine that powers SetupView AI.




Your Responsibilities:

✅ Develop & Scale AI Models – Train and refine machine learning models for candlestick pattern recognition, price-action analysis, and market predictions

✅ Build the Core Platform – Design and develop the platform’s architecture, including real-time data processing and the user dashboard

✅ Data Integration – Work with stock market and crypto APIs (e.g., Alpha Vantage, Yahoo Finance) to integrate real-time and historical data

✅ Innovate with Reinforcement Learning – Experiment with reinforcement learning to enhance the AI’s ability to adapt to market conditions




Current Progress

✅ Server Infrastructure Set Up – Backend and processing power in place

✅ Market Data Integrated – Stock data successfully fetched

✅ Training with Basic Data – AI model trained on foundational datasets for pattern recognition

✅ Dashboard v1 Created – First version with AI response output for initial testing

✅ Promising Initial Results – Early testing meets expectations, confirming model viability




Next Steps

🚀 LangChain Agent Setup – Implementing an intelligent agent for better decision-making

🚀 Reinforcement Learning Integration – Enhancing AI adaptability and trading decision-making

🚀 LSTM & RL Model Development – Building a hybrid model for sequential pattern recognition

🚀 Training Neural Network with Reinforcement Learning – Improving AI response over time

🚀 LSTM Model Testing – Validating performance on real market data







Who We’re Looking For

We need someone who:

✔️ Has strong AI/ML experience, particularly in time-series analysis, pattern recognition, and deep learning

✔️ Is proficient in Python, TensorFlow/PyTorch/LangChain/AutoGen, and full-stack development (React, TypeScript, Node.js)

✔️ Understands trading, market data, or financial technology (not required but a huge plus!)

✔️ Has an entrepreneurial mindset and thrives in a fast-paced startup environment

✔️ Is ideally based in Switzerland or Europe (remote possible with strong collaboration)




Why Join SetupView AI?

🚀 Build something revolutionary – Disrupt trading psychology with AI-powered decision-making.

💡 Be at the forefront of AI & finance – Develop cutting-edge ML models for real-world trading applications.

📈 Equity-based co-founder opportunity – Own a stake in the company’s success

📈 Additionally, allocation of SetupView AI ecosystem token




Reach out with your background and vision for SetupView AI.

Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
For Sony Advanced Visual Sensing

Location: Zurich, Switzerland

We offer an exciting position as part of a small R&D team which develops algorithm prototypes and solutions for future Sony sensors. You’ll be working with innovative, unreleased technology and get an opportunity to influence the future roadmap of Sony Semiconductor Solutions, the world leading image sensor company. Investigate and demonstrate the value of new sensor designs across a diverse range of applications and use cases such as mobile photography, video, automation, AR/XR/VR, and more.

Our team, being acquired in 2019 by Sony, strives to keep its startup spirit alive with a culture of curiosity and high engagement. In this position, you will develop algorithms to exploit the characteristics of new sensors in close collaboration with the colleagues that design those sensors.


Are you passionate about the future of technology, imaging, and sensing?
Do you enjoy designing and implementing software and algorithms where elegant and simple pieces of code click like clockwork to form a magical whole?
Are you a curious mind, eager to learn and courageous to put ideas to the test even if they could fail?


If this is the case, then join us. At Sony AVS we value diversity and do our best to nurture a workplace with room for different opinions, personalities, and backgrounds.

To Introduce Yourself, Please Take Some Time To Answer The Questions Under The Following Link, Along With The Usual CV-based Job Application Submission

===========================================

Use this link to share more of your background: https://forms.office.com/r/JVPwpGMaSV

===========================================

At Sony AVS, You Will


Research, develop and implement new algorithms to prototype and validate commercial applications of Sony sensors
Work together with the team to improve and future-proof our processes, software and tools
Collaborate closely with our computer vision, AI and hardware experts for best system performance and help develop the sensors of the future
Develop deep insights into how the world can be understood through photons
Coordinate developments within a multi-cultural work environment that spans engineering sites from Japan, Europe, and North America across the Sony Group organization


You Should Have


MSc or higher in Computer Science, Software Engineering or similar field
Proficiency in Python and optimally additional programming and scripting languages
Applied experience with Computer Vision and/or Deep Learning algorithms from previous positions, internships or academic projects as well as a solid theoretical background
Experience (preferably industry experience) with modern software development methodologies and principles, such as CI/CD, containers, SOLID, etc. as well as MLOps frameworks and tools
Confident communication skills and fluency in English
Ambition to continuously learn and improve


You Can Set Yourself Apart If You Have


Experience with various sensing modalities such as conventional CMOS cameras and the corresponding processing stack, event-based cameras, LIDAR, ToF, IMU, structured light etc.
Experience in technology transfer, bringing technology from R&D to market, be it through experience in a startup or a product-focused corporate R&D department in a relevant area


The position is within the Sony Advanced Visual Sensing (AVS) group which is an R&D center of Sony Semiconductor Solutions based in Zurich, Switzerland and a former spin-off of the Swiss Federal Institute of Technology (ETH Zurich) and the University of Zurich. We develop novel computer vision algorithms, vision sensors and sensing systems based on our world-leading sensing expertise, including event-based cameras, CMOS cameras and more. We’re a small and dynamic team where everybody can talk to everybody and give inputs on any topic at any time. The team continues to actively shape itself and everybody can have a big influence not only on technical topics but also on our culture and the way we work. We aim to give people the space to learn new things and develop themselves. We value and empower the individual to empower us!

Sony Semiconductor Solutions (sony-semicon.com) is the world market leader in image sensors, and it is very likely that you knowingly or unknowingly already take your photos with a Sony image sensor. Sony is using its unique technological advantage in image sensors to conquer new fields and markets. If you join us, you will be at the forefront of these activities. We are proud to have been named one of the World's Most Ethical Companies multiple years in a row.

If this sounds like your next adventure, we’re looking forward to hearing from you!

If this sounds like your next adventure, we’re looking forward to hearing from you!

Title: AI Engineer - Internship
Description:
We are looking for interns to support us in the development and deployment of learning-based models on our robot.

Requirements

Hands-on experience in working with machine learning models, including training and fine-tuning. Robotics experience is a plus but not required.

Particularly:


Excellent knowledge of Python, PyTorch.
Experience in C++ is a plus.
Experience in state of the art perception models.
Experience in robot control.
Experience in reinforcement learning & diffusion models is a plus.


We are looking for a person who enjoys working in a team in a very dynamic and fast-moving environment.

Benefits

We at Flexion Robotics (flexion.ai) are a young company in Zurich working on the next generation of humanoid robot software to enable robots to perform useful tasks autonomously.

We work dynamically and move fast. The team is still fairly small and every new employee at this stage will have significant ownership of their current project.

We offer a competitive remuneration in the form of a competitive base salary and additional components/benefits depending on the specific role and the experience of the applicant.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer 100%
Description:
We are seeking a talented and driven Machine Learning Engineer to join MDPI’s Data Intelligence (DI) Team. The DI team is dedicated to developing a cutting-edge data intelligence platform designed to enhance data-driven decision-making and operational efficiency. Our platform integrates data from multiple sources, providing actionable insights into company performance, market dynamics, and emerging trends. In this role, you will primarily collaborate with the DI team, composed of senior and junior data scientists, while also engaging with the AI and Data Engineering teams to leverage a shared microservices-based infrastructure.

Tasks & Responsibilities

As a Machine Learning Engineer at MDPI, you will be responsible for:


Platform Development: Contribute to the development of the Data Intelligence platform, designed to centralize data and provide advanced performance analysis, trend alerting systems, and market insights to support data-driven decision-making across the organization.
Team Collaboration: Work closely with the AI and Data Engineering teams to support a shared, modular system architecture, ensuring a flexible and scalable environment for machine learning and data analytics applications.
Model Integration: Support the integration of machine learning models into the platform. This includes building APIs to deliver model outputs to a frontend interface developed in frameworks like Vue, React, or Next.js.
Data-Driven Solutions: Develop, deploy, and optimize machine learning models that align with strategic goals, such as monitoring market trends, supporting journal performance analysis, and forecasting key business metrics.
Advanced Engineering Features: Contribute to the creation of innovative platform features, such as automated alert systems and tools for advanced data analysis, designed to uncover insights that inform MDPI’s strategic objectives.


Requirements


Education: Bachelor's or master's degree in computer science, Data Science, Machine Learning, or a related field.
Experience: 5+ years of experience in machine learning or data engineering, with a track record of deploying models into production.
Technical Skills: Proficiency in Python; experience with frameworks such as FastAPI and strong familiarity with data engineering tools (e.g., Airflow, Docker, Kubernetes) and microservices-based architecture. Engineering skills in deploying scalable, containerized applications and managing orchestration with Kubernetes are particularly valued.
Frontend Development (Preferred): Experience with front-end technologies such as Vue.js, React, or Next.js is a plus, particularly for integrating model results into an intuitive user interface.
Data Science & NLP: Strong understanding of NLP techniques, time series analysis, and predictive modelling.
Collaboration and Communication: Proven ability to work effectively across teams, especially in data engineering, analytics, and AI-focused environments.
Problem-Solving: Demonstrated skill in analyzing complex data problems and developing impactful solutions.
Project Management: Familiarity with Agile and Scrum methodologies, with experience using project management tools.


What We Offer


The opportunity to contribute to the academic/scientific community;
Flexible working hours;
Team bond strengthening through team-building events;
Professional growth opportunities with our global training system;
Working in a collaborative, diverse, and socially responsible team;
Company retreat facility;
Full-coverage insurance for accidents/daily sickness;
Prime location near Basel train station and city center;
And more...


If you are interested in this position, we look forward to receiving:


A motivational letter (EN) that briefly describes your motivations for joining MDPI
A resume (EN) including personal information, past & current education,
Copy of ID and Diplomas
If available: reference letters and certificates.


About MDPI

A pioneer in scholarly open access publishing, MDPI has supported academic communities since 1996. Our mission is to foster open scientific exchange in all forms, across all disciplines. We operate more than 400 diverse, peer-reviewed, open access journals supported by over 66,000 academic editors. We serve scholars from around the world to ensure the latest research is openly and broadly available.

MDPI is headquartered in Switzerland with additional offices in Europe, Asia and North America. We are committed to ensuring that high quality research is made available as quickly as possible. We also support sustainability projects, with sustainability as a key theme in many journals and through the MDPI Sustainability Foundation.

Initiatives

At MDPI, we develop and maintain various platforms in order to better serve the scientific community. Please find here-below a list of our main platforms:



https://www.mdpi.com

https://www.mdpi.com/books/

https://sciprofiles.com

https://sciforum.net

https://www.scilit.net

https://www.preprints.org

https://encyclopedia.pub


Show more

Title: Machine Learning Specialist
Description:
Location: On-site, Remote or Hybrid in Switzerland




Responsibilities:

Develop and train ML models for accurate material requirement calculations.
Optimise ML models for accuracy, efficiency, and scalability.
Collaborate with Data Engineers to integrate ML models into the platform’s backend.
Perform data analysis to identify patterns and insights that inform model development.
Test and validate ML models to ensure reliability and performance.
Implement and maintain model monitoring to detect and resolve performance issues.
Develop algorithms to ensure AI operates within defined parameters, maintaining safety and compliance.
Document ML models and methodologies for future reference and scalability.
Stay up to date with the latest ML research and industry trends to enhance model capabilities.
Work closely with the Product and Development teams to align ML initiatives with business objectives.
Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to ML model performance and data quality.

Requirements:

A minimum of an MBA or a master’s degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, or Statistics from a top-tier university such as MIT, Stanford, ETH Zurich, or UC Berkeley.
At least five years of experience as an ML Specialist or in a similar role within a technology-driven company.
Strong expertise in machine learning algorithms, data analysis, and model training.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, or Java.
Experience with ML frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or scikit-learn.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and teamwork abilities.
Familiarity with data preprocessing and feature engineering techniques.
Experience with cloud-based ML services is advantageous.
Proven ability to implement algorithms that ensure AI operates within predefined safety and compliance standards.

Benefits:

Competitive salary.
Complimentary lunch provided daily.
Access to a fully equipped gym at no cost.
Full coverage of all social contributions by the company.
Comprehensive health insurance.
Opportunities for professional growth and career development.
Flexible working hours with remote work options.
A dynamic and inclusive work environment.

Title: Machine Learning Operations Engineer (MLOps)
Description:
Who we are

X23D AG is a dynamic MedTech startup revolutionizing surgical guidance by advancing computer- and robot assisted surgery through cutting-edge artificial intelligence. Our growing research and development team is dedicated to transforming the surgical guidance market by delivering innovative products that seamlessly integrate into existing surgical workflows—ensuring they are both highly accurate and incredibly simple to use.

As a spin-off from Balgrist University Hospital and the University of Zurich, X23D benefits from unparalleled access to world-class medical and scientific expertise. This unique position allows us to develop solutions that directly address real-world clinical needs, bridging the gap between state-of-the-art research and practical surgical applications, even in low-resource settings!




Who we are looking for

We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced MLOps engineer with a strong background in designing, implementing and maintaining automated and scalable ML pipelines, model deployment lifecycle and data management.

You will take the lead in designing, implementing from ground up, and maintaining tools and software that enable efficient end-to-end ML pipelines (training, validation, deployment and monitoring).

This role is ideal for someone with deep expertise in AI processes, particularly in applications involving natural (e.g., RGB-D) and/or medical imaging (e.g., X-ray, CT scan) datasets.

As part of our interdisciplinary team, we highly value strong communication, leadership, and analytical problem-solving skills. Prior experience in the MedTech industry is a significant advantage.




Roles and Responsibilities




Designing, building and maintaining the entire ML pipeline, ensuring reliable model deployment, versioning, monitoring, and scalability.
Implementing efficient model and data monitoring processes and infrastructures.
Continuous integration and deployment of our ML models.
Developing scalable data management and versioning workflows.
Managing and implementing cloud resources for ML workloads and data processing.
Working closely with the software development and data science team to optimize model, data and inference pipelines.
Providing initiative and leadership to identify and implement MLOps best practices in our company.
Engaging with different stakeholders to define our high-level MLOps strategy.
Maintaining compliance with security and data governance standards.




Qualifications




2-5 years of work experience in MLOps, DevOps or a related filed.
MSc or PhD degree in computer science, informatics or related fields.
Profound understanding of machine learning principles and model lifecycle management.
Experience in integrating, evaluating and deploying pipelines for robust and scalable AI software solutions.
Experience in cloud computing and cloud data management (e.g., Google cloud, AWS, Azure, etc.) and their respective machine learning services.
Excellent programming skills in Python.
Hands on experience in working with common machine learning frameworks and libraries (e.g., Pytorch, Tensorflow or Keras).
Knowledge in containerization and orchestration tools (e.g., Docker)
Knowledge in CI/CD pipelines (e..g, github actions, Jenkins, etc.).
Experience in working with medical imaging data types (e.g., 3D volumetric data) is a big plus.




What we Offer

We are a team of dedicated young professionals with a mission to bridge the gap between the front-line developments in the fields of computer science, engineering and surgery. Working in our team is a unique opportunity to expand your professional portfolio by having day-to-day collaborations with colleagues with a vast variety of backgrounds, ranging from surgery and healthcare to computer science and biomedical engineering. As part of our compensation package, we offer a competitive salary and the ability for a flexible and hybrid (on-site + remote) work schedule.

We take pride in fostering a diverse, welcoming, and supportive work environment where everyone can thrive, learn, and enjoy their role. You’ll also have the opportunity to collaborate with our interdisciplinary team across multiple geographic locations.

Title: Junior ML & Signal Processing Engineer (Radar/Edge ML)
Description:
About the Company




Algorized is a fast-growing deep tech startup building software platform for people positioning and sensing. We leverage algorithms and edge-ML with any market available communication sensors such as Ultra-Wideband Radar for accurate people tracking, positioning, vital sign detection (breathing, heart-rate), age classifications.




As we continue to rapidly expand, we are seeking a highly skilled Junior ML and Signal Processing Engineer with genuine passion for innovation and experience in developing products from concept to mass deployment. If you are resourceful and have a good grasp of statistics, probability and ML/AI and are ready to join a dynamic fast-growing start-up this unique opportunity is for you!




Key Responsibilities

Design and implement complex machine learning models and algorithms processing raw radar sensor data and other sensor data to address customer business needs
Manage the machine learning pipeline, own the process of gathering, extracting, and compiling data across sources via relevant tools and separately format, re-structure, or validate data to ensure quality, and review the datasets to ensure it is ready for analysis
Analyze extensive datasets to identify trends and patterns and interpret them
Design tools for synthetic data generation and algorithm validation
Test and develop new techniques to provide critical insights and communicate them clearly with stakeholders 
Preprocess data for enhanced model accuracy and efficiency of people sensing and tracking
Build the foundation for platform-based data collection and analytics
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate data analytics and ML pipeline with the rest of the SW stack on the edge




Minimum Requirements

MSc/PhD in Data Science, Mathematics, Computer Science or a related field
1+ years hands on experience in a similar position (Radar / LiDAR / Computer vision)
Strong ML research background in conjunction with a strong coding experience
Startup mentality, solution driven, can do approach
Proficiency in Python and in standard ML tools – TensorFlow / PyTorch / Scikit-Learn
Experienced in Algorithm design and optimization
Hands on proficiency in C/C++
Obsessively passionate and inquisitive and seek to solve everyday problems in innovative ways
Experience with lightweight / edge ML technologies preferred
Good understanding of signal and image processing preferred
Experience with Generative Adversarial Neural Nets (GAN) preferred
Good familiarity time series models preferred
Ability to work in a hybrid mode with min. 60% in office

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Job Title: Data Scientist Lead




Responsibilities:

Data Analysis: Manage and analyze pharmaceutical datasets (clinical trials, patents, research, market data) to identify promising drug candidates.
Predictive Modeling: Develop or collaborate with vendors to create machine learning models predicting the success and market potential of assets.
Collaboration: Work with scientists and executives to align data insights with pipeline strategy.
Competitive Insights: Monitor industry trends, identify gaps in therapeutic areas, and suggest partnership or acquisition opportunities.
Data Sourcing & Cleaning: Process and analyze data from various sources (FDA, EMA, PubMed, pharma databases).
Visualization & Reporting: Develop dashboards and reports to present findings clearly.




Key Skills:

Technical: Proficient in Python, R, SQL, and machine learning for predictive analytics and natural language processing (NLP).
Pharma Tools: Familiarity with pharma databases and cheminformatics tools (e.g., RDKit, Bioconductor).
Data Visualization: Skilled in tools like Tableau, Power BI, Matplotlib, Plotly.
AI Expertise: Knowledge in AI for drug development is a plus.
Vendor Management: Ability to oversee and manage vendors and suppliers.
Strategic Insight: Understanding of data science trends and their application in pharma.




Domain Knowledge:

Therapeutics: Knowledge of disease biology, drug mechanisms, and pharmacokinetics.
Regulatory: Familiarity with FDA/EMA approval processes and clinical trials.
Business Acumen: Understanding of pharma M&A trends and partnerships.




Soft Skills:

Strong communication skills to translate technical findings to business strategy.
Analytical thinking and problem-solving in uncertain data scenarios.
Team-oriented and motivated to contribute in a biotech environment.




Requirements:

Education: Master’s/PhD in Data Science, Bioinformatics, Computational Biology, or similar.
Experience: 3+ years in pharma/biotech analytics or drug development.
Technical Proficiency: Expertise in Python, R, SQL, and cheminformatics.
Domain Knowledge: Familiarity with clinical trials, regulatory processes, and therapeutic areas.




Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with pharma datasets (e.g., IQVIA, Clarivate).
Knowledge of emerging trends like AI-driven drug discovery.
Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP).
Ongoing commitment to professional development.

Title: Research engineer
Description:
Mission

The Laboratory of Sustainability Robotics (LSR) of the Swiss Federal Institute of Technology, Lausanne (EPFL) searches a motivated and skilled Research Engineer to manage and maintain our state-of-the-art Flight arena for testing and validating of aerial robotics and drone technologies. This facility supports various research projects, academic coursework, and collaborations, making it a dynamic and multidisciplinary environment. The successful candidate will oversee operations, ensure compliance with health and safety regulations, and contribute to the advancement of drone research and development.

Main Duties And Responsibilities

The main activities to be carried out as part of the project include:


Maintain and manage the lab facilities and associated equipment, including drones, motion capture systems, and safety infrastructure.
Perform regular inspections, troubleshooting, and maintenance of hardware and software used in the arena.
Assist academic staff, researchers, and students in setting up experiments and tests within the lab.
Ensure the facility complies with all health and safety standards and regulations.
Conduct risk assessments for activities within the facility and develop safety procedures.
Train users on safety protocols and emergency response procedures.
Coordinate access for visitors, external collaborators, and industry partners.
Maintain accurate records of facility usage, incidents, and equipment inventory.
Support funding applications and project proposals related to facility development or drone research.


Profile

The candidates should hold a degree (BSc, MSc, or higher) in a relevant discipline such as Robotics, Aerospace Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field.

Technical Skills


Experience with aerial robotics systems, including drone operation, design, or programming.
Knowledge of motion capture systems, flight controllers, and simulation software (e.g., ROS, Gazebo, PX4, or ArduPilot).
Familiarity with programming languages such as Python, C++, or MATLAB.
Basic understanding of electronics and mechatronics for drone maintenance and repair.


Health And Safety Expertise


Experience conducting risk assessments and developing health and safety procedures.
Knowledge of safety standards relevant to drone operations and testing environments.


Soft Skills


Strong organizational and multitasking abilities.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to work with diverse stakeholders, including students, researchers, and external partners.
Problem-solving mindset and the ability to troubleshoot technical issues independently.
Desirable Attributes
Previous experience in managing or operating a similar research facility or lab.
Familiarity with collaborative research environments, especially in academia or industry.
A passion for innovation in aerial robotics and a proactive approach to exploring emerging technologies.


We offer


A stimulating and international working environment in the EPFL campus/Lausanne.
Competitive salary and excellent working conditions.
Opportunity to perform state-of-the-art research in one of the most dynamic scientific institutions in Europe


Informations

Only applications submitted through the online platform are considered. You are asked to supply:

A brief cover letter (pdf, up to 2 pages).

And In One PDF


A CV with a publication list.
A research statement (pdf, up to 3 pages).
Contact details for 3 referees.


For any further information, please contact: mirko.kovac@epfl.ch

Contract Start Date : as soon as possible

Activity Rate : 100.00

Contract Type: CDD

Duration: 1 year

Mission

The Laboratory of Sustainability Robotics (LSR) of the Swiss Federal Institute of Technology, Lausanne (EPFL) searches a motivated and skilled Research Engineer to manage and maintain our state-of-the-art Flight arena for testing and validating of aerial robotics and drone technologies. This facility supports various research projects, academic coursework, and collaborations, making it a dynamic and multidisciplinary environment. The successful candidate will oversee operations, ensure compliance with health and safety regulations, and contribute to the advancement of drone research and development.

Main Duties And Responsibilities

Title: Process Data Scientist
Description:
By clicking the “Apply” button, I understand that my employment application process with Takeda will commence and that the information I provide in my application will be processed in line with Takeda’s Privacy Notice and Terms of Use. I further attest that all information I submit in my employment application is true to the best of my knowledge.

Job Description:

Job Title Process Data Scientist:

Location CHE - Neuchâtel:

Primary duties:


Develops predictive/prescriptive models (CQAs, yield) with SME’s throught adequate tools like Simca to improve process robustness and efficiency.
Owns, manages, executes and maintain local data science initiatives.
Gathers and identifies local data science possibilities/initiatives/requests in collaboration with local team, IT, Engineering, Quality and global GMS data science.
Provides the local link between local and global GMS data science, local functions, Quality, IT, Engineering in the respective region/Operational Business Unit.
Drives the local execution and implementation of GMS Data Science strategy and initiatives.


Responsabilties:


Diagnostic model create, maintain and improve
Predictive model create, maintain and improve
Training and coaching
Project management
Investigation support


Education and Experience Requirements:


University degree of science/business
Advanced degree (Master/MBA and/or PhD) in highly quantitive field, e.g. in Engineering, Mathematics, IT, Economics or Physics with focus on either Control Theory/Statistics/Mechatronics, Information/Operation, Management/Strategy/Economics, Technology and Innovation Management
2+ years work experience in data analysis related position or equivalent academic experience/course record.
Hands-on experience in applying and executing Artificial Intelligence/Deep Learning, Machine Learning, Big Data and Digital with respective programming knowledge
Language French (B2) or willing to learn and English (C1)


Digital & Data Science Skills:


Strong expertise and experience in Artificial Intelligence/Deep Learning, Machine Learning, Big Data and Digital
Respective programming knowledge in Python/R/C is required. Further programming experience is advantageous
Proficiency in database languages (SQL), understanding of data models and databases
Compositional data analysis and analyzing time series data
Distributed computing, stochastic modelling, sampling methods and randomized algorithms
Explainable Artificial Intelligence methods


Complexity and Problem Solving:

Technical/Functional (Line) Expertise: (Breadth and depth of knowledge, application and complexity of technical knowledge)


Strong expertise and experience in Digital/Big Data Analytics/ Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning algorithms, respective programming knowledge
Capabilities to translate business needs into data analytics concepts and the other way
Hands-on, able to implement and execute data science initiatives, analysis, machine learning
High level project management skills


Leadership:


A firm grasp of industry, scientific and digital, artificial intelligence, machine learning and data science trends and market conditions, to develop solutions enhance compliance and quality of life for patients
Role requires partnership with local functions, IT, Engineering, Quality and Global Data Science team.
Provide patient-centered best in class GMS Data science, enhance local data science


Decision-making and Autonomy:


Responsible for day to day operation of local data science function, covering all data science levels and related technologies


Interaction:


Role requires partnership across local, functional and global GMS Data Science, IT, Engineering and GMS region
Clear partnership with Quality is required to ensure alignment for data science processes.


Innovation:


Translate data science, artificial intelligence and machine learning trends and technologie into execution


Complexity:


Impact across GMS portfolio
Ability to interface with international stakeholders and to connect internal and external data analytics experts of both academia and industries
Change management complexity
Capabilities to translate business needs into data analytics concepts and the other way
Hands-on, able to implement and execute initiatives


Internal and External Contacts:


Digital and Data Science - Global Manufacturing Science
Global IT (OSIPi, Simca, PAS-X)
Supplier of mathematical computing software (Mathworks)
Supplier of Data analytics tools and real time monitoring tools (Sartorius)


En savoir plus sur Takeda Neuchâtel

Avec plus de 700 collaborateurs, Takeda Neuchâtel est l’un des dix plus grands employeurs du Canton de Neuchâtel et l’un des sites de production biopharmaceutique de référence en Suisse. Actif 24 heures sur 24 et 7 jours sur 7, le site emploie un large éventail de professionnels formés aux biotechnologies et à leur application dans la production industrielle.

Avec plus de vingt nationalités, Takeda Neuchâtel offre un environnement de travail international, diversifié et innovant au sein d’une entreprise ancrée et engagée dans son écosystème local.

Takeda Neuchâtel est certifiée Entreprise Formatrice par le Secrétariat d'Etat à l'Economie Suisse. Nous formons des jeunes apprentis dans divers domaines tels que le contrôle qualité en laboratoire, la logistique, l’informatique et la production biopharmaceutique.

“Donner à nos employés les moyens de briller”

Takeda est fière de son engagement à créer une main-d'œuvre diversifiée et à offrir des opportunités d les employés et candidats à l'emploi sans tenir compte de la couleur de peau, de la religion, du sexe, d sexuelle, de l'identité de genre, de l'expression de genre, du statut parental, de l'origine nationale, de l statut de citoyenneté, des informations ou caractéristiques génétiques, de l'état civil ou de toute autre protégée par la loi.

Locations:

CHE - Neuchatel

Worker Type:

Employee

Worker Sub-Type:

Regular

Time Type:

Full time

Title: Machine Learning / AI Engineer
Description:
Job Title: Machine Learning / AI Engineers

Job Type: Full-time (80% - 100%)

Location: Zurich (hybrid and flexible)



We have partnered with one of the leading health technologies, and they are now looking for machine learning and AI engineers to solve real-world challenges and create transformative solutions.



What You'll Do:





Build and deploy scalable AI-powered web applications using modern frameworks like Node.js, React, and TypeScript.
Develop machine learning workflows with a focus on large language models (LLMs) and natural language processing (NLP).
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design, implement, and optimize AI solutions.
Stay updated on AI advancements and apply them to real-world projects.
Ensure reliability, efficiency, and performance in AI model deployment.


Qualifications:




Strong experience with web application development (Node.js, React, TypeScript).
Proficiency in Python for integrating ML/AI components.
Knowledge of cloud-based and local model deployments, vector databases, and MLOps/DevOps best practices.
Solid foundation in applied machine learning, including LLMs and NLP workflows.


Why Join Us?




Innovative and inclusive work environment.
Opportunities for growth and learning.
Competitive salary and flexible work options.


I can discuss this role in detail; if this interests you, apply with your latest CV!

Title: Machine Learning Data Scientist Intern
Description:
Be a part of a revolutionary change!

Times are changing at PMI. We’ve chosen to do something big. The world expects us to act responsibly. And we are doing just that by transforming our business and building our future on one clear purpose – to deliver a smoke-free future.

This transformation will revolutionize every area of our business. The products we sell. Where we sell them. How they’re manufactured and delivered. The way we talk to our customers and engage with society.

It’s the perfect setting place to start your career. As you take your first steps, you’ll have the backing of a multinational business combined with the freedom of a start-up. You’ll bring a positive mindset and fresh perspective to projects that can make a huge difference to so many.

About The Team

The Digital Product Innovation group drives product innovation by exploiting the expertise of the Digital Solutions Product Category Management team. This group supports business teams from ideation to product brief, providing digital leadership and expertise, technology innovation, and de-risking technologies, including rapid prototyping.

Project Description

This project aims to use natural language processing algorithms to classify and analyze big data from PMI. The project will involve applying both traditional supervised learning algorithms and state-of-the-art GPT algorithms to PMI’s internal data. The goal is to gain insights and understanding from the data through the use of NLP techniques. The project will involve collaboration with team members and stakeholders to ensure the analysis meets the project’s goals and provides valuable insights. This project presents an exciting opportunity to explore the potential of NLP algorithms in the analysis of big data.

Roles & Objectives

The student’s role would be to run and customize several NLP algorithms on the internal data of PMI.

Their Objectives Would Include


Understand project requirements and scope to tailor NLP solutions effectively.
Conducting research and analysis on the internal data of PMI to develop the NLP algorithms.
Develop, fine-tune, and test NLP algorithms that extract valuable insights from textual information.
Propose robust AWS architectures to efficiently run NLP scripts.
Benchmark the performance of the model & continuously refine and enhance algorithm performance.
Collaborating with team members and stakeholders to ensure the algorithm meets the project’s goals.
Documenting work and presenting findings to the team.


The student would be expected to work independently, think critically, and possess strong problem-solving skills. They would also be expected to communicate effectively with team members and stakeholders.

Who We’re Looking For

We seek an enthusiastic student who embodies curiosity, creativity, and technical prowess to join us in March/April 2025. Here’s the ideal candidate:


Educational Background: A strong foundation in computer science, mathematics, or a related field.
NLP Passion: Deep knowledge of machine learning and natural language processing techniques.
Coding Skills: Proficiency in Python is essential. Familiarity with libraries like NLTK, scikit-learn, and TensorFlow is a big plus.
Experience: Prior exposure to NLP projects or research is highly desirable.
Independence and Critical Thinking: You’ll have the autonomy to explore, innovate, and solve complex problems.
Effective Communication: Collaborate seamlessly with team members and stakeholders.


What We Offer


Hands-On Experience: The student will gain practical experience in their field of study, contributing to their professional growth.
Skill Enhancement: Opportunities to learn and apply new skills, including exposure to real-world scenarios.
Networking and Mentorship: Interaction with experienced professionals within the organization.
Flexible Work Environment: A supportive work environment that respects academic commitments.
Project Exposure: Involvement in projects that contribute to the organization’s goals.


Our success depends on our talented employees who come to work here every single day with a sense of purpose and an appetite for progress.

Join PMI And You Too Can

Seize the freedom to shape your future and ours. We’ll empower you to take risks, experiment and explore.

Be part of an inclusive, diverse culture, where everyone’s contribution is respected; collaborate with some of the world’s best people and feel like you belong.

Pursue your ambitions and develop your skills with a global business –our staggering size and scale provides endless opportunities to progress.

Take pride in delivering our promise to society: to deliver a smoke-free future.

PMI is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
About the Company

At 21.co Technologies, our mission centers on building scalable bridges into the world of cryptocurrency. By creating DeFi accessibility through traditional financial standards, we bring ourselves one step closer to the equitable financial future we all believe in.

About the Role

We are seeking a Data Scientist to design, implement, and optimize pipelines utilizing Large Language Models (LLMs) and generative AI technologies. The ideal candidate will have expertise in both generative and non-generative machine learning techniques, with a strong focus on natural language processing (NLP). This role involves end-to-end development, including data processing, LLM fine-tuning, implementing Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) pipelines, and deploying AI agents.

Key Responsibilities

As a Data Scientist at 21.co Technologies, you will:


Lead the development and deployment of pipelines leveraging LLMs and generative AI for advanced text-based applications, providing technical direction and mentoring team members.
Design and implement RAG systems, integrating external knowledge sources with LLMs.
Fine-tune and customize LLMs for specific use cases, ensuring optimal performance and adaptability.
Process and prepare large-scale text datasets for training, testing, and evaluation of models.
Build and monitor systems for evaluating and maintaining the quality, fairness, and safety of deployed LLMs.
Develop and implement AI agents capable of autonomous task execution and decision-making.
Apply non-generative machine learning techniques to complement and enhance generative AI systems.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to align AI solutions with business needs and objectives.
Stay at the forefront of advancements in generative AI, NLP, and machine learning, integrating new techniques as appropriate.


Qualifications


Bachelor's, Master's, or PhD in Computer Science, Data Science, Machine Learning, or a related field.
5+ years of experience in Data Science and Natural Language Processing (NLP)
Demonstrated expertise in LLMs and generative AI technologies (e.g., GPT, BERT, Transformer models), including fine-tuning and RAG pipelines.
Solid understanding of non-generative machine learning techniques, including supervised, unsupervised, and reinforcement learning.
Strong programming skills in Python, with experience in ML libraries such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, Jax or Hugging Face Transformers.
Hands-on experience with AI model monitoring, evaluation, and lifecycle management.
Familiarity with building and deploying AI agents in real-world applications.
Knowledge of data engineering workflows and tools for large-scale data processing.
Excellent problem-solving and communication skills, with the ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical audiences.


This role is based in Zürich and will be expected to work from our Zürich office in a hybrid model Monday - Wednesday.

  • Stay at the forefront of advancements in generative AI, NLP, and machine learning, integrating new techniques as appropriate.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor's, Master's, or PhD in Computer Science, Data Science, Machine Learning, or a related field.
  • 5+ years of experience in Data Science and Natural Language Processing (NLP)
  • Demonstrated expertise in LLMs and generative AI technologies (e.g., GPT, BERT, Transformer models), including fine-tuning and RAG pipelines.
  • Solid understanding of non-generative machine learning techniques, including supervised, unsupervised, and reinforcement learning.
  • Strong programming skills in Python, with experience in ML libraries such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, Jax or Hugging Face Transformers.
  • Hands-on experience with AI model monitoring, evaluation, and lifecycle management.
  • Familiarity with building and deploying AI agents in real-world applications.
  • Knowledge of data engineering workflows and tools for large-scale data processing.
  • Excellent problem-solving and communication skills, with the ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical audiences.

This role is based in Zürich and will be expected to work from our Zürich office in a hybrid model Monday - Wednesday.

Title: Research Scientist, Computer Vision
Description:
Minimum qualifications:


PhD degree in Computer Science, a related field, or equivalent practical experience.
Coding experience in Python, JavaScript, R, Java, or C++.
One or more scientific publication submission(s) for conferences, journals, or public repositories.


Preferred qualifications:


2 years of coding experience in Python, JavaScript, R, Java, or C++.
1 year of experience owning and initiating research agendas.


About The Job

As an organization, Google maintains a portfolio of research projects driven by fundamental research, new product innovation, product contribution and infrastructure goals, while providing individuals and teams the freedom to emphasize specific types of work. As a Research Scientist, you'll setup large-scale tests and deploy promising ideas quickly and broadly, managing deadlines and deliverables while applying the latest theories to develop new and improved products, processes, or technologies. From creating experiments and prototyping implementations to designing new architectures, our research scientists work on real-world problems that span the breadth of computer science, such as machine (and deep) learning, data mining, natural language processing, hardware and software performance analysis, improving compilers for mobile platforms, as well as core search and much more.

As a Research Scientist, you'll also actively contribute to the wider research community by sharing and publishing your findings, with ideas inspired by internal projects as well as from collaborations with research programs at partner universities and technical institutes all over the world.

Google Research is building the next generation of intelligent systems for all Google products. To achieve this, we’re working on projects that utilize the latest computer science techniques developed by skilled software developers and research scientists. Google Research teams collaborate closely with other teams across Google, maintaining the flexibility and versatility required to adapt new projects and foci that meet the demands of the world's fast-paced business needs.

Responsibilities


Author research papers to share and generate impact of research results across the team and in the research community.
Help in growing research business across teams by sharing research trends and practices within the community.
Define the data structure, framework, design, and evaluation metrics for research solution development and implementation under minimal guidance. Identify timelines and obtain resources needed.
Identify new and upcoming research areas by interacting with potential external and internal collaborators. Help in developing long-term research strategy and plans to expand the impact of Google research with some guidance.
Contribute to conducting experiments based on the research question. Develop research prototypes or conduct simulations to further evaluate the impact of research, finalize hypotheses, and refine the research methodology under minimal guidance.



Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

Title: Machine Learning Engineer, Gemini Factuality, CH
Description:
At Google DeepMind, we value diversity of experience, knowledge, backgrounds and perspectives and harness these qualities to create extraordinary impact. We are committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of sex, race, religion or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, citizenship, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy, or related condition (including breastfeeding) or any other basis as protected by applicable law. If you have a disability or additional need that requires accommodation, please do not hesitate to let us know.

Snapshot

You are an experienced Software Engineer with a strong machine learning background who is excited about improving the quality and factual accuracy of the “Gemini” end-user product, delivering state-of-the art language models to our users.

About Us

Artificial Intelligence could be one of humanity’s most useful inventions. At Google DeepMind, we’re a team of scientists, engineers, machine learning experts and more, working together to advance the state of the art in artificial intelligence. We use our technologies for widespread public benefit and scientific discovery, and collaborate with others on critical challenges, ensuring safety and ethics are the highest priority.

The role

Our team is working on improving the accuracy and factuality of responses generated by Gemini (post-trained) models, both standalone and in Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) settings.

We hillclimb on both the quality of RAG backends, and we build state-of-the-art language models through a variety of model training and optimization methods (Supervised Fine Tuning, Reinforcement Learning from Human Feedback, …). The team is responsible for managing data quality, model building, quality evaluation, quality monitoring, and tuning the quality of RAG backends.

We are looking for a senior software engineer with a strong ML background, working with us on making the Gemini end-user product more factual.

Key responsibilities


Leverage model training strategies like Supervised Fine Tuning (SFT) and preference-based approaches (e.g. Reinforcement Learning from Human Feedback, Identity Preference Optimization, …) to improve the quality of language models.
Hillclimb on the Retrieval-augmented-generation (RAG) approaches to improve the accuracy of language model responses.
Collaborate with cross-functional and Research teams on applying state-of-the-art machine learning approaches to LLM-based products.


About You

In order to set you up for success as a machine learning-focused software engineer at Google DeepMind, we look for the following skills and experience:


5 years of experience with software development in one or more programming languages, and with data structures/algorithms.
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent practical experience.
3 years of experience with state of the art GenAI techniques (e.g., LLMs, Multi-Modal, Large Vision Models) or with GenAI-related concepts (language modeling, computer vision).
3 years of experience testing, maintaining, or launching software products, and 1 year of experience with software design and architecture.
3 years of experience with ML infrastructure (e.g., model deployment, model evaluation, optimization, data processing, debugging)


In addition, the following would be an advantage:


PhD in Machine Learning or a related field.
Experience with training and optimizing large language models.


Application deadline: 12pm GMT Friday February 21th 2025

Note: In the event your application is successful and an offer of employment is made to you, any offer of employment will be conditional on the results of a background check, performed by a third party acting on our behalf. For more information on how we handle your data, please see our Applicant and Candidate Privacy Policy.
Show more

Title: Tax Data Scientist
Description:
Mercuria is one of the world’s leading independent energy and commodity groups. Our purpose is to connect markets and to advance the energy transition. We bring markets together to support the world’s energy needs of today by trading, structuring finance, and investing in strategic assets, whilst generating over $170 billion in turnover. We are committed to advancing the transition to a more sustainable, affordable, and reliable energy system for tomorrow. We are well ahead of the pledge we made in 2021 that over half of our investment capital will go into sectors that are advancing the energy transition by 2025, to contribute to global efforts to combat climate change.




We are seeking a highly skilled and innovative Tax Data Scientist to join our dynamic team. The successful candidate will play a crucial role in enhancing our tax-related processes through advanced data science techniques and machine learning applications.




Role and Responsibilities:




Anomaly Detection System Development:
Implement and maintain a machine-learning based anomaly detection system to ensure the accurate issuance of indirect tax costs across multiple jurisdictions.
Continuously improve the system's accuracy and efficiency by integrating new data sources and refining algorithms.
Database Development for Credit Analysis:
Collaborate with the credit analysis team to build a comprehensive database of counterparty information extracted from unstructured legal documents.
Utilize Generative AI (GenAI) technologies to automate data extraction and processing, ensuring high-quality and reliable data for credit risk assessments.
GenAI-based Code Maintenance:
Develop and implement a GenAI-based engine to automate simple code maintenance tasks for ETRM/CTRM teams.
Enhance the productivity and accuracy of code management processes, reducing manual intervention and minimizing errors.
Transfer Pricing and Tax Control Automation:
Lead the conversion of transfer pricing and manually-run tax control processes into a seamlessly integrated internal software solution.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure the successful implementation and adoption of the new system.




Skills and Competencies:




Demonstrated experience in developing and deploying machine learning models specifically for anomaly detection in financial or tax-related datasets.
Proficiency in using libraries such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Scikit-learn
Strong background in working with unstructured data, particularly legal documents, and transforming it into structured formats suitable for analysis.
Experience with Natural Language Processing (NLP) techniques and tools such as spaCy, NLTK, or BERT for extracting relevant information from legal texts.
Hands-on experience in implementing Generative AI solutions for automating routine tasks, with a focus on code maintenance and data processing.
Familiarity with GenAI frameworks and platforms, such as OpenAI's GPT or similar, for developing custom AI-driven applications.
In-depth understanding of Energy Trading and Risk Management (ETRM) and Commodity Trading and Risk Management (CTRM) systems.
Ability to integrate AI-driven solutions within existing ETRM/CTRM frameworks to enhance operational efficiency.
Experience in automating tax-related processes, particularly in the areas of transfer pricing and tax control, using software development and integration techniques.
Advanced programming skills in Python, with experience in developing scalable and maintainable code.
Familiarity with database technologies such as SQL, NoSQL, and data warehousing solutions for managing large datasets.
Fluent English

Show more

Title: Machine Learning, Software Engineer, Multilingual Gemini
Description:
At Google DeepMind, we value diversity of experience, knowledge, backgrounds and perspectives and harness these qualities to create extraordinary impact. We are committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of sex, race, religion or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, citizenship, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy, or related condition (including breastfeeding) or any other basis as protected by applicable law. If you have a disability or additional need that requires accommodation, please do not hesitate to let us know.

Snapshot

Join us in making the Google Gemini App the best general-purpose conversational AI in the world for global users.

We’re looking for a Software Engineer who is willing to embrace a fast-paced and agile environment with a lot of opportunities to make real-life impact on Gemini's non-English-speaking users.

About Us

Our team works on developing high-quality multilingual and multimodal models and data, designing scaling processes and carrying out data analyses. We also train and adapt LLMs by closely collaborating with partnering engineering, infrastructure and cross-functional teams.

Artificial Intelligence could be one of humanity’s most useful inventions. At Google DeepMind, we’re a team of scientists, engineers, machine learning experts and more, working together to advance the state of the art in artificial intelligence. We use our technologies for widespread public benefit and scientific discovery, and collaborate with others on critical challenges, ensuring safety and ethics are the highest priority.

Gemini, the game-changing personal assistant powered by generative AI, revolutionizes your mobile experience. The Gemini mobile apps deliver tailored support directly to your device. Our team’s mission is to lead the charge in evolving Gemini on Android and iOS, placing Google at the forefront of the LLM and generative AI revolution.

The role

We’re looking for a highly skilled Software Engineer with a strong background in AI/ML/NLP to join our team and contribute to the improvement and extensions of Gemini’s multilingual capabilities.

Key responsibilities


Train and fine-tune models for better response quality and efficiency
Design high-quality data collections for training and evaluation
Productionize, serve and launch large multilingual and multimodal models
Carry out data analysis to identify and understand shortcomings
Help scaling deliveries and processes
Proactively identify gaps and opportunities to increase multilingual quality
Act as an expert for your native language


About You

In order to set you up for success as an Engineer in the Multilingual/Global Team at Google DeepMind, we look for the following skills and experience:


Bachelor’s degree or equivalent practical experience
4+ years of software engineering and AI/ML/NLP experience
Is passionate about multilingual abilities of LLMs


In addition, the following would be an advantage:


Background in statistics and in data or qualitative and quantitative analysis
Own problems end-to-end and be passionate about maximizing AI technology impact
Strong analytical, problem-solving and solution-oriented skills
Ability to thrive and prioritize effectively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment with multiple stakeholders.
Team player with exceptional interpersonal, solution-oriented and communicative attitude
Ideally (near-)native knowledge in (a) non-English language(s)


Application deadline: 12pm GMT Thursday 7th March 2025

Note: In the event your application is successful and an offer of employment is made to you, any offer of employment will be conditional on the results of a background check, performed by a third party acting on our behalf. For more information on how we handle your data, please see our Applicant and Candidate Privacy Policy.

Title: Paid Internship in Data Science – Operations Research - 6 Months (m/f/x)
Description:
Job Location

Petit-Lancy

Job Description

Get hands-on into the details of Data Science, using advanced Operations Research and optimization techniques, big data platforms and data visualization to discover solutions to problems requiring tremendous creativity. Partner with business leaders to fully understand the problem, and data engineers to automate & deploy your models into applications providing prescriptions to Sales, Marketing and Supply Chain executives - that allow P&G to serve consumers worldwide in a better way.

This internship position will allow you to kickstart your Data Science career:


Report to a senior data scientist and collaborate within a Data Science and Analytics team, part of P&G’s global Data Science organization.
Propose solutions that inform decision-making for key business challenges, applying advanced operations research methods and automating the analysis of complex problems
Discover next-generation analytic capabilities - being directly in touch with our category analysts and senior business leaders.
Team-up with technology partners to translate your innovations into robust, scaled, analytic solutions
Participate and improve your skills via P&G’s analytic capability program


Job Qualifications


Enthusiasm and curiosity about the intersection of business, technology, and data, with a particular interest in Operations Research.
You are doing a Master’s degree in a quantitative field (Operations Research, Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering, Applied Math, Statistics, Analytics etc); with a major or minor in Operations Research and optimization techniques.
You have started getting proficient in Python and Data Science / Operations Research techniques - and want to broaden your knowledge by applying them in practice.
You are comfortable working with diverse business scenarios, handling multiple priorities and have a business & consultancy mind-set, while being technically (data) savvy.
Passion to try new things, learn quickly and work well with diverse backgrounds- Excellent interpersonal skills, self-motivated, dynamic and can-do attitude
English required (written and oral)


Job Schedule

Full time

Job Number

R000123553

Job Segmentation

Internships (Job Segmentation)Starting Pay / Salary Range

Apply Now

Title: Computer Vision & Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
We are looking for a CV/ML Engineer to work with one of the leading global tech giants, based in Zurich.




The role is to join their contigent workforce (contract) initially on a one year contract which can be 100% be extended, through to 18 months.




This team work remotely, but you must be living in Switzerland/willing to relocate to Switzerland.




The team are currently driving efforts to developer and prototype CV based expeirences that provide creativity and social play experiences for people connecting through their AR/VR products. Lot of work designing and building efficient data pipelines.




Job Responsibilities

• Design, build and launch efficient CV/ML models and evaluate them in real-time and on mobile device.

• Develop prototypes for future AR/VR experiences, cutting edge research, drive continued development, or integrate robust solutions into products

• Code using Python and efficient real-time CV/ML libraries.

• Analyze and improve efficiency, scalability, and stability of various system resources.

• Complete medium to large features (each with many tasks) independently without guidance.

• Proactively identify and drive changes as needed for assigned codebase, product area and/or systems.




Minimum Qualifications

• BS/MS in Computer Science or a related technical field.

• 5+ years of experience in Python and CV/ML development

• Experience in building and maintaining scalable CV/ML pipelines (image processing, model training)

• Experience with CV/ML performance and runtime optimization




Preferred Qualifications

• Designing and implementing real-time CV/ML pipelines.

• ML Model optimization and on-device deployment

• GenAI/Diffusion Models/Gaussian Splatting

• Proactively identify and drive changes as needed for assigned codebase, product area and/or systems.


Minimum Qualifications

• BS/MS in Computer Science or a related technical field.

• 5+ years of experience in Python and CV/ML development

• Experience in building and maintaining scalable CV/ML pipelines (image processing, model training)

• Experience with CV/ML performance and runtime optimization


Preferred Qualifications

• Designing and implementing real-time CV/ML pipelines.

• ML Model optimization and on-device deployment

• GenAI/Diffusion Models/Gaussian Splatting

Title: Machine Learning Engineer (OSS) in a fast-growing AI Startup
Description:
At the ETH spin-off Lightly, we build software solutions to help companies improve their deep learning models. The available data for deep learning grows faster than human tagging and available compute power. Our customers already face this problem and have too much data to process. As a solution, we built software to identify and work with the most relevant samples only. Learn more about us on our website.

We are a team of talented developers and researchers in Zurich, Prague and San Francisco and are backed by YCombinator. Every member of the team is going to have a massive impact.

Thus, we are looking for an experienced engineer with lots of passion for the subject. We offer attractive cash- & equity package for you to become part-owner of Lightly. Remote work is also possible.

We use a modern stack of:


PyTorch, Python, Typescript, C++, Rust, React, NodeJS
Docker, Kubernetes, Google Cloud Platform, AWS



Tasks

As a Machine Learning Engineer in the core ML team, you will be part of a team which works mainly on our open-source package for self-supervised learning and similar internal frameworks.

Particularly, you will get to:


Work on our open-source Python package for self-supervised learning: https://github.com/lightly-ai/lightly.
Add support for finetuning pretrained models for downstream tasks including many different computer vision tasks like object detection, segmentation, tracking, and more.
Keep up with current research in self-supervised learning and multi-modal models.
All these tasks will include working with state-of-the-art technology such as self-supervised learning, model distillation, vision language models and deep learning for computer vision in general.
Participate in and hold paper sessions about the latest papers in the field.
Represent the company at machine learning conferences and engage with the community.



In general, for this role expect to use the stack we use for our open-source package https://github.com/lightly-ai/lightly.

Requirements

Ideally, you have:


MSc or PhD in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field
Experience in deep learning and computer vision, ideally in self-supervised learning and you have worked with PyTorch.
Excellent Python coding skills and knowledge of software engineering best practices. Experience with testing and typed Python is a big plus.
Experience with building and shipping software solutions.
Strong passion for new technologies and interest in keeping up with the latest technologies and publications in deep learning.



Benefits

We offer attractive cash- & equity package for you to become part-owner of Lightly. Remote work is also possible.

Interested? Contact us!

We look forward to getting to know you!
Show more
