Title: Data science internship (Multiplexed image analysis)
Description:
Summary

The Immunology Data Science team is looking for a recent postgraduate to complete an internship establishing a universal multiplexed imaging and spatial transcriptomics analysis pipeline for the discovery of immune-related disease mechanisms and novel targets.

About The Role

The Immunology (IMM) Disease Area within Biomedical Research (BR) at Novartis in Basel is seeking a highly motivated postgraduate to join our Data Science team for an internship to establish and benchmark computational tools for the analysis of multiplexed imaging and other tissue profiling technologies including spatial transcriptomics.

The IMM Data Science team collaborates with project teams across IMM on a variety of clinical and preclinical drug discovery programs targeting autoimmune diseases and chronic inflammation. With the advancement of multiplexed imaging and spatial transcriptomics technologies, we are now expanding our internal pipelines to provide a flexible and scalable solution to analyze spatial tissue data across projects.

Desired start date: ASAP

Duration: 6 months

Your Responsibilities Will Include


Establish and evaluate existing computational tools to handle and analyze spatial tissue data
Compare existing analysis approaches in terms of usability, flexibility and scalability
Apply the selected tools to internal data supporting the identification of disease-relevant tissue structures
Present the results internally within IMM and the broader tissue profiling community at BR


Essential Requirements


Recent master’s degree (MSc) in bioinformatics, computational biology, data science or a related field
Excellent skills in data handling and analysis using Python; Experience with Unix command line and pipelining solutions (e.g. snakemake/nextflow)
Ability to work independently and as part of an interdisciplinary team
English: proficient in oral and written


Desirable Requirements


Previous experience with analyzing low- or highplexed imaging data; Experience analyzing spatial transcriptomics and applying spatial statistics is a plus
Good understanding of biology and immunology


Onsite or Hybrid?

Why Novartis: Our purpose is to reimagine medicine to improve and extend people’s lives and our vision is to become the most valued and trusted medicines company in the world. How can we achieve this? With our people. It is our associates that drive us each day to reach our ambitions. Be a part of this mission and join us! Learn more here: https://www.novartis.com/about/strategy/people-and-culture

Commitment To Diversity And Inclusion

Novartis is committed to building an outstanding, inclusive work environment and diverse teams' representative of the patients and communities we serve.

Accessibility and accommodation

Novartis is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to all

individuals. If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable

accommodation for any part of the recruitment process, or in order to receive more detailed

information about the essential functions of a position, please send an e-mail to

diversity.inclusion_ch@novartis.com and let us know the nature of your request and your

contact information. Please include the job requisition number in your message

HTML:
Summary

The Immunology Data Science team is looking for a recent postgraduate to complete an internship establishing a universal multiplexed imaging and spatial transcriptomics analysis pipeline for the discovery of immune-related disease mechanisms and novel targets.

About The Role

The Immunology (IMM) Disease Area within Biomedical Research (BR) at Novartis in Basel is seeking a highly motivated postgraduate to join our Data Science team for an internship to establish and benchmark computational tools for the analysis of multiplexed imaging and other tissue profiling technologies including spatial transcriptomics.

The IMM Data Science team collaborates with project teams across IMM on a variety of clinical and preclinical drug discovery programs targeting autoimmune diseases and chronic inflammation. With the advancement of multiplexed imaging and spatial transcriptomics technologies, we are now expanding our internal pipelines to provide a flexible and scalable solution to analyze spatial tissue data across projects.

Desired start date: ASAP

Duration: 6 months

Your Responsibilities Will Include

  • Establish and evaluate existing computational tools to handle and analyze spatial tissue data
  • Compare existing analysis approaches in terms of usability, flexibility and scalability
  • Apply the selected tools to internal data supporting the identification of disease-relevant tissue structures
  • Present the results internally within IMM and the broader tissue profiling community at BR

Essential Requirements

  • Recent master’s degree (MSc) in bioinformatics, computational biology, data science or a related field
  • Excellent skills in data handling and analysis using Python; Experience with Unix command line and pipelining solutions (e.g. snakemake/nextflow)
  • Ability to work independently and as part of an interdisciplinary team
  • English: proficient in oral and written

Desirable Requirements

  • Previous experience with analyzing low- or highplexed imaging data; Experience analyzing spatial transcriptomics and applying spatial statistics is a plus
  • Good understanding of biology and immunology

Onsite or Hybrid?

Why Novartis: Our purpose is to reimagine medicine to improve and extend people’s lives and our vision is to become the most valued and trusted medicines company in the world. How can we achieve this? With our people. It is our associates that drive us each day to reach our ambitions. Be a part of this mission and join us! Learn more here: https://www.novartis.com/about/strategy/people-and-culture

Commitment To Diversity And Inclusion

Novartis is committed to building an outstanding, inclusive work environment and diverse teams' representative of the patients and communities we serve.

Accessibility and accommodation

Novartis is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to all

individuals. If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable

accommodation for any part of the recruitment process, or in order to receive more detailed

information about the essential functions of a position, please send an e-mail to

diversity.inclusion_ch@novartis.com and let us know the nature of your request and your

contact information. Please include the job requisition number in your message

Title: Data Scientist (m/w)
Description:
Ab sofort, Langfristig, In Festanstellung | 50 bis 100 % | Zürich | Forschung & Entwicklung | Berufserfahrener | Projekt-ID P202549181_1S

univativ ist ein Projekt- und Personaldienstleister, der Studenten und Absolventen spannende Jobs bei renommierten Unternehmen bietet. Deine Karriere ist unsere Mission, denn Deine Entwicklung liegt uns am Herzen.

Whether you're a student, a recent graduate, or an experienced professional – at univativ, you'll find a job that fits you and your lifestyle. Are you looking for an exciting part-time position alongside your studies? Or are you searching for your first full-time role? If you're not ready to commit yet, univativ offers the chance to explore different industries and companies. No matter where you want to go – whether it's the pharmaceutical, automotive, finance, or IT sector – together, we'll find the right job for you.

Our client is a company in research and development. For this exciting project, we are looking for a tech-savvy employee (m/f/d) who values a modern working environment. If we have convinced you, apply at univativ and take advantage of our opportunities!

Aufgaben


Develop and maintain storage access APIs within a complex storage infrastructure
Act as the primary contact and specialist for the ORD project
Analyze and define requirements for scientific data access and interactions
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to optimize storage solutions
Ensure scalability, security, and performance of data access systems



Qualifikation


Bachelor’s or Master’s degree, preferably in computer science or related disciplines
Basic understanding of large storage systems
General knowledge of storage technologies
Basic knowledge of how APIs work
Good knowledge of at least one programming language
Good knowledge of AWS S3 protocol
Basic Knowledge of Identity Providers / Management Systems
Good knowledge of linux OS and posix interface



Benefits


Eine Festanstellung direkt bei unserem Kunden
Work in a heterogeneous, complex and highly exciting environment
Support for further education and training
Flexible working hour models, remote work options, and the possibility of and home office work
Employee benefits, including public transportation subscriptions, car sharing, sports facilities, childcare services, and more



Wir konnten Dein Interesse wecken? Klasse!

Wir freuen uns auf Deine Bewerbung

Title: Machine Learning Engineer, Gemini Factuality, CH
Description:
At Google DeepMind, we value diversity of experience, knowledge, backgrounds and perspectives and harness these qualities to create extraordinary impact. We are committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of sex, race, religion or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, citizenship, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy, or related condition (including breastfeeding) or any other basis as protected by applicable law. If you have a disability or additional need that requires accommodation, please do not hesitate to let us know.

Snapshot

You are an experienced Software Engineer with a strong machine learning background who is excited about improving the quality and factual accuracy of the “Gemini” end-user product, delivering state-of-the art language models to our users.

About Us

Artificial Intelligence could be one of humanity’s most useful inventions. At Google DeepMind, we’re a team of scientists, engineers, machine learning experts and more, working together to advance the state of the art in artificial intelligence. We use our technologies for widespread public benefit and scientific discovery, and collaborate with others on critical challenges, ensuring safety and ethics are the highest priority.

The role

Our team is working on improving the accuracy and factuality of responses generated by Gemini (post-trained) models, both standalone and in Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) settings.

We hillclimb on both the quality of RAG backends, and we build state-of-the-art language models through a variety of model training and optimization methods (Supervised Fine Tuning, Reinforcement Learning from Human Feedback, …). The team is responsible for managing data quality, model building, quality evaluation, quality monitoring, and tuning the quality of RAG backends.

We are looking for a senior software engineer with a strong ML background, working with us on making the Gemini end-user product more factual.

Key responsibilities


Leverage model training strategies like Supervised Fine Tuning (SFT) and preference-based approaches (e.g. Reinforcement Learning from Human Feedback, Identity Preference Optimization, …) to improve the quality of language models.
Hillclimb on the Retrieval-augmented-generation (RAG) approaches to improve the accuracy of language model responses.
Collaborate with cross-functional and Research teams on applying state-of-the-art machine learning approaches to LLM-based products.


About You

In order to set you up for success as a machine learning-focused software engineer at Google DeepMind, we look for the following skills and experience:


5 years of experience with software development in one or more programming languages, and with data structures/algorithms.
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent practical experience.
3 years of experience with state of the art GenAI techniques (e.g., LLMs, Multi-Modal, Large Vision Models) or with GenAI-related concepts (language modeling, computer vision).
3 years of experience testing, maintaining, or launching software products, and 1 year of experience with software design and architecture.
3 years of experience with ML infrastructure (e.g., model deployment, model evaluation, optimization, data processing, debugging)


In addition, the following would be an advantage:


PhD in Machine Learning or a related field.
Experience with training and optimizing large language models.


Application deadline: 12pm GMT Friday February 21th 2025

Note: In the event your application is successful and an offer of employment is made to you, any offer of employment will be conditional on the results of a background check, performed by a third party acting on our behalf. For more information on how we handle your data, please see our Applicant and Candidate Privacy Policy.

Title: Tax Data Scientist
Description:
Mercuria is one of the world’s leading independent energy and commodity groups. Our purpose is to connect markets and to advance the energy transition. We bring markets together to support the world’s energy needs of today by trading, structuring finance, and investing in strategic assets, whilst generating over $170 billion in turnover. We are committed to advancing the transition to a more sustainable, affordable, and reliable energy system for tomorrow. We are well ahead of the pledge we made in 2021 that over half of our investment capital will go into sectors that are advancing the energy transition by 2025, to contribute to global efforts to combat climate change.




We are seeking a highly skilled and innovative Tax Data Scientist to join our dynamic team. The successful candidate will play a crucial role in enhancing our tax-related processes through advanced data science techniques and machine learning applications.




Role and Responsibilities:




Anomaly Detection System Development:
Implement and maintain a machine-learning based anomaly detection system to ensure the accurate issuance of indirect tax costs across multiple jurisdictions.
Continuously improve the system's accuracy and efficiency by integrating new data sources and refining algorithms.
Database Development for Credit Analysis:
Collaborate with the credit analysis team to build a comprehensive database of counterparty information extracted from unstructured legal documents.
Utilize Generative AI (GenAI) technologies to automate data extraction and processing, ensuring high-quality and reliable data for credit risk assessments.
GenAI-based Code Maintenance:
Develop and implement a GenAI-based engine to automate simple code maintenance tasks for ETRM/CTRM teams.
Enhance the productivity and accuracy of code management processes, reducing manual intervention and minimizing errors.
Transfer Pricing and Tax Control Automation:
Lead the conversion of transfer pricing and manually-run tax control processes into a seamlessly integrated internal software solution.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure the successful implementation and adoption of the new system.




Skills and Competencies:




Demonstrated experience in developing and deploying machine learning models specifically for anomaly detection in financial or tax-related datasets.
Proficiency in using libraries such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Scikit-learn
Strong background in working with unstructured data, particularly legal documents, and transforming it into structured formats suitable for analysis.
Experience with Natural Language Processing (NLP) techniques and tools such as spaCy, NLTK, or BERT for extracting relevant information from legal texts.
Hands-on experience in implementing Generative AI solutions for automating routine tasks, with a focus on code maintenance and data processing.
Familiarity with GenAI frameworks and platforms, such as OpenAI's GPT or similar, for developing custom AI-driven applications.
In-depth understanding of Energy Trading and Risk Management (ETRM) and Commodity Trading and Risk Management (CTRM) systems.
Ability to integrate AI-driven solutions within existing ETRM/CTRM frameworks to enhance operational efficiency.
Experience in automating tax-related processes, particularly in the areas of transfer pricing and tax control, using software development and integration techniques.
Advanced programming skills in Python, with experience in developing scalable and maintainable code.
Familiarity with database technologies such as SQL, NoSQL, and data warehousing solutions for managing large datasets.
Fluent English

Title: Machine Learning, Software Engineer, Multilingual Gemini
Description:
At Google DeepMind, we value diversity of experience, knowledge, backgrounds and perspectives and harness these qualities to create extraordinary impact. We are committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of sex, race, religion or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, citizenship, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy, or related condition (including breastfeeding) or any other basis as protected by applicable law. If you have a disability or additional need that requires accommodation, please do not hesitate to let us know.

Snapshot

Join us in making the Google Gemini App the best general-purpose conversational AI in the world for global users.

We’re looking for a Software Engineer who is willing to embrace a fast-paced and agile environment with a lot of opportunities to make real-life impact on Gemini's non-English-speaking users.

About Us

Our team works on developing high-quality multilingual and multimodal models and data, designing scaling processes and carrying out data analyses. We also train and adapt LLMs by closely collaborating with partnering engineering, infrastructure and cross-functional teams.

Artificial Intelligence could be one of humanity’s most useful inventions. At Google DeepMind, we’re a team of scientists, engineers, machine learning experts and more, working together to advance the state of the art in artificial intelligence. We use our technologies for widespread public benefit and scientific discovery, and collaborate with others on critical challenges, ensuring safety and ethics are the highest priority.

Gemini, the game-changing personal assistant powered by generative AI, revolutionizes your mobile experience. The Gemini mobile apps deliver tailored support directly to your device. Our team’s mission is to lead the charge in evolving Gemini on Android and iOS, placing Google at the forefront of the LLM and generative AI revolution.

The role

We’re looking for a highly skilled Software Engineer with a strong background in AI/ML/NLP to join our team and contribute to the improvement and extensions of Gemini’s multilingual capabilities.

Key responsibilities


Train and fine-tune models for better response quality and efficiency
Design high-quality data collections for training and evaluation
Productionize, serve and launch large multilingual and multimodal models
Carry out data analysis to identify and understand shortcomings
Help scaling deliveries and processes
Proactively identify gaps and opportunities to increase multilingual quality
Act as an expert for your native language


About You

In order to set you up for success as an Engineer in the Multilingual/Global Team at Google DeepMind, we look for the following skills and experience:


Bachelor’s degree or equivalent practical experience
4+ years of software engineering and AI/ML/NLP experience
Is passionate about multilingual abilities of LLMs


In addition, the following would be an advantage:


Background in statistics and in data or qualitative and quantitative analysis
Own problems end-to-end and be passionate about maximizing AI technology impact
Strong analytical, problem-solving and solution-oriented skills
Ability to thrive and prioritize effectively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment with multiple stakeholders.
Team player with exceptional interpersonal, solution-oriented and communicative attitude
Ideally (near-)native knowledge in (a) non-English language(s)


Application deadline: 12pm GMT Thursday 7th March 2025

Note: In the event your application is successful and an offer of employment is made to you, any offer of employment will be conditional on the results of a background check, performed by a third party acting on our behalf. For more information on how we handle your data, please see our Applicant and Candidate Privacy Policy.

Title: Paid Internship in Data Science – Operations Research - 6 Months (m/f/x)
Description:
Job Location

Petit-Lancy

Job Description

Get hands-on into the details of Data Science, using advanced Operations Research and optimization techniques, big data platforms and data visualization to discover solutions to problems requiring tremendous creativity. Partner with business leaders to fully understand the problem, and data engineers to automate & deploy your models into applications providing prescriptions to Sales, Marketing and Supply Chain executives - that allow P&G to serve consumers worldwide in a better way.

This internship position will allow you to kickstart your Data Science career:


Report to a senior data scientist and collaborate within a Data Science and Analytics team, part of P&G’s global Data Science organization.
Propose solutions that inform decision-making for key business challenges, applying advanced operations research methods and automating the analysis of complex problems
Discover next-generation analytic capabilities - being directly in touch with our category analysts and senior business leaders.
Team-up with technology partners to translate your innovations into robust, scaled, analytic solutions
Participate and improve your skills via P&G’s analytic capability program


Job Qualifications


Enthusiasm and curiosity about the intersection of business, technology, and data, with a particular interest in Operations Research.
You are doing a Master’s degree in a quantitative field (Operations Research, Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering, Applied Math, Statistics, Analytics etc); with a major or minor in Operations Research and optimization techniques.
You have started getting proficient in Python and Data Science / Operations Research techniques - and want to broaden your knowledge by applying them in practice.
You are comfortable working with diverse business scenarios, handling multiple priorities and have a business & consultancy mind-set, while being technically (data) savvy.
Passion to try new things, learn quickly and work well with diverse backgrounds- Excellent interpersonal skills, self-motivated, dynamic and can-do attitude
English required (written and oral)


Job Schedule

Full time

Job Number

R000123553

Job Segmentation

Internships (Job Segmentation)Starting Pay / Salary Range

Apply Now

  • You have started getting proficient in Python and Data Science / Operations Research techniques - and want to broaden your knowledge by applying them in practice.
  • You are comfortable working with diverse business scenarios, handling multiple priorities and have a business & consultancy mind-set, while being technically (data) savvy.
  • Passion to try new things, learn quickly and work well with diverse backgrounds- Excellent interpersonal skills, self-motivated, dynamic and can-do attitude
  • English required (written and oral)

Job Schedule

Full time

R000123553

Title: Computer Vision & Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
We are looking for a CV/ML Engineer to work with one of the leading global tech giants, based in Zurich.




The role is to join their contigent workforce (contract) initially on a one year contract which can be 100% be extended, through to 18 months.




This team work remotely, but you must be living in Switzerland/willing to relocate to Switzerland.




The team are currently driving efforts to developer and prototype CV based expeirences that provide creativity and social play experiences for people connecting through their AR/VR products. Lot of work designing and building efficient data pipelines.




Job Responsibilities

• Design, build and launch efficient CV/ML models and evaluate them in real-time and on mobile device.

• Develop prototypes for future AR/VR experiences, cutting edge research, drive continued development, or integrate robust solutions into products

• Code using Python and efficient real-time CV/ML libraries.

• Analyze and improve efficiency, scalability, and stability of various system resources.

• Complete medium to large features (each with many tasks) independently without guidance.

• Proactively identify and drive changes as needed for assigned codebase, product area and/or systems.




Minimum Qualifications

• BS/MS in Computer Science or a related technical field.

• 5+ years of experience in Python and CV/ML development

• Experience in building and maintaining scalable CV/ML pipelines (image processing, model training)

• Experience with CV/ML performance and runtime optimization




Preferred Qualifications

• Designing and implementing real-time CV/ML pipelines.

• ML Model optimization and on-device deployment

• GenAI/Diffusion Models/Gaussian Splatting

Show more

Title: Automation intern (Deep Learning based machine)
Description:
We are looking for a motivated Automation Intern to support our automation tasks. This position is based in Basel, Switzerland, within an English-speaking environment.




About Axom

At Axom, we develop cutting-edge visual inspection solutions that enhance efficiency and accuracy in the pharmaceutical and animal health industries. Our technology ensures that patients receive the right products with zero defects by leveraging robotic automation, software integration, and data-driven optimizations.




What You’ll Do

As an intern, you will actively contribute to our automation projects. Your daily tasks will include:

Assisting in the design, development, and testing of automation solutions
Writing and optimizing scripts and workflows to streamline processes
Supporting the integration of automation tools into production environments
Identifying and implementing efficiency and reliability improvements




What We’re Looking For

We value autonomy and proactiveness. You’ll take ownership of your projects, contribute fresh ideas, and explore innovative solutions. Our team thrives on creativity, initiative, and experimentation—so don’t hesitate to test new approaches!




Skills & Experience That Matter (Not all are required, but the more, the better!)

Experience with electronic components (e.g., Arduino, lasers, electric motors), whether in professional projects or personal hobbies (like building robots)
Comfortable using Linux (beyond just Windows)—bonus points if you've built your own computer!
Experience with CAD design and 3D printing
Familiarity with existing software codebases and an understanding of maintainable code
Show more

Title: Gen AI Intern
Description:
Lombard Odier Investment Managers (“LOIM”) is the asset management arm of the Lombard Odier Group. With more than 120 investment professionals, we are a global business with a network of offices across Europe, Asia and North America. LOIM has a unique approach to investment, combining the best of alternative and traditional asset management, to offer its clients a diversified range of investment solutions, including a number of new and innovative approaches.




Our technology team works directly and closely with the Business. Our IT ecosystem is based on state-of-the-art tools from leading financial software providers. In addition to this, we develop our own solutions using agile development and DevOps techniques.




We are excited to offer an opportunity for a passionate and talented individual to join our Geneva based team as a Generative AI intern. In this role, you will work closely with our BI & AI analysts to develop, implement and optimize cutting edge AI solutions that drive our business forward. It is an Opportunity to shape the organization's generative AI strategy and direction.




Generative AI Intern




Primary responsibilities




Collaborate with multiple business units to put in place Generative AI enabled Agents
Design, implement, and optimize generative AI prompts for various Agents
Assist in data collection, pre-processing and analysis
Participate in the testing and validation of AI models
Communicate, promote and educate available AI tools to all employees
Conduct research on the latest AI trends and technologies




Desired profile




Pursuing or recently completed a Master’s degree in Computer Science or a related field.
Experience with Python and data processing / machine learning libraries
Familiarity with generative AI prompt design and Large Language Models is a plus.
Understanding of cloud technologies (e.g., Azure), microservices, APIs; is a plus
Exposure to the Finance industry through internships, coursework or relevant projects is a plus
Team player with strong communication skills
Quick learner with strong problem-solving abilities
Ability to multi-task and work in a fast-paced environment.

Show more

Title: Applikations-Entwickler (w/m/d) 100%
Description:
Für den besten Kaffeegenuss braucht JURA die besten Mitarbeitenden.

Seit 1931 steht die Marke JURA für höchste Qualität, zukunftsweisende Innovation, erstklassiges Design und gelebte Nachhaltigkeit.

Zur Verstärkung unseres Softwareteams im Bereich Technik suchen wir ab sofort einen initiativen und engagierten Applikations-Entwickler.




Ihre Aufgaben




Programmierung und Betreuung von Applikationssoftware in Delphi sowie von Datenbank Backend in SQL
Erstellung von Software Konzepten und Pflichtenheften
Sicherstellen von reproduzierbaren Applikationen / Source Code durch Versionsverwaltung
Erschaffen von Setups und Installationsroutinen
Erstellen von Scripts für Produktion und Service Systeme
Sicherstellen des Entwicklungs-Know-How, mittels Vorlagen, Dokumenten und Checklisten




Ihr Profil




Informatiker HF oder gleichwertige Ausbildung
Programmiererfahrung in objektorientierten Sprachen wie C#, C++ oder Java sowie SQL
Erfahrung in Programmierung Delphi von Vorteil
Gute Kenntnisse im Windows Betriebssystem
Gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift
Exakte Arbeitsweise




Ihre Vorteile bei JURA




Innovativer JURA Campus mit den besten technischen Voraussetzungen und Möglichkeiten
Zukunftsgestaltung von hochintegrierten technischen Produkten im Premiumbereich
40-Stunden-Woche, mindestens 25 Ferientage, flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle
Grosszügige Verpflegungszone mit Möglichkeit zu Pausenaktivitäten, kostenlose Kaffeespezialitäten während der Arbeitszeit
Gute Anbindung an den ÖV, Wegentschädigung sowie Gratisparkplätze und elektrische Ladestationen
Interne Schulungen und Förderung von Aus- und Weiterbildungen
Anlässe für Mitarbeitende und Förderung gemeinsamer Aktivitäten




Interessiert? Martin Wullschleger freut sich auf Ihre vollständigen Bewerbungsunterlagen per Online-Bewerbungsformular.

Title: Backend Software Engineer II - ArcGIS Urban
Description:
Are you passionate about creating good user experiences on the web? So are we! In the past few years, Esri has put a large effort into making design tools accessible and powerful. We are dedicated to continually pushing the boundaries of urban design and planning, and you can play a key role in our mission.

At the Esri R&D Center-Zurich, we develop ArcGIS Urban, CityEngine, as well as Esri’s core 3D web technologies. As a software engineer at Esri, you will be solving challenges that make a difference in the world. We are looking for creative, smart engineers to help us build the next generation of urban planning tools.

Tasks

Help design and implement the back end for ArcGIS Urban using cutting-edge technologies (GraphQL, WebAssembly, Rust, Elixir)

Develop a scalable, testable, maintainable architecture

Advise in matters of software architecture and database design

Apply and promote software engineering best practices

Work in a small and dynamic team of people passionate about what they do

Help shape the future of urban planning

Requirements

Excellent programming skills in any modern programming language

2+ years of industry experience in web application development

Excellent communication skills: you can clearly articulate the reasons behind design decisions

Ability to think creatively

Master’s or PhD in computer science or equivalent experience working with web technologies

Existing work authorization for Switzerland

Benefits

Dynamic, fast-growing, international team that is driven by the pursuit of excellent results 

Passionate and supportive working culture 

Emphasis on team and personal growth through training and team development events 

Strong focus on company culture: appreciative, compassionate communication, enabling and embracing diversity 

40-hour work week with flexible working hours

Competitive salary

Free lunches, fresh fruit, coffee, tea, and soft drinks

Fun team activities

Part of Esri, a global organization based in California focused on GIS and spatial analytics to enable global change
Show more

Title: ZHAW Student (w/m/d) Data Science - 2025 - 2029
Description:
St. Gallen - Ausbildung / Lehrstelle / Duales Studium

Deine Verantwortung


Ausbildung und Mitarbeit in unserem MLOps Workflow mit verschiedenen Programmiersystemen (z.B. R / Python etc.)
Aufbereitung von Datenprodukten im Marktbereich Nicht-Leben
Aktive Mitarbeit und Unterstützung bei Ad Hoc Reporting-Anfragen
Unterstützung bei MLOps Themen bzgl. Requirements Engineering, Wartung und Weiterentwicklung
Dauer: September 2025 - September 2029


Deine Qualifikation


Du hast einen Maturitäts-/ Berufsmaturitätsabschluss oder ein Abitur mit guten bis sehr guten Leistungen (vorzugsweise Schwerpunkt in naturwissenschaftlichen Fächern oder Informatik)
Du beginnst ein Studium mit Studienrichtung Data Science, Statistik, Mathematik oder Informatik an der ZHAW
Du bringst erste Erfahrungen in R oder Python mit und hast bereits Einblicke in die Arbeitswelt erhalten
Du hast eine sorgfältige, selbstständige Arbeitsweise und bist eine teamorientierte Persönlichkeit
Du zeigst eine proaktive Verhaltensweise bei der Erledigung von Arbeiten
Du begeisterst dich für neue Technologien und hast ein Flair für Innovationen


Was wir bieten


Flex Office ermöglicht orts- und zeitunabhängiges Arbeiten
Attraktive Mitarbeitervergünstigungen und Aktienprogramme
Grosses Angebot zur Gesundheits­förderung
Externe Beratung in schwierigen Lebenssituationen
Attraktive Aus- und Weiter­bildungs­pro­gramme


Arbeiten bei Helvetia

Das Team Helvetia ist gemeinsam da, wenn es drauf ankommt. Wir sind Menschen, auf die man sich verlassen kann. Die einander unterstützen und sich füreinander einsetzen. Die einander fordern und fördern. Die begeistern und sich begeistern lassen. So gestalten wir gemeinsam die Zukunft. &Los!

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer / Tech Lead - AI & ML
Description:
About Civo

Civo is revolutionising the cloud industry by providing developers and businesses with cutting-edge, developer-friendly cloud solutions. With a focus on simplicity, performance, and reliability, Civo enables its clients to unleash the full potential of their projects and scale with ease. As a company committed to excellence and innovation, Civo values diversity, collaboration, and continuous improvement.

About The Role

Are you up to the challenge of building the next generation of Machine Learning products on the cloud with us? We have an international, fully remote team working on creating the best Kubernetes-first, innovative virtualization platform around, and we'd like you to join as a senior engineer and team lead. In this role, you will be bringing new products to life, working with cutting-edge technology, and making a daily difference supporting users by giving them a platform on which to build awesome new things.

You will get fully involved with the inner workings of Artificial Intelligence, Kubernetes, virtualization and cloud computing, with opportunities to contribute back to open-source projects and participate at industry conferences around the world. You won't just ship code: you'll join a supportive team that values your perspective and ideas from day one.

Responsibilities


Manage the development and maintenance of scalable, efficient code for the Machine Learning components of the Civo Cloud Platform
Ensure code quality, performance, and reliability through comprehensive testing and optimization
Collaborate with designers, product managers, and other engineers to translate requirements into technical solutions
Improve team performance through implementing best practices, refactoring, optimizing and improving the documentation of code and the application of best practices
Participate in code reviews, providing constructive feedback and fostering a collaborative environment
Stay up-to-date with the latest Machine Learning trends, libraries, and tools
Troubleshoot and debug complex technical issues


Requirements


Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a related field, or proven related professional experience
4+ years of professional experience developing, deploying and optimising Machine Learning Solutions
2+ years of running large applications and systems in production environments
2+ Experience with containerization technologies (Docker, Kubernetes)
Proven Experience training Machine Learning Models of any modality
Experience building and designing Machine Learning Pipelines or workflows (MLOps)
Experience managing complex Kubernetes Deployments
Experience scaling GPU Machine learning deployments and managing GPU Clusters
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Experience leading complex software development projects


Nice To Have


Experience in a software development management or leadership roles
Experience using Machine Learning monitoring tools
Experience enforcing coding standards and practices
Experience working in asynchronous agile software teams
Experience working in fully remote organizations
Experience with open source Machine Learning projects


Why Join Civo


Competitive compensation and benefits package
4-day week company (unless attending an event)
Uncapped holiday
Collaborative and inclusive culture that values diversity and creativity
Opportunity to work with a dynamic and innovative team in the fast-growing cloud industry
Show more

Title: Oportunidades de Carreira: Cientista de Dados - São Paulo(SP) (1293234)
HTML:
Com mais de 60 anos de existência, a Sociedade Beneficente Israelita Brasileira Albert Einstein ainda mantém uma premissa: inovar e crescer, sempre com excelência. Ajudamos a salvar vidas, difundir o conhecimento em educação, prevenção e inovação em saúde. Além da atuação em setores assistenciais, temos oportunidades na área de Inovação, Tecnologia, Pesquisa, Ensino, entre outras. Seguimos oferecendo qualidade, afirmando nosso compromisso com a Responsabilidade Social e com o propósito de levar uma gota de Einstein para cada cidadão. Valorizamos a diversidade e inclusão de todos os talentos e buscamos profissionais que compartilhem deste mesmo propósito!

Informações da Vaga

  • Unidade: Morumbi - São Paulo (SP)
  • Área: CIA
  • Horário 08:00-17:00 2ª/6ª
  • Modelo de Trabalho: Híbrido
  • Contrato: CLT Prazo Indeterminado

Responsabilidades

  • Tratar, transformar e organizar dados (estruturados, semi-estruturados ou não-estruturados), com uso de habilidades em matemática, estatística, programação, machine learning e outros, aplicando suas capacidades analíticas para identificar soluções para os problemas de negócios e contribuir na tomada de decisões e estratégias da sociedade;
  • Explorar e analisar dados para determinar tendências e ou oportunidades para gerar valor ao negócio;
  • Desenvolver novos algoritmos e/ou adaptar algoritmos do estado da arte para resolver problemas e criar ferramentas e soluções;
  • Conectar soluções internas para produtos de uso externo;
  • Comunicar de maneira clara previsões e resultados para as áreas demandantes, através de visualizações de dados eficazes e storytelling, adotando gráficos, tabelas, relatórios e, principalmente, narrativas para apresentar conclusões de um projeto de análise de dados para um público não técnico;
  • Utilizar os dados de forma ética e de acordo com as políticas de segurança da informação da instituição e da lei geral de proteção de dados;
  • Atuar como referência técnica de seu grupo de trabalho, direcionando e acompanhando as atividades.

Requisitos

  • Formação Superior Completa;
  • Experiência em projetos utilizando Machine Learning e Deep learning;
  • Conhecimento de Modelagem para predição e simulação de dados;
  • Conhecimento de métodos para simulação de cenários de múltiplas variáveis (especialmente o método de Monte Carlo );
  • Experiência com projetos de IA Generativa;
  • Experiência em tópicos de Engenharia de prompt, LLM Agents, RAG, LangChain e AWS Bedrock;
  • Experiências com projetos de IA e protótipos orientado a produtos;
  • Conhecimento de conceitos de gestão de projetos (metodologia ágil, scrum, PMBOK, entre outros);
  • Nível de inglês avançado.

Desejável/Diferencial

  • Conhecimento do método Monte-Carlo Markov Chain;
  • Experiência com modelos de cálculo de risco;
  • Conhecimento em MLOps;
  • Mestrado/Doutorado em ciência de dados/IA;
  • Conhecimento em Cloud (AWS e ou Databrics);
  • Experiência em gestão de produtos digitais;
  • Conhecimento de R.

Soft Skils

  • Comunicação (oral e escrita) assertiva;
  • Capacidade de trabalhar em equipe, bom relacionamento interpessoal e comprometido com as metas e valores da sociedade;
  • Visão sistêmica;
  • Resiliência;
  • Capacidade em conectar tendência de mercado com soluções internas;
  • Análise de Dados com foco em Produto;
  • Proatividade;
  • Cultura de incentivar e dar feedback;
  • Liderança.

Einstein Benefícios – Compartilhando Bem-Estar

  • Cuidados com a saúde: Programa Cuidar com serviços realizados no Einstein para promover a saúde e bem-estar dos colaboradores e dependentes, Clínicas Einstein, Telemedicina, Convênio Farmácia, Convênio Médico, Assistência Odontológica e Consultório Dental in Company.
  • Bem-Estar: Wellhub (Gympass), TotalPass, Coral, Programa de Orientação Pessoal e SESC.
  • Para você e sua família: Licença paternidade estendida, Seguro de Vida, Creche ou Auxílio Creche para mães ou pais com guarda legal, Auxílio para Filhos com Deficiência e Previdência Privada com taxa zero.
  • Alimentação: Vale Alimentação, Vale Refeição ou Refeitório no local de trabalho.
  • Mobilidade: Vale Transporte, Fretado, Estacionamento, Aplicativo de Caronas e Circular Metrô.
  • Clube de Benefícios: Para economizar e obter vantagens nas compras de produtos e serviços de diversas categorias, como Beleza e Fitness, Comer e Beber, Compras, Cultura e Lazer, Educação Ensino Einstein, Turismo e muito mais.
  • Programa Mais Conectados: Trabalho remoto nas modalidades Teletrabalho ou Híbrido conforme atividade e área de atuação.
  • Os benefícios podem sofrer alteração de acordo com a convenção coletiva, unidade de trabalho e políticas vigentes.

Title: Cientista de Dados (Projetos IA)
Description:
A Omie tem como propósito trazer prosperidade para o ecossistema empreendedor brasileiro. Por isso, buscamos por pessoas com mentalidade de crescimento, valorizando perfis que tenham capacidade de adaptação, senso colaborativo e sejam motivadas pela inovação e pelo aprendizado contínuo.

Faça parte da história de uma das empresas de tecnologia que mais cresce no país! 🚀

#VempraOmie

Responsabilidades e atribuições


Aplicar e desenvolver algoritmos de Ciência de Dados, Machine Learning e Inteligência Artificial com foco em soluções para otimizar iniciativas de gestão de pessoas;
Avaliar o uso e implantação de ferramentas de IA/ML terceiras para soluções de demandas de RH;
Monitorar, avaliar e garantir a manutenção e sustentação das soluções de IA/ML utilizadas pelo RH.
Acompanhar tendências de mercado em soluções de RH e sugerir otimizações relacionadas à jornada dos colaboradores, utilizando inteligência artificial com base nos KPIs monitorados pelo time de People Analytics.
Estabelecer a interlocução e alinhar as expectativas entre as áreas de negócios e tecnologia.



Requisitos e qualificações


Necessário experiência em Ciência de Dados, Machine Learning e Inteligência Artificial;
Conhecimentos em ferramentas de Visualização de Dados;
Conhecimento de programação em SQL, Python e/ou R;
Conhecimento em Processamento de Linguagem Natural e LLMs;
Conhecimento em MLOps e CI/CD;
Ter experiência com Metodologias Ágeis é um diferencial;
Ter experiência com soluções AWS é um diferencial;
Ter conhecimento nas áreas de RH e ter experiência com soluções de IA/ML para RH é um grande diferencial;
Boa capacidade de comunicação, para dialogar com stakeholders técnicos e não técnicos.



Informações adicionais

Benefício Flexível/VR: R$ 40,00/dia útil.

Auxílio-escritório e Auxílio Home office para você melhorar o seu ambiente de trabalho remoto e torná-lo ainda mais confortável.

Precisa trabalhar presencialmente? Nós temos vale-transporte. E para você que vem de trem/metrô disponibilizamos um fretado na estação para deslocamento até o escritório.

Plano de saúde Bradesco.

Plano odontológico Amil Dental.

Auxílio Farmácia.

Auxílio-creche.

Day off de aniversário, para você comemorar como quiser!

Para manter a saúde e o bem-estar físico em dia, contamos com Apps parceiros de academias credenciadas.

Para relaxar e cuidar da saúde mental, temos parcerias com plataformas de terapia e meditação online.

Parceria com o SESC - Credencial Plena

Descontos exclusivos nas melhores faculdades e instituições de ensino, voltados para cursos de graduação, pós-graduação e MBA. Além de disponibilizarmos o Omie Academy gratuito para colaboradores.

Parceria com cursos de English in Company.

Programa de descontos em seguros.

Empréstimo consignado via Ali Crédito.

Swile Shop: plataforma de descontos exclusivos.

Parceria com a Dell: cupons de até R$ 2.000,00.

PPRL.

Global Pass: benefício de viagens.

Seguro de vida.

Title: Cientista de Dados Jr - Vaga Afirmativa para Mulheres
Description:
O time de Data Science do Magalu está à procura de Cientista de Dados para nos ajudar a desenvolver soluções analíticas para diversos problemas de negócios (relacionados a fraude, projeção de demanda, precificação, sortimento, marketing, logística, investimentos, entre outros), utilizando técnicas de Machine Learning e Inteligência Artificial.




Entendimento das necessidades de negócios.
Criação de hipóteses para solução dos problemas de negócio em questão.
Realização de análises descritivas, diagnósticas, preditivas e/ou prescritivas.
Criação de modelos estatísticos / de machine learning e otimizadores.
Identificação, recomendação e implementação de oportunidades de melhoria relacionadas aos problemas de negócio abordados.
Criação de métricas e acompanhamento de performance das soluções criadas, buscando melhorias contínuas.
Exposição / apresentação dos trabalhos realizados e resultados obtidos para as áreas de negócio e executivos da empresa.




Precisamos que você já tenha:
Graduação completa.
Conhecimento em linguagens de programação (ex: C, Python, Java, R, etc)
Aptidão e interesse em programação; Interesse por Ciência de Dados.
Conhecimentos e experiência em Data Science (ex: Regressões, Classificações, segmentações, etc.)
Experiência em modelagem de dados.
Visão de negócios; Alta capacidade de comunicação.
Facilidade em trabalhar em times / engajar com pares e parceiros de negócios.
Será incrível se você tiver:
'Conhecimentos em estatística.
Conhecimento de ferramentas de Big Data (e.g., Hadoop, Hive e Spark)
Portfólio de projetos relacionados à Ciência de Dados (Github, Kaggle etc.)
Experiência na área
Local: Vila Guilherme | SP

Title: Python Developer
HTML:
Enabling What’s Next


Who We Are😎

Born in 2004 as Techedge, we have almost 20 years of expertise that enabled us to become what we are today: Avvale!

This path led us to be able to count on over 3,500 employees, present in 12 countries around the world.


What We Do🌱

We help public and private companies to re-design their business models through the development of innovative and sustainable solutions, which have a positive impact not only on our customers but also on the world we live in!


How we do💡

Through circular economy models, made possible thanks to technological innovation.


What you will find 🔍

In Avvale we value our talents and your path with us will be full of:

Flexibility, thanks to our policy you can work remotely in Italy, up to 5 days a week, and in SEE and Switzerland up to 5 months a year;

Training & development as you can participate to training on the job, certifications, foreign languages classes and you will have a yearly budget to buy training courses;

Gender equality & inclusion, the obtaining of Pdr 125 is a proof of Avvale commitment to an inclusive and fair work environment!


Role and responsibilities🎯

You will be part of the practice “Mobile & Cloud”, an area that takes care of analysis, design and implementation of enterprise solutions based on the newest technologies. The team works primarily from home, thanks to our smart working policy.


Cloud architectures and services will be a big focus of the team activities, and you will be required to keep up with the technical evolution of the cloud platforms and stacks as a point of reference for the team of developers. Studying and following certification paths will be encouraged and supported greatly.


Required Skills🛹

  • Have 3 to 8 years of relevant work experience;
  • Minimum 3 years' relevant experience with Python programming language;
  • Consolidated experience in cloud-based projects;
  • Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks effectively;
  • Good knowledge of english;
  • Familiarity with server-side MVC web frameworks;
  • Experience in building and designing a relational database (MySQL, SQL Server or Oracle);
  • Flexibility and good communication skills.


Preferred Skills

  • Expertise with cloud technologies (Azure, AWS, GCP);
  • Knowledge of Flask and/or FastAPI;
  • Experience in working with Docker, Kubernates and other container-based solutions;
  • Have a Bachelor or Master Degree in Computer Science, Computer Science Engineering or in other scientific disciplines ;
  • Ability to review requirements and translate them into efficient applications and architecture.


Come with us💪

Send us your resume and have a look at our website to learn more!


We do not consider applications without CV.


This announcement is aimed at candidates of both sexes (L. 903/77).

Title: Postdoctoral Researcher
Description:
Location

This position is for a researcher to be involved with the activities of the Biometrics and Multimedia Forensics (BioMedia4n6) laboratory of Roma Tre University, Rome, Italy (https://biomedia4n6.uniroma3.it).

It is expected to have on-site interactions, with the possibility to work remotely for some periods.

 

Description

This position involves collaborative research in signal processing with specific emphasis on physiological data.

Biometric recognition is expected to represent a prominent field of application. Competences on artificial Intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML) methodologies are needed to handle the expected research tasks.

Data collectable through wearable devices have to be treated in order to extract information allowing to perform estimates on the healt status of a subject, as well as discriminative characteristics allowing the identification or verification of the identity of their owner. Techniques employed to acquire the interested data include electrocardiography (ECG), electroencephalography (EEG), photopletismography (PPG), seismocardiography (SCG), and so on.

Emphasis will be given to developing and evaluating biometric systems operating continuously.

 

Responsibilities

Candidates must be highly motivated and creative individuals with a research experience fields such as electronic engineering, computer science, telecommunications, and similar. They must also be goal-oriented, self-reliant, and capable of working independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced research setting.

The candidate must design and apply artificial intelligence and machine learning approaches tailored to physiological signals acquired using wearable devices such as ECG, EEG, PPG, etc.

 

Qualifications

The candidate must have research signal processing experience, with specific emphasis on the research topics proposed in this call. The candidate should also have strong programming skills in Matlab and/or Python (preferable), practical written and oral communication skills in English, and publication records in relevant areas.

 

Salary

This position is for twelve months (expected to start around April 2025).

Gross salary is about 27k€ per year.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
HTML:
Siamo una Data Driven Transformation & Consulting Company specializzata nel gestire e trasformare il più importante asset del mercato odierno: I Dati.

Grazie ad oltre 20 anni di esperienza e 500 dipendenti divisi in 4 sedi (Bologna HQ, Milano, Roma e Napoli) supportiamo l’evoluzione di grandi gruppi italiani operanti in tutti i principali settori, dal bancario al manifatturiero, passando per il Fashion, il Retail, l’Energy e le Telco senza dimenticare le grandi pubbliche amministrazioni centrali.

Il nostro portfolio progetti spazia da servizi di Advisory quali la realizzazione di Data Strategy fino ad attività di implementazione con il design e la realizzazione di soluzioni di Business Analytics, Big Data Platform & Artificial Intelligence.

Siamo un’azienda dinamica, con un Dna che si è plasmato in questi anni grazie al fatto di aver coltivato oltre l’80% delle nostre risorse dall’università, e in continua trasformazione così come il mercato in cui operiamo e del quale siamo fra i player più riconosciuti e grandi del panorama italiano.

Posizione:

Come Senior Data Scientist, entrerai a far parte del team Innovation dedicato ad AI/ML per il supporto dall’ideazione e allo sviluppo di progetti che integrano tecnologie di AI/ML a supporto dei diversi processi di business. Lavorerai in una realtà con elevata expertise, caratterizzata da un team giovane e fortemente inclusivo.

In particolare, il Senior Data Scientist si occuperà di:

  • Progettare e realizzare soluzioni di Advanced Analytics end-to-end: dalla comprensione dell’esigenza di business alla comunicazione efficace dei risultati di analisi e alla industrializzazione;
  • Progettare e sviluppare soluzioni di ML/DeepL/Gen AI per i clienti;
  • Supportare nella fase di prevendita e nella risposta a gare;
  • Collaborare con il team di progetto e con gli stakeholder aziendali per integrare i modelli e le soluzioni nei sistemi di produzione;
  • Proporre e implementare approcci metodologici avanzati di data science anche in collaborazione con enti di ricerca esterni;
  • Formare e sviluppare profili junior contribuendo alla crescita complessiva dei team di delivery.

Requisiti:

  • PHD e/o Laurea magistrale in materie scientifiche: Informatica ed Ingegneria, Statistica, Matematica, Fisica e Economia;
  • Almeno 6 anni di esperienza in posizione analoga, sarà considerato preferenziale se in contesto consulenziale. L’esperienza a livello internazionale sarà considerata un plus;
  • Conoscenza avanzata di linguaggi quali Python e R;
  • Comprovata conoscenza dei modelli di ML/DeepL/AI;
  • Esperienza in progettazione e sviluppo di soluzioni di Machine Learning e analisi dati per i clienti;
  • Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese (almeno B2);
  • Ottime capacità comunicative anche verso stakeholder non tecnici;
  • Ottime capacità di astrazione;
  • Mentalità orientata al fare, con una forte attenzione alla collaborazione e al lavoro di squadra;
  • Capacità di gestire le priorità, organizzare e gestire efficacemente il flusso di lavoro.

Ricerchiamo persone che, oltre alle qualità tecniche, abbiano una forte motivazione, una grande passione per l'innovazione e per le tecnologie, spiccate doti comunicative, e che si distinguano per entusiasmo, impegno, spirito di iniziativa e visione futura.

Altre informazioni:

Cosa offriamo ai candidati?

Ai candidati selezionati verrà offerto un percorso di sviluppo di carriera e crescita strutturato per obiettivi, con processi formativi sia in ambito tech sia in ambito soft skills.

Nel pacchetto retributivo sono compresi assicurazione medica integrativa, welfare, buoni pasto, convenzioni dipendenti usufruibili su tutto il territorio nazionale, dotazioni integrative per lo smart working.

Sede di inserimento

Tutte le principali sedi in Italia dove Iconsulting è presente, come: Bologna, Roma, Milano, Napoli.

Inquadramento: contratto a tempo indeterminato

Perché scegliere Iconsulting?

Together we spark!

Lavorare in Iconsulting è un percorso di crescita sfidante e motivante. Crediamo in un modello di collaborazione in cui instaurare un rapporto duraturo di fiducia con i nostri collaboratori e clienti. Potrai lavorare in modo flessibile e per obiettivi grazie a una politica consolidata di lavoro Agile, vivendo le tue giornate lavorative in spazi aziendali moderni e accoglienti.

I candidati ambosessi (D.lgs. n. 198/2006) sono invitati ad inviare il curriculum comprensivo di autorizzazione al trattamento dei dati personali ai sensi dell’art. 13 del Decreto Legislativo 30 giugno 2003, n. 196 “Codice in materia di protezione dei dati personali” e dell’art. 13 del GDPR (Regolamento UE 2016/679).

Title: Software Developer
HTML:
About us:

Founded on the dream and insight of three sports journalists in 1945, Sisal was the first Italian company to operate in the gaming and betting industry as a government licensee.

Sisal is now part of Flutter Entertainment plc, the world’s largest online sports betting and gaming operator with a portfolio of globally recognized brands and a constituent of the FTSE 100 index of the London Stock Exchange.

The company’s commitment to building a more responsible future rests on a sustainability strategy with long-term objectives to affirm Sisal as a leader in Responsible Gaming, an innovative and sustainable company and an exemplary work environment.

What you’ll do:

  • You will join the team You will join the team of Player Account Manager platform and in particular in the Business Management ICT/Digital Factory, reporting directly to Architecture Associate Manager;
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in PAM project for software devolpment and technical analisys activites for all the brands managed by Sisal digital assets.

Who you are:

  • You have at least 3 years of experience in Java/Spring;
  • You have a degree in Computer Science or Tech subjects or equivalent job experience;
  • You have excellent knowledge of Java >= 11; Spring framework/Spring boot/Hibernate/JPA;
  • You are proficient in English and Italian, both spoken and written;
  • You know basic concepts of networking; you’re familiar with cloud computing and kubernetes orchestrator clusters usage;
  • You are familiar with team working and available for quick transfers;
  • You have expertise in secure code development.

Preferrably, you also have:

  • Previous experience in Message broker technologies such as Apache Kafka;
  • Basic knowledge of Betting and/or gambling markets concepts and rules and/or Payment gateways integrations.

What we offer you/you can expect from us:

  • Permanent contract;
  • Hybrid work;
  • An inclusive place to work;
  • Company-Owned Devices: laptop and business mobile phone;
  • Meal Allowance;
  • Supplemental Health Insurance.

Looking for a role that can support your learning and career goals:

  • Psychological well-being: online meditation courses, medical online service, counselling service thanks to the support of certified psychologists and coaches;
  • Continuous learning for soft and hard skills (es. learning platform; managerial learning) to be fully exploited thanks to FlexiLearning, which allows you to dedicate at least 4 hours per month for your professional growth;
  • Support for parents, children and financial aid for mothers;
  • Volunteering during your working hours.

Location: Italy, Rome, Viale Sacco e Vanzetti, 89.

Equal Opportunity

Sisal is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Diversity and Inclusion are fundamental values for us. We welcome any candidate without distinction of sex, age, culture, religion, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression.

Title: Tester Junior
Description:
Tester

Roma, Area IT

Descrizione

Benvenuto in Medialogic S.p.A.! System Integrator nella progettazione e realizzazione di soluzioni informatiche avanzate, sviluppiamo un'offerta integrata di servizi, consulenza e competenza tecnologica, oltre a prodotti software proprietari. La nostra Mission è quella di instaurare una salda relazione con i Clienti stimolando sempre più il loro potenziale, comprendendo le loro esigenze e supportandoli nell’approccio alle tecnologie. Poniamo soluzioni ad alta efficacia, mediante Persone, processi e tecnologie, che siano fruibili anche in futuro. Traiamo la nostra forza principale dalle Persone, quindi le conoscenze, le esperienze, le abilità e il talento dei dipendenti sono il motore dell’azienda che crea le condizioni per il raggiungimento degli obiettivi aziendali.

Cosa Chiediamo a Chi Si Unisce a Noi

Almeno 2 anni di esperienza come Tester nella creazione di test list, analisi requisiti, pianificazione ed esecuzione di test (manuali, integrazione, regressione, stress, performance ecc. su diverse piattaforme).

Nice to have

Certificazioni coerenti alla esperienza e tecnologie utilizzate.

corsi di formazione e certificazioni su tecnologie specifiche
welfare aziendale
buoni pasto giornalieri

Title: Coder
Description:
Outlier aiuta le aziende più innovative del mondo a migliorare i loro modelli di intelligenza artificiale fornendo feedback umano. Sei un ingegnere del software esperto che vorrebbe mettere a disposizione la propria competenza in programmazione per addestrare modelli di IA?

Collaboriamo con organizzazioni per addestrare grandi modelli linguistici di IA, aiutando i modelli generativi avanzati a scrivere codice migliore. I progetti generalmente includono problemi discreti e altamente variabili, che richiedono di interagire con questi modelli mentre apprendono la programmazione. Non è richiesta alcuna esperienza precedente con l'IA.

Informazioni Sull’opportunità

Outlier è alla ricerca di programmatori talentuosi per contribuire al training di modelli di intelligenza artificiale generativa.

Questa opportunità freelance è completamente remota e offre orari flessibili, permettendoti di lavorare quando ti è più comodo.

Come Puoi Contribuire


Creando e rispondendo a domande relative all'informatica per aiutare a formare i modelli di IA.
Valutando e classificando il codice generato dai modelli di IA.


Esempi Di Competenze Desiderate


Essere attualmente iscritto o aver completato una laurea triennale o superiore in informatica presso un'istituzione rinomata.
Competenza in uno o più dei seguenti linguaggi di programmazione: Java, Python, JavaScript / TypeScript, C++, Swift, Verilog.
Capacità di spiegare concetti complessi in modo fluente in italiano.
Eccellente attenzione ai dettagli, compresi grammatica, punteggiatura e linee guida stilistiche.


Pagamento


Attualmente, le tariffe orarie per il lavoro su progetti principali eseguito da esperti di programmazione variano tra $25 e $50 USD.
Le tariffe possono variare in base alle competenze, alla valutazione delle abilità, alla posizione, alle necessità del progetto e ad altri fattori. Ad esempio, tariffe più elevate possono essere offerte a chi possiede un dottorato di ricerca. Per lavori non principali, come la fase di onboarding iniziale o il lavoro straordinario, possono essere applicate tariffe inferiori. Alcuni progetti offrono anche incentivi economici. Ti invitiamo a consultare i termini di pagamento specifici per ogni progetto.


PLEASE NOTE: We collect, retain and use personal data for our professional business purposes, including notifying you of opportunities that may be of interest and sharing with our affiliates. We limit the personal data we collect to that which we believe is appropriate and necessary to manage applicants’ needs, provide our services, and comply with applicable laws. Any information we collect in connection with your application will be treated in accordance with the Outlier Privacy Policy and our internal policies and programs designed to protect personal data.

This is a 1099 contract opportunity on the Outlier.ai platform. Because this is a freelance opportunity, we do not offer internships, sponsorship, or employment. You must be authorized to work in your country of residence. If you are an international student, you may be able to sign up for Outlier if you are on a visa. You should contact your tax and/or immigration advisor with specific questions regarding your circumstances.
Show more

Title: DevOps Engineer
Description:
Cyber Guru, con oltre 1.000.000 di utenti attivi nelle sue piattaforme, è il fornitore leader di Cyber Security Awareness Training nell'Europa meridionale. La nostra missione è quella di dotare i dipendenti delle conoscenze e delle competenze necessarie per riconoscere e contrastare le minacce informatiche, garantendo una solida cultura della sicurezza all'interno delle organizzazioni. Le nostre soluzioni vengono fornite tramite un modello Software-as-a-Service (SaaS), fornendo programmi di formazione scalabili e accessibili.




Stiamo cercando un DevOps Engineer motivato e con esperienza. Il candidato ideale ha una solida esperienza nella gestione di infrastrutture AWS e nel mantenimento di sistemi on-premise.




Come DevOps Engineer ti assicurerai che il nostro prodotto SaaS basato su AWS sia affidabile, sicuro e ad alte prestazioni, supportando anche gli ambienti on-premise. Se sei appassionato di ottimizzazione dei sistemi e hai una profonda conoscenza di AWS e dell'architettura a microservizi è il ruolo che fa per te!




Competenze richieste:

Infrastruttura AWS:

Conoscenza approfondita dei servizi AWS, inclusi EC2, RDS, S3, Lambda, CloudFront, VPC, IAM e strumenti correlati.
Esperienza nella progettazione, implementazione e gestione di soluzioni scalabili, altamente disponibili e tolleranti ai guasti su AWS.
Capacità di ottimizzare i costi AWS monitorando e adattando le risorse alle esigenze aziendali.




Ambienti on-premise:

Esperienza pratica nella configurazione, gestione e manutenzione di server Linux.
Eccellente padronanza nell'accesso e nell'amministrazione di sistemi tramite SSH.
Competenza nella creazione di script, in particolare con Bash, per automatizzare le operazioni e gestire ambienti on-premise.
Capacità di troubleshooting e problem-solving in ambienti on-premise.




Microservizi e orchestrazione:

Esperienza comprovata nella progettazione, implementazione e gestione di architetture a microservizi.
Conoscenza avanzata di Kubernetes, incluse le best practice per il deployment, il monitoraggio e la scalabilità dei servizi.
Familiarità con piattaforme di messaggistica come Kafka e gestione di flussi di dati in tempo reale ad alta disponibilità.




Database:

Esperienza approfondita con sistemi di gestione database come MySQL, PostgreSQL e MongoDB.
Competenza nella diagnosi e risoluzione di problemi di performance dei database.
Abilità nell'ottimizzazione delle query, gestione dei backup e ripristino.




Automazione e Continuous Integration:

Esperienza con strumenti di automazione come Terraform, Ansible o Puppet.
Familiarità con piattaforme CI/CD come Jenkins, CircleCI o GitLab.




Networking e sicurezza:

Solida comprensione dei principi di networking, inclusi DNS, bilanciamento del carico e firewall.
Esperienza pratica nella configurazione e gestione di soluzioni di sicurezza, monitoraggio e logging.
Conoscenza approfondita dell'integrazione SSO e dei protocolli SAML2 per la gestione di autenticazione e autorizzazione.




Soft Skills:

Attitudine al lavoro di squadra con eccellenti capacità comunicative, in grado di collaborare efficacemente con colleghi di diverse aree funzionali.
Approccio proattivo e orientato alle soluzioni di fronte alle sfide.
Voglia di apprendere continuamente e rimanere aggiornato sulle ultime tecnologie e best practice.
Show more

  • Esperienza comprovata nella progettazione, implementazione e gestione di architetture a microservizi.
  • Conoscenza avanzata di Kubernetes, incluse le best practice per il deployment, il monitoraggio e la scalabilità dei servizi.
  • Familiarità con piattaforme di messaggistica come Kafka e gestione di flussi di dati in tempo reale ad alta disponibilità.


Database:

  • Esperienza approfondita con sistemi di gestione database come MySQL, PostgreSQL e MongoDB.
  • Competenza nella diagnosi e risoluzione di problemi di performance dei database.
  • Abilità nell'ottimizzazione delle query, gestione dei backup e ripristino.


Automazione e Continuous Integration:

  • Esperienza con strumenti di automazione come Terraform, Ansible o Puppet.
  • Familiarità con piattaforme CI/CD come Jenkins, CircleCI o GitLab.


Networking e sicurezza:

  • Solida comprensione dei principi di networking, inclusi DNS, bilanciamento del carico e firewall.
  • Esperienza pratica nella configurazione e gestione di soluzioni di sicurezza, monitoraggio e logging.
  • Conoscenza approfondita dell'integrazione SSO e dei protocolli SAML2 per la gestione di autenticazione e autorizzazione.


Soft Skills:

  • Attitudine al lavoro di squadra con eccellenti capacità comunicative, in grado di collaborare efficacemente con colleghi di diverse aree funzionali.
  • Approccio proattivo e orientato alle soluzioni di fronte alle sfide.
  • Voglia di apprendere continuamente e rimanere aggiornato sulle ultime tecnologie e best practice.

Title: Engineering ILP Day - Sapienza
Description:
About Translated

Translated is on a mission to make content in all languages accessible to everyone. We are a technology-powered professional translation provider. We partner with over 180 000 professional translators, i.e. about a third of the translator workforce alive today. Our 140 000 clients range from the private person who needs their CV translated to the very big, like Google and Airbnb.

We have invested over 6 000 000 € in R&D in the past years. Our EU H2020 project Matecat produced the translation GUI which allows our translators to edit sentence translations without having to worry about document layout and formatting at all. With ModernMT, another H2020 project which won an accolade from the EU as one of the 3 best projects of the call, we developed our neural adaptive machine translation technology, which is available open-source on Github. Our research papers and more information about our research activity can be found on our website.

We use AI techniques in several places in our platform. Of course, machine translation is our core enabling technology. Beyond that, we use ML to deal with our massive pool of translators: for instance, assigning an incoming translation job to the best qualified translator available is an algorithmic process which uses matches against the translator's job history, as well as past performance. We also need to rank translators for whom we have no performance data: our algorithms produce estimates based on their CVs.

We would like to make progress in a number of different areas which require AI, ML and data science skills:


marketing: can we predict predict what customer retention activities work best?
NLP: with our millions of translation edits at sentence-level, can we create a linguistically-informed edit distance?
low-resource machine translation: out of the 140 languages we process, most have few NLP resources, and translation models have a hard job. How can we improve this, for instance with transfer learning or language similarity?
probabilistic modelling: Tensorflow 2.0 supports Edward; can we probabilistically model in our linguistic QA processes, i.e. translation scoring, quality score prediction etc.?
information extraction: can we do form-filling to set up translation jobs from email requests? That implies extracting source and target language, count words on documents, understand the domain.


Do you think you can help us with this? If yes, write to us, and we'll build a project for your internship.

Headquarter (Rome - Italy)

Translated is hosted at Pi Campus, a working environment immersed in nature where 5 luxury villas have been converted into functional offices to foster talent growth. Pi Campus is also a venture firm created by Translated to reinvest part of its profits into promising AI startups.

Benefits And Perks


Gym
Swimming Pool
Kickboxing, water aerobics, fitness and Pilates classes
Table Tennis and Football table
Kitchen and snacks


Diversity statement

At Translated, we proudly embrace and celebrate each individual's unique qualities to our team, regardless of race, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other differences. We recognize that these diverse perspectives empower us to overcome challenges, foster innovation, and drive excellence. As an inclusive and equal-opportunity employer, we are committed to cultivating an environment where everyone feels welcome, valued, and supported to achieve their full potential.

Privacy Policy
Show more

Title: Neolaureati/Laureandi STEM
HTML:
L'esperienza e le abilità che ti rendono la persona giusta:

  • Laurea in materie scientifiche tra cui: Informatica, Ingegneria Informatica, Ingegneria delle Telecomunicazioni, Matematica, Fisica, Statistica, Ingegneria Gestionale, Economia e simili.
  • Conoscenza di uno o più linguaggi di programmazione tra cui: Python, Node.js, React, Angular;
  • Abilità comprovate tramite l'impegno in progetti personali e/o partecipazione attiva a progetti open source (es. sviluppo applicazioni web/mobile);
  • Buona conoscenza della lingua Inglese;
  • Capacità di lavorare in gruppo e di gestione del tempo;
  • Intraprendenza, innata curiosità ed intuito;

Mindset.

Le persone che lavorano con noi non sono “dipendenti”, sono talenti che contribuiscono, ciascuno nel proprio settore, alla creazione di un luogo senza confini spaziali e mentali, dove aspirazioni, obiettivi, entusiasmi e strategie si fondono in un percorso virtuoso di evoluzione condivisa, per crescere ed esprimere il massimo del proprio potenziale.

Il gruppo Symphonie ha creato un ambiente di lavoro in cui ogni persona ha la possibilità di esprimere e sviluppare le proprie potenzialità a pieno.

Promuoviamo l'indifferenza di genere, età, cultura, lingua, religione, idee politiche, orientamento sessuale, abilità psicofisiche, condizioni personali e sociali, mettendo in primo piano le persone, i loro meriti, le loro abilità e la loro passione.

Title: Big Data Engineer for AI Training
Description:
Outlier helps the world’s most innovative companies improve their AI models by providing human feedback. Are you an experienced software engineer who would like to lend your coding expertise to train AI models?

We partner with organizations to train AI large language models, helping cutting-edge generative AI models write better code. Projects typically include discrete, highly variable problems that involve engaging with these models as they learn to code. There is no requirement for previous AI experience.

About The Opportunity


Outlier is looking for talented coders to help train generative artificial intelligence models
This freelance opportunity is remote and hours are flexible, so you can work whenever is best for you


You may contribute your expertise by…


Crafting and answering questions related to computer science in order to help train AI models
Evaluating and ranking code generated by AI models


Examples Of Desirable Expertise


Currently enrolled in or completed a bachelor's degree or higher in computer science at a selective institution
Proficiency working with one or more of the the following languages: Java, Python, JavaScript / TypeScript, C++, Swift, and Verilog
Ability to articulate complex concepts fluently in Italian
Excellent attention to detail, including grammar, punctuation, and style guidelines


Payment


Currently, pay rates for core project work by coding experts range from USD $25 to $50 per hour.
Rates vary based on expertise, skills assessment, location, project need, and other factors. For example, higher rates may be offered to PhDs. For non-core work, such as during initial project onboarding or project overtime phases, lower rates may apply. Certain projects offer incentive payments. Please review the payment terms for each project.


PLEASE NOTE: We collect, retain and use personal data for our professional business purposes, including notifying you of opportunities that may be of interest and sharing with our affiliates. We limit the personal data we collect to that which we believe is appropriate and necessary to manage applicants’ needs, provide our services, and comply with applicable laws. Any information we collect in connection with your application will be treated in accordance with the Outlier Privacy Policy and our internal policies and programs designed to protect personal data.

This is a 1099 contract opportunity on the Outlier.ai platform. Because this is a freelance opportunity, we do not offer internships, sponsorship, or employment. You must be authorized to work in your country of residence. If you are an international student, you may be able to sign up for Outlier if you are on a visa. You should contact your tax and/or immigration advisor with specific questions regarding your circumstances.

Title: Solution Developer Heroku
Description:
DPWAY S.r.l.,società con esperienza decennale in soluzioni e servizi nellambito dellInformation & Communication Technology, sta cercando per ampliamento organico:

Solution Developer Heroku

Il candidato ideale ha almeno 3 anni di esperienza, possiede conoscenze e competenze verticali nellutilizzo della piattaforma PaaS Heroku con focus su scalabilità, integrazione di database, utilizzo di add-ons e automazione tramite la CLI; nella gestione della sicurezza, monitoraggio e CI/CD per ottimizzare il ciclo di vita delle applicazioni.
